Marjorie R., 25 years old, is a retailer of beverages on the island of Nocnocan. She has two children, the eldest child being two years old while the youngest is only one. She started her business in 2007 and she is still selling beverages because it is a very good business.

Marjorie would like to apply for a loan of Php 8,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. to buy more beverages to sell. She will also use some of the loan to buy batteries to sell to the pump boat (an outrigger canoe powered by a small gasoline or diesel engine) operators on their island.

loans.use: To buy additional merchandise like batteries and beverages

loans.name: Aissa

texts.fr:
Cette jeune femme a appris le métier de la couture, elle a ouvert sa propre boutique qu’elle a appelé « COUTURE AICHA BEL AVENIR » en 2007 elle a décidé d’associer à son commerce la vente de pagnes et de tissus bazins. Ce commerce lui réussit bien, elle veut agrandir son commerce, elle sollicite alors de WAGES un crédit pour l’achat de lots de pagnes et de tissus bazins.
Etant célibataire, c’est avec le revenu de ce commerce qu’elle subvient  à ses propres besoins.
texts.en:
This is a woman who was trained as a seamstress, and she opened her own store that she called « COUTURE AICHA BEL AVENIR ». In 2007, she decided to also start selling pagnes (colorful African cloth) and Bazin fabrics. This business is successful to her, and she wants to expand it. She's therefore seeking a loan from Kiva's partner, WAGES, in order to buy batches of pagnes and Bazin fabrics. Being unmarried, she uses the income drawn from this business to provide for herself.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy batches of pagnes (colorful African cloth) and Bazin fabrics

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
Fatima is a 47-year-old woman who hails from Estako in Edo State. She is married and blessed with a 14-year-old child. She sells sand, which is used for building houses. From the income in her business, she pays her child's school fees, caters to her pressing needs, and supports her husband. 

She hopes to expand her business and is therefore, humbly requesting a loan of NGN150,000 to enable her to purchase more sand to sell. She expresses her profound appreciation to all Kiva lenders for their kind support.

loans.use: To purchase more sand to sell.

loans.name: Ablanvi

texts.fr: Cette femme âgée de 43 ans, est née dans la ville d’Aneho au sud  du Togo, aujourd’hui elle est mariée et vit dans le quartier de bé kpota, elle a un enfant. En 2006 elle s’est lancée dans la vente de bijoux, elle exerce ce commerce au grand marché de Lomé où cette activité est très développée, voulant grandir son commerce elle s’est approchée de WAGES pour solliciter un crédit pour l’achat de divers bijoux afin de bien satisfaire ses clients.
texts.en:
This 43-year old lady was born in the town of Aneho in the south of Togo. Today she is married and lives in the Bé Kpota neighbourhood; she has one child. In 2006 she started selling jewelry and she carries out this business at the large market in Lomé where it is very developed. In order to expand her business she has approached WAGES to apply for a loan for the purchase of various items of jewelry in order to satisfy customer demand.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of jewelry

loans.name: Silvia Gabriela

texts.es:
Doña Silvia Gabriela O. habita en Chichigalpa en un barrio que se llama el pueblito, este barrio es uno de los más antiguos de este pueblo, su dirección es frente a la Iglesia de El Pueblito, también una de las Iglesias más antiguas, ella es una señora muy dispuesta al trabajo y a la superación, es casada, tiene 40 años de edad, tiene tres hijos, dos mujeres y un varón, el mayor está en la universidad, la mayor de las dos niñas está en secundaria y la menor en primaria, el marido tiene un bus con el que trabaja para una empresa privada con el cual transporta personal de esta empresa, de esta manera él contribuye con los gastos de la familia. 
Doña Silvia trabaja con la institución desde el año 2004, tiempo en el cual se le han otorgado la cantidad de 34 créditos, demostrando en todo este tiempo mucha responsabilidad con sus obligaciones, estos créditos le han ayudado de gran manera, ya que con ellos poco a poco ha podido ir ampliando su negocio, y a la vez mejorando su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Mrs. Silvia Gabriela O. lives in Chichigalpa in a neighborhood called el pueblito. This neighborhood is one of the oldest in the town. She lives in front of the Church of El Pueblito, also one of the oldest churches. She is a woman who is prepared to work and do better. She is 40 years old, married and has three children, two girls and a boy. The oldest is in college, the oldest girl is in high school and the youngest in grammar school. Her husband has a bus and works for a private company transporting company personnel. He contributes towards family expenses this way. Mrs. Silvia has worked with the institution since 2004. During this time she has received 34 loans and shown she is very responsible with her obligations. These loans have helped her greatly since she has been able to expand her business little by little and at the same time improve her quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Haynes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase Merchandise: Rice, Oil, Sugar, Beans and Cosmetics (Creams, Lipstick, Nail Polish, Eye Shadow, Cases).

loans.name: Tamara

texts.en:
Tamara is married with two grown children. She lives in Melitopol, southern Ukraine.

Tamara sells women’s clothing in one of the local markets of her home town. She has been a market entrepreneur for over sixteen years. Her clothes always come at affordable prices which is a big attraction in times of recession when many customers live on a shoestring. Currently, Tamara has 55,000 Grivnyas invested in inventory. Her income amounts to 10,000 Grivnyas a month.

Tamara is hoping to use the loan of 13,000 Grivnyas to increase her assortment of seasonal merchandise and generate additional income as a result. She is hoping to reinvest a part of her profit into further stable development of her venture. Moreover, she believes financial stability will secure her family’s well-being in this time when everything is so volatile.

loans.use: To purchase additional merchandise

loans.name: Digmelia

texts.es:
Digmelia tiene 47 años, vive con su esposo, quien es profesor, y con sus hijos que ya son independientes, motivo por el cual se dedica a tiempo completo a su negocio.

“Son como mis hijos”, manifiesta cuando ve a los niños que atiende en su guardería y es que se ha encariñado tanto con ellos que los quiere como tales. Ella atiende su guardería desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 6 de la tarde, tiempo en el cual muchas madres le dejan al cuidado de sus hijos por diferentes motivos como trabajo, estudio, etc. Entonces Digmelia, con gran paciencia y dedicación y ayudada por dos jóvenes que trabajan para ella, atiende a los niños instruyéndolos al aprendizaje con diferentes juegos y lecturas que los estimulen. A ella le gusta mucho su trabajo y le encanta realizarlo, es por ello que en un futuro quiere ampliar el espacio de su “Cuna- Escuela” para así poder albergar a mayor cantidad de niños.

Este es el sétimo préstamo de Digmelia con MFP y nunca defraudó a esta institución, por el contrario ha sido muy puntual con cada uno de los pagos. Ahora, con el dinero que solicita comprará algunos materiales que le hacen falta para equipar su guardería y que los niños se sientan más cómodos.
texts.en:
Digmelia, 47, lives with her husband, who is a teacher, and her children, who are now independent; this allows her to focus full-time on her business. "They are like my own children," she states when referring to the children that attend her child care center. This is because she has become so attached to them that she loves them as if they were her own. She tends to the center from 8am until 6pm; a period of time when many mothers leave their children with her to be cared for. They have several reasons for doing so: work, study, etc. So Dogmelia, very patiently and with much dedication, assited by two young employees, tends to the children initiating them into the learning process with various challenging games and readings. She enjoys her work very much and loves doing it. This is why she would like, in the future, to enlarge the space of her "Cuna-Escuela" so that she can house more children. This is Digmelia's 7th loan with MFP; she has never defrauded the institution. On the contrary, she has been very punctual with every one of her payments. Now, with the requested funds, she will buy some materials that she needs for her child care center so that the children will feel more comfortable.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy children's educational materials.

loans.name: Jeannette

texts.fr:
Madame Jeannette M. est une femme mariée de 38 ans qui habite a la cite Ndiobene dans la banlieue de Guediawaye. Elle est membre de l’U-IMCEC depuis juillet 2009. Elle est mère de 6 enfants dont l’âge varie entre 2 et 18 ans. Madame M. fais du mareyage et vend du poisson depuis 5 ans. Ne voulant pas rester inactive,  elle  a pris l’exemple des femmes de son quartier qui exercent cette activité et qui en tire profit. Sa préférence se focalise sur la période de froid ou il y’a plus de poissons. C’est la période la plus favorable aux bénéfices. La rentabilité de son activité primaire lui a permis d’ouvrir un local ou elle exerce la vente de produits cosmétiques. Elle sollicite un crédit de 100 000 frs  destine a l’achat de ces produits en vue de renforcer son activité secondaire. Elle s’adonne aussi à la vente de glace. Le prêt l’aide à augmenter son fond de roulement et à supporter certaines charges de ses enfants. Son souhait le plus ardent est d’ouvrir une buvette chez elle qu’elle va exploiter.
-
texts.en:
Mrs. Jeannette M. is a married woman who is 38 years old and lives in the town of Ndiobène in the Guediawaye suburb. She has been a member of U-IMCEC (a Senegalese association of mutual savings and loans institutions) since July 2009. She has six children, the ages of whom range from two to 18 years old. Mrs. M. is a fish merchant and has been selling fish for five years. Not wanting to remain inactive, she followed the example of other women in her neighborhood who carry out this activity and make a profit from it. She prefers to focus on the cold season when there are more fish. This is the best season to make money. The profitability of her primary acitivity has allowed her to open a shop where she sells cosmetic products. She is applying for a loan of 100,000 francs to buy these products in order to strengthen her secondary activity. She has also taken to selling ice-cream. The loan will allow her to increase her working capital and cover certain expenses relating to her children. She has a burning desire to open and run a refreshment stall at her house.. -

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase of funds

loans.name: Paula Edita

texts.es:
Paula es casada, tiene 46 años de edad y vive junto a su esposo y sus tres hijos en el distrito de Paiján, provincia de Ascope, en la región La Libertad, ubicada a tres horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Desde hace más de tres años tiene instalada en su vivienda una bodega en la cual ofrece a sus clientes productos de primera necesidad y toda clase de abarrotes. Ella nos comenta que su esposo tiene un pequeña panadería y que gracias al dinero que tenían ahorrado pudieron instalar la bodega para ayudarse.

El negocio goza de buena acogida gracias a la calidad de servicio que Paula ofrece a sus clientes. Ella desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de más productos, de modo que pueda satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes, por ello se encuentra solicitando a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.

Paula es una mujer bastante alegre y servicial. Sus vecinos y clientes le tienen mucha estima. Ya ha trabajado anteriormente con Nuestra Institución y ha demostrado ser una cliente puntual y responsable.
texts.en:
Paula is 46 years old and married. She lives with her husband and their three children in the Paiján district, Ascope province, La Libertad region. It is three hours from the city of Chiclayo. For over three years she has had a convenience store set up in her house. She offers her customers basic needs items and all types of groceries. She tells us that her husband has a small bakery. Thanks to the money they had saved, they were able to set up the convenience store to help them. The business is well-received thanks to the quality of service that Paula gives her customers. She wants to expand her business by purchasing more products. That way she will be able to satisfy the customer demand. That is why she is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativea for 2,000 PEN, which will help her achieve her objective. Paula is a very happy and helpful woman. Her neighbors and customers hold her in high esteem. She has worked with our institution before, and she has demonstrated herself to be a punctual and responsible client.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy basic needs products and groceries to expand her business

loans.name: Do Your Best Group

texts.en: Do Your Best is a group of five borrowers led by Lucy B.. She is 54 years old and is a widow with six children aged from 3 to 35 years. Lucy also cares financially for seven of her sisters. She did not have the opportunity to go to school herself due to poverty. Lucy and her family live in Harbel, which is the capital of Margibi County in central Liberia. In the photo, Lucy is the one holding the sign. Lucy's business is the sale of palm oil. She buys her palm oil wholesale and sells retail in the Harbel Market. She has been running this business for fifteen years and hopes to grow her business by getting new customers. Lucy started selling when her husband died in the civil war because there was no one to help her take care of her children. She talks to her customers in a friendly manner in order to encourage them to continue buying from her. She will use this loan to purchase more palm oil. Lucy dreams of giving all of her children a good education. About LEAP: The Local Enterprise Assistance Program (LEAP) is Liberia's largest and oldest continuously operating micro-finance institution with thirteen branches across the country. Founded in 1994, the non-profit organization has survived periods of civil war and severe socio-economic hardship. LEAP seeks to help rebuild post-conflict Liberia through its group and individual loans to micro- and small-scale entrepreneurs, and puts emphasis on lending to women.

loans.use: To purchase more palm oil to sell

loans.name: Carolina

texts.en:
Carolina V. A. is a 42-year-old single mother who lives in San Francisco de Heredia, in the central valley of Costa Rica.

Over the past year, Carolina has worked as a distributor of catalogue products to catalogue vendors in Heredia. The vendors collect orders for clothing and other products from clients in communities throughout Heredia and then purchase products from Carolina in order to distribute them to community members.

The income she generates from sales is the main source of revenue for Carolina and her son. She plans to use this loan to invest in the purchase of catalogue products from a new catalogue company for which she has recently received an influx of orders.

In general, Carolina enjoys a high volume of sales. In a good month she expects to earn 5,100,000 colons; in a bad month, only 1,000,000. Her goal is to expand her business. She says her only obstacle is financial.

The loan consultant who has been working with Carolina describes her as an independent woman with a strong entrepreneurial spirit. Her goal is to expand her business and increase her income so she can pay for some maintenance work to be done on her car and her house.

loans.use: For the purchase of catalogue products to be sold at a later date

loans.name: Joséphine

texts.fr: H. Joséphine  est née en 1978 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin.  Mariée à TOVO Mathieu, un pêcheur, Joséphine  est mère de trois enfants, tous scolarisés. La famille vit ensemble au quartier Agbato à Cotonou et le couple assure ensemble les charges de la famille.  Joséphine  n’a jamais fréquenté l’école.  Il y a 10 ans, Joséphine  s’est mise dans la vente de tissus et des habits pour dames et hommes.   C’est à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin, que Joséphine  s’approvisionne. Joséphine effectue la vente de ses produits par le système de distribution. Joséphine  a déjà obtenu deux crédits à ALIDé, crédits qu’elle a bien remboursés.  Joséphine  sollicite un autre crédit auprès de ALIDé pour renforcer ses activités et mieux satisfaire ses clients.
texts.en:
Joséphine H. was born in 1978 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Bénin. Married to Mathieu TOVO, a fisherman, Joséphine has three children who are all at school. The family lives together in the Agbato district of Cotonou and the couple cover the household expenses between them. Joséphine has never been to school. Ten years ago she started selling fabric and clothes for both women and men. She gets her supplies in Dantokpa, Bénin's international market. Joséphine sells her products through the distribution system. She has already had two loans from ALIDé which she repaid without incident. She is applying for another loan from ALIDé in order to strengthen her business and better satisfy her customers.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fabric and clothes for women and men

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys is a 34-year-old single lady with three children, two of whom attend school. She has been running an embroidery shop for six years.

Gladys was previously employed but currently she is not. Since she joined Faulu Kenya she has learned to manage her business and has gained experience. She hopes to start an embroidery school and increase supplies by opening a branch out of Nairobi.

Gladys has requested a loan of KES 20,000 to buy a sewing machine and embroidery materials. She describes herself as hardworking, focused, and committed to the satisfaction of her customers.

loans.use: To purchase a sewing machine and embroidery materials

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Blessed Family Group

texts.en:
Blessed Family is a group made up of five borrowers led by Amos S.. He is 33 years old, married and has two children, one an infant and the other a six year old who is in the second grade. Amos also takes care of his sister. He was not able to go to university due to lack of funds. 

Amos and his family live in the Cotton Tree Community in Harbel, capital of Margibi County in central Liberia. He makes a living selling dry goods, buying them wholesale and selling them retail in his town. He has been in business for five years, and hopes to expand his operations in the future. 

When he went into business, Amos was worth 3,000 Liberian dollars but by working hard has increased that to 16,000. The main problem he faces is transporting goods from his supplier to his shop.  He has few if any problems selling them once they arrive, because he is known for having reasonable prices. He has applied for this loan to buy more items to sell, including body cream and slippers to wear in the shower.

Amos dreams of having enough money to give his children a good education. In the photo, he is the person holding the sign.

About LEAP:
The Local Enterprise Assistance Program (LEAP) is Liberia's largest and oldest continuously operating microfinance institution, and has 13 branches across the country.  Founded in 1994, the non-profit has survived periods of civil war and severe socio-economic hardship.  LEAP seeks to help rebuild post-conflict Liberia through its group and individual loans to micro- and small-scale entrepreneurs, and puts a special emphasis on lending to women.

loans.use: To buy more body cream and shower slippers.

loans.name: Respe De Romeo Group

texts.en:
The Respe de Romeo Group is excited about receiving their firS.loan from Esperanza. The group has a variety of businesses from selling gas to selling food on the Haitian-Dominican border.  Ghuslene L. is the representative of the group. She is a 33-year-old wife and mother of three children.
Ghuslene is a long-term charcoal maker and seller. Her intereS.in joining Esperanza came from hearing about associates in neighboring towns grateful for the opportunity and increased benefits of having a loan. She says, “There were people who wanted to do business, but needed a little bit of help…Esperanza is helping.” She dreams of being able to grow her business and send her kids to school with greater ease. On behalf of Ghuslene, the Respe de Romeo Group and Esperanza, we thank you for your support.

loans.use: To purchase charcoal and wood

loans.name: Affoussatou

texts.fr: G. Affoussatou est née le 11 mars 1968.  Il y a huit ans que Affoussatou s’est installée à Sodjèatinmè à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin.  Mariée à MOUSTAPHA Wahid, Affoussatou est mère de trois enfants, tous scolarisés.  Affoussatou vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants.  Le couple assure ensemble les charges de la famille.  Affoussatou a fréquenté l’école jusqu’au cours secondaire.  Pour faire face à ses besoins, Affoussatou vend des produits pharmaceutiques à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin.  Affoussatou exerce cette activité depuis 12 ans.  C’est à Promo Pharma qu’elle s’approvisionne.  Affousatou est à son deuxième crédit à ALIDé.  Affousatou a bien remboursé le premier crédit et sollicite un autre crédit pour renforcer son activité et pour augmenter son profit.
texts.en:
Affoussatou G. was born on 11th March 1968. Eight years ago she settled in Sodjèatinmè in Cotonou, the economic capital of Bénin. Married to Wahid MOUSTAPHA, Affoussatou has three children, all of whom are at school. She lives with her husband and her children. The couple cover the household expenses between them. Affoussatou attended school until secondary level. In order to provide for her needs, she sells pharmaceutical products in Dantokpa, Bénin's international market. She has been carrying out this activity for 12 years. She gets her supplies at Promo Pharma. Affoussatou is on her second loan from ALIDé. She repaid the first loan without problem and is applying for another loan to strengthen her business and increase her profit.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of pharmaceutical products

loans.name: Primitiva

texts.es:
Primitiva tiene 60 años de edad, es casado y vive junto a su esposa y el ultimo de sus tres hijos en el distrito de Paiján, provincia de Ascope, en la región La Libertad, ubicada a tres horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se ha dedicado a la venta de jugos de fruta desde hace más de 20 años. El ofrece sus jugos durante todo el año desde las seis de la mañana hasta las dos de la tarde en un pequeño puedo ubicado cerca al centro de la ciudad. El negocio le ayuda a solventar los gastos familiares.

El negocio de Primitiva goza de buena acogida, gracias a la calidad con la que los prepara y al buen trato que ofrece. Adicionalmente su esposa trabaja vendiendo helados en su vivienda. Con estos ingresos ha logrado sacar a sus hijos adelante.

Las fuertes lluvias que se presentaron en la zona norte del Perú hace algunas semanas han hecho que parte del techo de su vivienda se caiga, por lo que se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a reparar los daños.

Primitiva es un hombre honrado y serio con su trabajo. El ya ha trabajado anteriormente con Nuestra Institución y ha demostrado puntualidad y responsabilidad al momento de asumir sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Primitiva, 60, is married and lives with his wife and the youngest of his three children in Paiján district, Ascope province, La Libertad region, located three hours away from the city of Chiclayo. He has sold fruit juices for over 20 years. He sells year-round form 6am until 2pm at a small stand located near the center of town; the business helps him meet household expenses. Primitiva's business is well received thanks to the quality of his product and the good customer service he provides. In addition, his wife sells frozen treats from home. Their combined income has made it possible for them to raise their children. The heavy rains that occured in the north of Perú a few weeks ago caused parts of his roof to collapse. This has made it necessary for him to ask Edpyme Alternativa for a 2000 new sol loan to help do the needed repairs. Primitiva is an honest man who is serious about his work. He has collaborated with our institution in the past and has demonstrated punctuality and responsiblity with respect to his repayment obligations.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To repair his rain damaged roof.

loans.name: Dolly

texts.es:
Dolly tiene 27 años, es una emprendedora mujer que vive con su esposo José Luis y sus 2 hijos de 14 y 3 años, en casa propia.

Desde hace 3 años, junto a su esposo se dedican al transporte de pasajeros en su motocarro, él maneja y ella se encarga de la administración de las ganancias, refacciones y mantenimientos del vehículo. Dolly no puede dedicarse a una labor que le ocupe todo el día porque sus hijos aun necesitan de sus cuidados, es por ello que con su esposo decidieron incursionar en este negocio. Para el futuro, desean comprar otro motocarro para empezar una pequeña empresa de transportes local. 

Este es su cuarto préstamo con MFP y desde el comienzo de sus créditos ha demostrado ser muy responsable en el pago de sus cuotas. Con el dinero que ahora solicita quiere refaccionar su moto y dejarla óptima el trabajo por las diferentes calles de la ciudad.
texts.en:
Dolly is 27 years old. She is an entrepreneur. She lives with her husband José Luis and their 2 children who are 14 and 3 years old. They live in their own home. They have worked for the past 3 years in passenger transportation with their motorcycle taxi. He drives and she is in charge of profit administration, repairs and maintenance of the vehicle. Dolly cannot work at a job that keeps her busy all day because her children still need her care. That’s why together they decided to tackle this business. In the future they would like to buy another motorcycle taxi to start a small, local transportation business. This is her fourth loan with MFP and since the beginning of her loans, she has shown she is very responsible making her payments. She wants to repair her motorcycle with the money she is applying for now and leave it in ideal condition for work on the different city streets.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Haynes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair motorcycle taxi

loans.name: Belgique

texts.fr:
Mademoiselle  Belgique M. est une femme de 36 ans qui habite dans le quartier de Wakhinane dans la banlieue de Guediawaye.Elle est sociétaire de la caisse de Baye Laye depuis novembre  2001 et a déjà rembourse 2 prêts antérieurs.  
C'est  une célibataire sans enfants mais qui est pleine d’ambition. Mademoiselle M. est coiffeuse de profession. Elle a fait huit ans d’expérience dans sa formation. Des la réception de son diplôme elle a ouvert son salon de coiffure. Parallèlement elle fait du commerce de boubou d’art, de perruques et d’articles divers en destination de la France. Compte tenu du fait qu’elle bouge beaucoup, elle est souvent aidée par sa petite sœur qui apparait d’ailleurs sur la photo qui est publiée. Elle aime beaucoup la coiffure c’est la raison pour laquelle après avoir échoué au brevet elle s’est immédiatement orientée a la  coiffure.  Les moments qui l’intéressent le plus dans cette activité  sont les périodes d’événements comme les fêtes de fin d’années ou la demande de service est très importante. Elle sollicite un crédit de 500 000 frs pour acheter des mèches qu’elle va transformer en perruque et exporter vers l’extérieur. Son plus grand souhait est de devenir une grande coiffeuse de renommée internationale et de pouvoir mener ses activités à l’extérieur. Le crédit consenti au sein de L’U-IMCEC  la motive et renforce ses capacités de production. Les profits gagnes lui permettent de prendre en charge ses besoins personnels, d’être indépendante et d’épargner.
texts.en:
Ms. Belgique M. is a 36-year old woman who lives in the Wakhinane neighborhood of the suburb of Guediawaye. She has been a shareholder-member of the Baye Laye savings bank since November 2001 and has already repaid two previous loans. She is a single woman without children but is very ambitious. Ms. M. is a hairdresser by profession. She had eight years of experience during her training. Since obtaining her diploma she has opened a hairdressing salon. At the same time she sells handcrafted "boubous" (long-flowing suits or dresses), wigs and various articles coming from France. Because she moves around a lot, she is often helped by her younger sister, who appears by the way on the photo above. She loves hairdressing and for this reason she turned to it immediately after having failed her "brevet" (school certificate). The times that interest her the most in this activity are those when there are events such as end-of -year celebratons where demand for service is very high. Her greatest desire is to become an internationally renowned haidresser and to be able to carry out her business abroad. The loan agreed by U-IMCEC (a Senegalese association of mutual savings and loans institutions) will motivate her and strengthen her production capacity. The profits she makes will allow her to take care of her personal needs, to be independent and to save.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase of funds

loans.name: Carlos Roberto

texts.es:
Carlos Roberto Ramírez J., tiene la edad de 23 años, está en unión libre, y vive únicamente con su compañera. El crédito lo quiere para dar asistencia a su finca, el desea realizar unos trabajos en la finca y así lograr que los cultivos produzcan más. La idea es mejorar y aumentar la capacidad de producción y aumentar el área del cultivo.  Don Carlos cuenta con área de diversos cultivos en producción tal es el caso del cultivo del café. Desea darle el adecuado mantenimiento y lograr una mejor calidad y  obtener el mayor ingreso posible cuando sea tiempo de su cosecha. Es la primera vez que realiza un crédito con FUDECOSUR y está muy contento con las facilidades que se le brindaron. Don Carlos también trabaja desde hace varios años en la agricultura. El espera en un futuro mejorar su calidad de vida y tener una mayor estabilidad económica, y así poder seguir creciendo como persona y como productor.

About FUDECOSUR: The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org
texts.en:
Carlos Roberto Ramírez J. is 23-years-old has a live-in girlfriend. She is the only person with whom he lives. He wants this credit to help his farm. He wants to do several jobs on the farm so his crops will produce more. His idea is to improve and increase his production capacity and to expand his area for growing crops. Don Carlos has a production area with different crops like coffee. He hopes to give it adequate maintenance and to achieve better quality so he can make the most income possible at harvest time. This is his first loan with FUDECOSUR and he is very happy with the terms they have offered him. Don Carlos has worked in agriculture for several years. He hopes to improve his quality of life in the future and to have more economic stability so he can keep growing as a person and a producer. About FUDECOSUR: The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To make improvements to his farm

loans.name: Fatima

texts.fr: H. Fatima est née en 1982 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin.  Fatima est mariée à SESSINOU Nassif, un transitaire, et n’a pas encore des enfants.  Fatima vit ensemble avec son mari au quartier Sènadé à Cotonou depuis deux ans.  Fatima n’a jamais fréquenté l’école.  Pour faire face à ses besoins, Fatima vend des pagnes par le système de distribution.   Elle a cinq ans d’expérience dans ce domaine et s’approvisionne à Lomé au Togo, pays voisin du Bénin.  C’est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé, ayant déjà obtenu trois crédits qui ont été bien remboursés à ALIDé. Fatima sollicite un quatrième crédit auprès de ALIDé, pour renforcer son activité et accroître sa clientèle.
texts.en:
Fatima H. was born in 1982 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. She's married to Nassif SESSINOU, a freight agent, and doesn't have children yet. She's been living with her husband in the Sènadé neighborhood in Cotonou for two years. Fatima never attended school. To provide for herself, she sells pagnes (colorful African cloth) through the distribution system. She's got a five years experience in this field, and gets her supplies in Lomé, in Togo, a country that borders Benin. She's a former client of Kiva's partner, ALIDé, who already benefited from three loans that were repaid without problems. Fatima is now seeking a fourth loan from ALIDé, in order to bolster her business and expand her clientele.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pagnes (colorful African cloth)

loans.name: Elorgia

texts.es:
Elorgia tiene 52 años, vive con su pareja, Franklin, en su casa propia. Sus hijos ya son independientes y viven aparte.

Desde hace un año se dedica a su bazar – librería, el cual implementó en su propia vivienda, teniendo la comodidad de atender a sus clientes mientras desarrolla las labores del hogar. Elorgia se siente contenta y satisfecha con su trabajo porque le brinda los ingresos necesarios para vivir con tranquilidad y ser independiente, aunque muchas veces le resulta muy cansado el tener que proveer a su librería de materiales, puesto que debe traer los paquetes ella sola resultándole muy pesado. Su esposo es jubilado, pero realiza algunos trabajos esporádicos por lo cual no permanece en casa, es así que Elorgia debe dedicarse sola a su trabajo. 
En un futuro quiere ampliar su librería y seguir mejorando la sección del bazar comprando artículos más atractivos para su clientela.

Este es su segundo préstamo con MFP y siempre ha respondido muy bien a los pagos por la gran responsabilidad que posee. Con el dinero que ahora solicita comprará útiles escolares, pues se acerca la época escolar y estos serán muy demandados.
texts.en:
Elorgia is 52 years old. She lives with her husband, Franklin, in their own home. Their children are already independent and live elsewhere. She has worked in her shop – bookstore for a year. She established it in her own house which makes it easy to wait on her customers while doing her housework. Elorgia is happy and satisfied with her work because it gives her the income she needs to live peacefully and be independent. Although, often it is very tiring to have to stock her bookstore with materials since she has to bring the packages herself and they are very heavy for her. Her husband is retired but he does some work sporadically which is why he doesn’t stay home. That’s why Elorgia has to work by herself. She wants to enlarge her bookstore in the future and continue improving the shop section by purchasing more attractive items for her clientele. This is her second loan with MFP and she has always responded very well to the payments for the great responsibility it is. She will buy school supplies with the money she is applying for now. The school year is getting close and these will be in big demand.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Haynes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es:
Gloria tiene 41 años, vive con su pareja y sus hijos de 15 y 11 años, en su casa propia.
Por el progreso de su familia nunca dudó en dedicarse a diferentes labores con tal de lograr buenos ingresos. Felizmente encontró la estabilidad en la venta de cerveza, actividad con la cual lleva más de 4 años, resultándole muy rentable. Ella suele vender esta bebida en las diferentes actividades que existen en la zona en la que vive, ya que siempre solicitan de su servicio por ser una persona confiable. Además, todos los sábados, se instala en la cancha de fútbol de su localidad, donde siempre hay muchas personas por los partidos que ahí se juegan, logrando buenas ventas. Gloria espera seguir trabajando para consolidar su negocio y en un futuro hacerlo más estable, ha estado pensando en incursionar en otra actividad paralela, pero aun no ha decidido en cuál, pero sabe que a lo que se dedica le pondrá muchas ganas y voluntad.

Este es su sexto préstamo con MFP y es considerada una cliente puntual y muy responsable, al igual que sus compañeras, con las cuales forma un grupo muy unido. Con el dinero que ahora solicita, Gloria quiere comprar más cajas de cerveza para aumentar su mercadería, puesto que en esta época de verano las ventas son muy buenas y sabe que logrará buenos ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
Gloria is 41 years old. She lives in her own home with her partner and their children who are 15 and 11 years old. She never thought twice about working at different jobs to make a good income in order for her family to get ahead. She happily found stability selling beer. She has worked in this for 4 years and it has been very profitable. She usually sells this beverage at the different activities in the area where she lives. They always request her service because she is a reliable person. Every Saturday she also goes to the local soccer field. There are always a lot of people due to the games that they play there and she makes good sales. Gloria hopes to keep working to consolidate her business and make it more stable in the future. She has been thinking about tackling another parallel job but she still hasn’t decided in what. But she knows that whatever she does she will use her desire and willpower. This is her sixth loan with MFP and she is considered to be a punctual customer and very responsible like her friends. They form a very close group. With the money she has applied for, Gloria wants to buy more cases of beer to increase her stock. The sales are very good this time of the summer and she knows she will make a good income.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Haynes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase stock

loans.name: Amoudiya

texts.en: Amoudiya O. is 16 years old and works in the Grand Marché de Hédzranawoé selling groceries. She gets her supplies from the Grand Marché in Lomé and then transports them to the market in Hédzranawoé for resale. She has applied for her first loan from WAGES to buy more items to sell. She is single and does not have children. With your help, this young entrepreneur will develop into a successful businesswoman.

loans.use: To buy groceries for resale

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy children's clothes and slippers so that he can open a new general goods store

loans.name: Hilber

texts.es:
Hilber es un hombre de 32 años, es taxista, y comparte su vida con Edith su esposa, quien se dedica a la venta de ropa. Juntos educan su única hija de 5 años. Gracias a su gran esfuerzo y dedicación adquirieron su casa propia, donde ahora viven muy contentos.

Él aprendió a conducir desde muy joven y gracias a esta actividad, en la cual lleva 2 años, hoy puede mantener a su familia. Hilber brinda servicio de transporte desde tempranas horas en la mañana y se prolonga hasta el atardecer, siendo un trabajo muy cansado porque debe ir a los diferentes lugares que le solicitan sus clientes. A pesar de todo el esfuerzo que le demanda esta labor, él se siente muy contento, ya que siempre le gustó mucho conducir y además como él manifiesta es un trabajo muy independiente. Como si fuera poco él y su esposa están pensando instalar un restaurante y así propagar sus posibilidades de mejorar sus ingresos. Ellos piensan que todo es posible si le ponen muchas ganas y mucho esfuerzo a todo lo que hacen y sienten que podrán cumplir sus metas muy pronto.

Este es el primer crédito de Hilber con MFP y decidió solicitar un crédito porque vio las mejoras que éste produjo en el negocio de su hermana. Con el dinero que solicita refaccionará su auto para seguir ofreciendo un buen servicio. Además apoyará a su esposa con la compra de ropa para que también mejore su negocio, así ambos saldrán adelante.
texts.en:
Hilber is a 32 year-old man. He is a taxi driver and lives with his wife, Edith, who sells clothes. Together, they educate their only daugther, who is five years old. Thanks to their great effort and dedication, they were able to buy their own house, where they live happily. Hilber learned how to drive when he was very young. He has been a taxi driver for two years, and thanks to this, he is able to support his family. Hilber offers his transportation services from the early hours in the morning until dusk. It is very tiresome work because he has to go to all the different places his customers ask. In spite of all the effort being a taxi driver demands, Hilber feels very content with what he does. He has always really liked driving, and he is able to work independently. As if that weren't enough, Hilber and his wife are thinking about starting a restuarant to increase the possibility of improving their income. The couple believes that anything is possible if they put forth a lot of interest and effort in the things that they do. They believe they can accomplish their goals very soon. This is Hilber's first loan with with MFP, and he decided to request it because he saw the improvements a loan had on his sister's business. Hilber will use the money he is soliciting to refurbish his car so he can continue offering good service. Additionally, he will buy clothes to support his wife so that she can improve her own business. This will allow both of them to move forward.

Translated from Spanish by Lydia Brantley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Refurbishing car

loans.name: Flora

texts.es:
Flora S. T., tiene la edad de 63 años, está casada, y vive con el esposo  y un nieto. El crédito lo quiere para la compra de ropa para venderla. Desea tener un inventario más variado de prendas de vestir, para ampliar su negocio. Hace aproximadamente 2 años que empezó este negocio viendo la necesidad de aportar a la economía de su hogar. No es la primera vez que realiza un crédito con FUDECOSUR y está muy contenta con las facilidades que se le han brindado siempre. Ella espera en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mayor estabilidad económica, y de poder seguir creciendo como persona y como comerciante.

About FUDECOSUR:
The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org
texts.en:
Flora S. T. is 63, is married, and lives with her husband and one grandson. She wants this credit to buy clothing to sell. She hopes to have a more varied inventory of clothing so she can expand her business. She started this business approximately 2 years ago because she saw it necessary to support her home economically. This isn't the first time that she has had a loan with FUDECOSUR, and she is very happy with the terms they have always offered her. She hopes to offer her family a better quality of life and economic stability in the future and to keep growing as a person and a businesswoman. About FUDECOSUR: The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothing to sell

loans.name: Jessica

texts.es:
Jessica tiene 29 años, es una joven muy dinámica, vive con su esposo Andrés y su hijo de 5 años, y su otro bebé está próximo en llegar.

Ella siempre ha trabajado para apoyar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar, a pesar que él tiene un trabajo más estable ella quiere ser independiente y poder cubrir sus gastos y los de su hijo. Es por eso que optó por una actividad que no le demandara un horario fijo. Ahora se siente muy contenta porque la venta de productos de belleza ha sido la actividad perfecta para obtener buenos ingresos. Además de ofrecerlos a sus vecinas y amigas, también compró una vitrina, la cual colocó en la tienda de su madre, donde la clientela puede apreciar mejor los productos que ofrece. Ella quiere hacer más estable su negocio y es por eso que piensa seguir invirtiendo en él.

Jessica es una cliente antigua de MFP y su grupo “Cristo Morado” uno de los mejores por su buena organización y puntualidad con los pagos. Con el dinero que ahora solicita adquirirá mayor cantidad de productos de belleza para mejorar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Jessica is 29 years old. She is a very dynamic young woman. She lives with her husband, Andrés, and her five year old son; she has another baby on the way. Jessica has always worked to help her husband with household costs. Even though he has a stable job, Jessica wants to be independent and be able to cover her and her son's spending. For this reason, she opted to work doing something that does not demand a set schedule. Now she is really happy because selling beauty products has been the perfect activity to increase income. In addition to offering the products to her friends and neighbors, she bought a display case, which she put in her mother's store so her customers can better appreciate the products Jessica offers. Jessica wants to make her business more stable, so she plans to continue investing in it. Jessica is an old client of MFP, and her group "Cristo Morada" is one of the best with its organization and punctuality with repayments. With the money she is requesting, she will acquire a larger quantity of beauty products so she can increase her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Lydia Brantley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing merchandise

loans.name: Vidal De La Cruz

texts.es:
Don Vidal de la Cruz V. M.es un hombre de campo, tiene 56 años de edad, es soltero, tiene una hija de tres años de edad, la señora con la que él convive se llama Verónica Mercado, este señor vive en una comunidad rural que se llama Sirama Norte (Las Nubes), acá él tiene los corrales donde mete el ganado después que este ha pastado.
Este cliente ha obtenido tres créditos con nuestra institución, estos los ha utilizado para compra de vacas, y este último lo adquirió para compra de alambre para mejorar las cercas de los corrales y a la vez para la compra de una vaca, es bueno hacer notar que a demás de dedicarse a la ganadería, este cliente también se dedica a la siembre de Granos Básicos, como podemos ver, este cliente es un hombre de mucho trabajo.
texts.en:
Don Vidal de la Cruz V. M.is a man of the country and is 56, single, and has a 3-year-old daughter. The woman he lives with is named Verónica Mercado. He lives in a community called Sirama Norte (the nearest city is Las Nubes). Here he has corrals where he keeps cattle that he grazes. This client has had three loans with our institution, and he has used them to buy cows. He will use this last loan to buy wire to improve the fences of his corrals and also to purchase a cow. It is good to point out that in addition to raising cattle, he also grows basic grains. As we can see, this client is a very hard-working man.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase wire to improve his fences and to buy a cow

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more rice to sell to her customers

loans.name: Victoire

texts.fr: A. Victoire est née vers 1978.  Il y a 12 ans que Victoire s’est installée à Adogleta à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin.  Mariée à BANKOLE Gafari, un commerçant, Victoire est mère de deux enfants, tous scolarisés.  Victoire vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants.  Le couple assure ensemble les charges de la famille.  Victoire a fréquenté l’école jusqu’au cours secondaire.  Pour faire face à ses besoins, Victoire est une couturière.   Victoire exerce cette activité depuis 8 ans.  C’est à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin, que Victoire achète les materiels dont elle a besoin.  Victoire a déjà obtenu deux crédits de ALIDé, crédits qu’elle a bien remboursés.  Elle sollicite un troisième crédit pour renforcer ses activités et mieux satisfaire ses clients.
texts.en:
Victoire A. was born circa 1978. Twelve years ago, she moved to Adogleta in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. She's married to Gafari BANKOLE, a storekeeper, and the mother of two school-attending children. Victoire lives together with her husband and her children. The couple provides for the family expenses together. Victoire attended school up to secondary level. To provide for herself, she's been a seamstress for eight years. She gets the supplies she needs in Dantokpa, an international marketplace in Benin. She already benefited from two loans from Kiva's partner, ALIDé, which were repaid without problems. She's now seeking a third loan in order to bolster her business and better satisfy her customers.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy poplin and sewing thread

loans.name: Fredrick

texts.en: Fredrick is 30 years old, married and has two children, one of whom attends school. For the last four years, he has made a living running a retail shop in the Kibera slums.  Before this, he ran a boutique where he sold clothes. Since joining Faulu Kenya, he has been able to increase his working capital, and now hopes to continue expanding his business and earn enough money to send his children to university.  He has applied for a loan for Kes. 40,000 to buy items such as cooking fat, tea leaves, towels and margarine to sell to his customers.  He is an ambitious and visionary man who also hopes to expand his business into a wholesale operation.

loans.use: To buy additional items to sell in his shop

loans.name: Luz

texts.es:
Luz es una amable mujer de 39 años, su esposo trabaja en otra ciudad y es por ello que sólo vive con sus 3 hijos de 21, 18 y 15 años, en su casa propia.	Edad, estado civil, miembros de su familia.

Al estar lejos de su esposo vio por conveniente generar sus propios ingresos, ya que siempre ha trabajado y está acostumbrada a estar en permanente actividad. Es así que incursionó en variedad de oficios dedicándose anteriormente a la venta de bisutería, actividad que le resultó muy rentable en ciertas épocas del año; pero Luz necesitaba un negocio más estable es por ello que incursionó en la venta de comida, labor que le está trayendo grandes gratificaciones, pues tiene una sazón muy buena y cada día se hace de más clientes. Ella suele trabajar durante las mañanas entregando los almuerzos a domicilio a las personas que se lo solicitan, ya que no tiene un local donde ofrecer sus platillos, además esta forma de trabajo le da la ventaja de que no le sobre comida porque cocina sólo la cantidad de platillos que le solicitan. 

Este es el sexto préstamo de Luz con MFP, el trabajo con su grupo es muy bueno porque todas sus compañeras son muy responsables, siendo un grupo ejemplar en la institución. Con este préstamo comprará ingredientes para preparar sus platillos, además de algunos utensilios de cocina para facilitarse el trabajo.
texts.en:
Luz is a nice 39 year-old woman. Her husband works in another city, so she lives alone in her house with her three children who are 12, 18, and 15 years old. Being away from her husband, Luz thought it advisable to generate her own income. She has always worked and is used to being in a state of permanent activity. She has made forays into a variety of different fields. Previously, she sold costume jewelry, which was very profitable during certain times of the year, but Luz needed a more stable job so she started selling food. Selling food has brought Luz a lot of gratification, because she has really good seasoning and every day she has more clients. Luz usually works during the mornings to deliver lunches to the people who order them since she does not have a restaurant where she can serve them. Delivering food gives her the advantage of not having leftover food because she only cooks the number of plates people order. This is Luz's sixth loan with MFP. Her group is very good because all of the members are very responsible, making them one of the institution's exemplary groups. With this loan, Luz will buy the ingredients needed to prepare her food as well as some kitchen utensils to help with her work.

Translated from Spanish by Lydia Brantley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying ingredients for food

loans.name: Elton

texts.en: Elton is a visionary and hard-working man. He was previously employed before he started his retail shop, which he has been running for five years. His shop is located in the Kibera slums in Nairobi. He says that his finances have really been transformed since he became a member of Faulu Kenya. He has also been able to pay the school fees for his three children in school. He plans to buy sugar, rice, cooking oil and cereals, hence he has requested a loan of Kes. 65,000. He hopes to grow his retail business into selling wholesale in the future.

loans.use: To buy cooking fat, sugar, rice and cereals

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en: Mercy is a 30-year-old single lady who has been selling clothes for the last three years. She is also employed in an insurance agency. She started the business after she took out a loan from Faulu Kenya, which she used as capital for the new business. She has requested a loan of Kes. 30,000 to buy more clothes for resale. She hopes to open a shop for rental in the future. She dreams of creating employment for many people. She describes herself as a hard-working lady.

loans.use: To buy new clothes for sale

loans.name: Massa Victorine

texts.fr: cette femme, réside dans le quartier d'attiégou qui est un quartier périphérique de la ville de Lomé, elle est mariée et mère de 04 enfants. elle exerce ce commerce depuis 2005 et contribue financièrement aux charges de sa famille, elle s'approvisionne au grand marché de lomé. son stock est en baisse ,elle veut se réapprovisionner raison pour laquelle elle sollicite de WAGES son premier crédit pour l'achat de céréales, 10 cartons de savons  , des produits de beauté, des laits , des bonbons,des biscuits et divers.
texts.en:
This is a woman who lives in Attiégou, an outlying neighborhood in the city of Lomé. She's married and the mother of four children. She's been running this business since 2005, and she contributes in supporting the family expenses. She gets her supplies at the grand market in Lomé. Her stock has decreased, and she wants to resupply. She's therefore seeking her first loan from Kiva's partner, WAGES, in order to buy cereals, 10 boxes of soaps, cosmetics, milk, candies, biscuits, and various other items.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cereals, 10 boxes of soaps, cosmetics, milk, candies, biscuits, and various other items

loans.name: Ninfa

texts.es:
Ninfa, de 37 años, vive en su casa propia al lado de sus tres hijos de 17, 13 y 3 años.
Desde hace 8 años se dedica al cultivo y a venta de hortalizas, tiene chacras de maíz, apio, poro, etc., los cuales cultiva en unos terrenos de su propiedad. Su puesto está ubicado en uno de los mercados más conocidos de la zona en la que vive. Anteriormente vendía en la calle, en costales que extendía en el suelo y donde ponía a la vista sus productos; pero gracias a uno de los créditos con MFP pudo alquilar su puesto y ahora sus productos son más vistosos y es más visitada por los clientes. Ninfa le dedica a su negocio toda la mañana, para posteriormente trasladarse a preparar los alimentos a su hogar y por las tardes ir a supervisas sus chacras hasta el anochecer, gracias a todo este esfuerzo ella viene obteniendo buenas ganancias que le ayudan a sustentar su hogar.

Este es el segundo préstamo que tiene con MFP y su experiencia en el anterior préstamo fue muy bueno y espera repetir esta experiencia. Ninfa tiene pensado invertir el dinero que solicita en la compra de semillas y algunos fertilizantes para optimizar su producción de vegetales y que éstos se vendan rápidamente.
texts.en:
Ninfa is 37 years old. She lives in her own house with her three children, who are 17, 13, and three years old. For eight years, Ninfa has worked growing and selling vegetables. She has small fields of corn, celery, leeks, etc. which she grows on he property's land. Her vegetable stall is located in one of the most well-known markets in the area where she lives. Previously, she sold her vegetables in the street, where she put them in plain view in open sacks that she spread out across the ground. Thanks to one of her loans with MFP she was able to rent a stall in the market. Now her products are more visible and she has more visits from customers. Ninfa dedicates all morning to her business, later going home to prepare food, and in the afternoons she cares for her fields until dark. Thanks to all this effort, Ninfa has been able to make a good income that help her support her household. This is her second loan with MFP. Her experience with her first loan went very well, and she hopes to repeat this experience. Ninfa plans to invest the money she is requesting in buying seeds and fertilizer to increase her vegetable production since they sell rapidly.

Translated from Spanish by Lydia Brantley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Luis Narciso

texts.es: Luis es padre separado tiene hijos ya mayores de edad no tiene carga familiar, tiene casa propia se dedica a su propio taller de electricidad hace 11 años, tiene buenas referencias personales y experiencia creditica, solicita dicho credito para capital de trabajo  se propone por contar con capacidad y sobre todo voluntad de pago.
texts.en:
Luis is a father separated from his wife. He has grown children and no family responsibilities. He has his own house. He has worked in his own electrician business for 11 years. He has good personal references and credit experience. He is asking for this loan for working capital. He says one can count on his ability and mO. than anything his willingness to make payments.

Translated from Spanish by Lydia Brantley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase cattle

loans.name: Flordeliza

texts.en:
Flordeliza N. is a 25-year-old married woman who lives in San Antonio, Himamaylan City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating a general store. Flordeliza’s husband, Sanny, is a 27-year-old passenger jeepney driver. They have one child who currently goes to school

Flordeliza joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2004 in the hopes that she would be able to help her husband improve the quality of life for their family. With the help of her loans from NWTF-PD, she has been able to increase their family income by engaging in a general store business. Now she earns an average monthly income of PHP 6,000 from her business activities.

Flordeliza is a member in good standing. Her previous loan of PHP 27,000 was used to fund operations of her general store, and it had a positive impact on both the business and the family’s living conditions. Now she is borrowing her 14th loan of PHP 28,000, which she intends to use in her general store business. Flordeliza is working hard to achieve her dreams and aspirations for her family, which are to provide them with a brighter future and a more comfortable life.

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: As additional working capital

loans.name: Gregory

texts.en: Gregory is an entrepreneur who operates a furniture business. He has been in the business for five years and employs one person. He was previously running a welding shop. His wife is a hairdresser and they are blessed with eight children, who are in school. He appreciates Faulu Kenya for helping him increase his business income. He looks forward to expanding his business in the future. To do this, he has requested a loan of Kes. 40,000 to buy timber and nails for making more furniture. He describes himself as a successful entrepreneur.

loans.use: To buy timber and nails

loans.name: George Harrinson

texts.es:
George es un padre de familia de 21 años de edad que vive junto a su esposa y a su hijo de tres meses de nacido en el distrito de Paiján, provincia de Ascope, en la región La Libertad, ubicada a tres horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Usualmente trabaja como recolector de esparragos en una empresa agroindustrial de la zona, pero como los ingresos que percibe no son suficientes para  mantener a su familia también tiene un negocio de crianza y venta de cerdos. El cría los cerdos en casa de sus padres para luego venderlos a los negociantes que visitan la zona constantemente.

George se muestra muy interesado por la crianza de cerdos y siempre está pensando en encontrar nuevas formas para mejorar la calidad de sus animales de tal modo que los pueda vender a buen precio. Es siguiendo este objetivo que se ha propuesto mejorar la raza de sus animales, para lo que desea comprar un cerdo macho de mejor raza para que se aparee con las hembras que posee con el propósito de mejorar la raza y la calidad de las nuevas camadas. Por ello George se encuentra solicitando a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 300 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.

George es un joven trabajador y que responde con responsabilidad a los retos que le ofrece la vida. Su mayor anhelo es poder adquirir una vivienda para su mujer y su menor hijo. El ya ha trabajado anteriormente con Nuestra Institucón y ha demostrado puntualidad y responsabilidad al momento de asumir sus cuotas.
texts.en:
George is a 21-year-old father who lives with his wife and three-month-old son in Paiján district, Ascope province, La Libertad region, located three hours away from the city of Chiclayo. He ususally works picking asparagus for a local agroindustrial company. However, because his salary is insufficient to support his family, he also raises pigs. He raises the pigs at his parents' house and then sells them to merchants that always come around the area. George is very interested in raising pigs and is always looking for new ways to improve the quality of his animals so that he can sell them at better prices. Following this objective, he plans to improve his breed by buying a pedigree male which he will use to breed with his sows in order to improve the breeding of the new litters. George needs a 300 new sol loan from Edpyme Alternativa to reach this goal. George is a hard-working young man who faces life's challenges with responsibility. His greatest wish is to be able to acquire a dwelling for his wife and young son. He has collaborated with our institution in the past and he has demonstrated punctuality and responsibility with respect to repayment obligations.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pedigree pigs to improve his breed.

loans.name: Rhoda

texts.en:
Rhoda M. is a 42-year-old married woman who lives in Luke Wright St., Dumaguete City, Negros Oriental. She earns her living by providing multimedia services to her clients.

Rhoda’s husband, Rafael, is a 41-year-old computer technician who helps his wife manage their computer-based business. They have three children who are between 5 and 10 years old. The two older children are currently going to school and also help their parents in the business as part of their daily chores.

Rhoda joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2005 in the hope that she would be able to help her husband improve the quality of life of their family. With the help of her loans from NWTF-PD she has been able to increase their family income by engaging in multimedia services. Now she earns an average monthly income of PHP 20,000 from her business activities.

Rhoda is a member in good standing. Her previous loan of PHP 20,000 was used to fund operations of her multimedia services business, and it had a positive impact on both the business and the family’s living conditions. Now she is borrowing her ninth loan for PHP 20,000, which she intends to use as additional working capital in her multimedia services business. Rhoda is working hard to achieve her dreams and aspirations for her family, which are to provide them with a brighter future and a more comfortable life. In the picture, Rhoda is with her husband at their business.

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: As additional working capital

loans.name: Jose Ramon

texts.es: José Ramón tiene 36 años, su actividad económica es ofrecer el servicio de tricitaxi. Este hombre recorre muchos lugares todos los días, a pesar de ser un trabajo agotador llega a su vivienda proporcionándole  sus 4 hijos los ingresos necesarios, por lo que además José los fines de semana se incorpora en la venta y compra de cerdos, el es un hombre trabajador y futuro empresario pues siempre está pensando en un sin número de medios para mejorar sus ingresos por lo que es una persona muy ejemplar. El financiamiento que solicita es para la compra de capital de trabajo para proporcionarle mejoras a su tricitaxi. El sueña con algún día construir su propia casa.
texts.en:
Jose is 36 years old and he drives a “trictaxi” (a pedal powered three-wheeled taxi) and goes to many places daily. This is tiring work, but each day he goes home to provide for his four children. On the weekends he buys and sells hogs. He is a hard worker and a future entrepreneur. He is an exemplary person who is always thinking of ways to improve his income. He is asking for this loan in order to provide working capital to maintain his tricitaxi. Some day he would like to build his own home.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital for vehicle mainenance

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en: Victoria is 41 years old and has three children, the eldest of whom is 18 years old. She is currently requesting a loan from Community Economic Ventures, Inc. for 15,000 Php. Her business is manicure and pedicure services. She provides these services in her customers' homes to gain more income. She wants her business to become successful because this is what her family depends on.

loans.use: Manicure and pedicure supplies

loans.name: Chevalier Group

texts.en: The Chevalier de Romeo group is excited about receiving their firS. loan from Esperanza. The group has a variety of businesses from selling used clothing and sandals to food and meats in local markets. Leonel B. is the representative of the group. He is a 31-year-old husband and father of two children. Leonel has a thriving gas business, a sort of mini station. He sells both at home and by the side of the road to passing motorists.  His intereS. in joining Esperanza came from the low intereS. rate of the loans and because the organization shares his same Christian values. He hopes to grow his business and be a blessing to the people in the area. On behalf of Leonel, Chevalier, and Esperanza we thank you for your support.

loans.use: To buy gasoline and diesel fuel

loans.name: Luz Group

texts.es:
The Luz Group is made of three women entrepreneurs and workers, each with a strong vision.  ADIM promotes personal and business development programs to its clients. These women have taken the opportunity to learn how to manage their small businesses more efficiently, and to strengthened their self esteem and feel empowered.  Also, it has helped them to efficiently use their loans, to be more organized, and to improve their relationship with their clients.

The coordinator of the group is Señora Cisel del Socorro López.  Two years ago Cisel used her savings to purchase new products and begin her small store.  Now, thanks to the loans from ADIM she has been able to offer more variety, and better quality products, which has grown her business. She hopes that in the not too distant future she will be able to convert her store into a miscellaneous shop, she is sure she will achieve this.

Also in the group Señora Rosa María Pérez A. and Gloria del Socorro V..  Rosa is dedicated to her sales of all types of products.  She sells Avon and Zermat & Voguet brand cosmetics, clothing, shoes, traditional Nicaraguan sweets, and pork.  She wants to be able to fix up her home which is deteriorating. Gloria and her husband began a small funeral home ten years ago, additionally they began a small restaurant where they make and sell lunch during the day, fried foods in the evenings, and on the weekends soup and nacatamales. Her wishes are that her businesses continue to prosper.
texts.en:
The Luz Group is made of three women entrepreneurs and workers, each with a strong vision. ADIM promotes personal and business development programs to its clients. These women have taken the opportunity to learn how to manage their small businesses more efficiently, and to strengthened their self esteem and feel empowered. Also, it has helped them to efficiently use their loans, to be more organized, and to improve their relationship with their clients. The coordinator of the group is Señora Cisel del Socorro López. Two years ago Cisel used her savings to purchase new products and begin her small store. Now, thanks to the loans from ADIM she has been able to offer more variety, and better quality products, which has grown her business. She hopes that in the not too distant future she will be able to convert her store into a miscellaneous shop, she is sure she will achieve this. Also in the group Señora Rosa María Pérez A. and Gloria del Socorro V.. Rosa is dedicated to her sales of all types of products. She sells Avon and Zermat & Voguet brand cosmetics, clothing, shoes, traditional Nicaraguan sweets, and pork. She wants to be able to fix up her home which is deteriorating. Gloria and her husband began a small funeral home ten years ago, additionally they began a small restaurant where they make and sell lunch during the day, fried foods in the evenings, and on the weekends soup and nacatamales. Her wishes are that her businesses continue to prosper.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Inventory

loans.name: Cipriana

texts.es: La Sra. Cipriana Baldeón tiene 48 años de edad. Es casada vive junto a su esposo,y sus 5 hijos todos mayores, tres de ellos están comprometidos, sólo dos hijos solteros se encuentran viviendo con ellos. Tienen un pequeño negocio de venta de abarrotes y bebidas en su casa desde hace 1 año apróximadamente. Además su cónyuge labora como obrero de campo en distintas empresas agroindustriales de la zona de Santiago, Ica. Cuenta con casa propia la cual han construído con mucho esfuerzo. Además se dedican a la crianza de animales como vacas y ovejas. No cuentan con endeudamiento en ninguna institución. Su sueño es hacer crecer su negocio para incrementar ingresos en su familia y mejorar su calidad de vida. Ambos agradecen el apoyo que les podamos brindar a través de estos financiemientos.
texts.en:
Mrs. Cipriana B. is 48 years old, married and lives with her husband. Her five children are all grown up; three of them are engaged and only two sons are single and live with them. They have a small business where they have been selling groceries and drinks in their home for approximately a year now. Furthermore her spouse works as a field worker in different agro-industrial companies in the Santiago, Ica. zone. She has her own home that they have built with a lot of effort. They are also dedicated to raising animals such as cows and sheep. They don't have any debts with any institution. Her dream is to make their business grow to increase the earnings for their family and to increase their quality of life. They both are very grateful that we can provide help with this financing.

Translated from Spanish by Esteban Riojas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Mila

texts.en:
Mila A. is a 39-year-old married woman who lives in Brgy Culipapa, Hinobaan, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by running a general store, a piggery and fishing.

Mila and her husband, William, have two children who are 15 and 17 years old. The children are currently going to school and help their parents in the business as part of their daily chores.

Mila joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2002 in the hopes that she would be able to help her husband improve the quality of life for their family. With the help of her loans from NWTF-PD, she has been able to increase their family income by engaging in a general store, a piggery and fishing. Now she earns an average monthly income of PHP 5,000 from her business activities.

Mila is a member in good standing. Her previous loan of PHP 10,000 was used to fund operations of her general store, and it had a positive impact on both the business and the family’s living conditions. Now she is borrowing PHP 8,000 for her 11th loan, which she intends to use as additional capital for her general store, piggery and fishing businesses. Mila is working hard to achieve her dreams and aspirations for her family, which are to provide them with a brighter future and a more comfortable life.

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Karina Edith

texts.es: Karina tiene 26 años es madre soltera tiene una hija de 3 años , vive en casa de su tios ella tiene amplia experiencia en el rubro de ventas , tiene su negocio de venta de refrescos y panes hace mas de 3 años productos de su trabajo tiene buena acumuacion de bienes  es padre y madre para su pequeña hija, a Karina le gusta mantener limpio y  presentable su negocio es por ello que tiene buena clientela, tiene experiencia crediticia  solicita dicho credito para invertir en capital de trabajo se propone por contar con capacidad y sobre todo voluntad de pago.
texts.en:
Karina is 26 years old and a single mother of a 3 year old daughter; she lives in her uncle's home. She has had a lot of experience in sales, having run her business selling juice and bread for the last 3 years. Due to her business, she has been able to provide for her daughter for whom she is both mother and father. She likes to keep a clean and presentable business locale which leads to a loyal clientele. She has a good credit record and is requesting this loan to invest in working capital; she is very able and willing to pay her loan back punctually.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Marlyn

texts.en:
Marlyn A. is a 50-year-old married woman who lives in Brgy San Jose, Sipalay City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by selling all kinds of footwear (shoes and sandals) and operating a cafeteria.

Marlyn’s husband, Nonoy, manages the cafeteria, and they have five children who are between 13 and 22 years old. The children are currently going to school and help their parents in the business as part of their daily chores.

Marlyn joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2005 in the hope that she would be able to help her husband improve the quality of life of their family. With the help of her loans from NWTF-PD, she has been able to increase their family's income by engaging in selling footwear at retail and running a cafeteria business. Now she earns an average monthly income of PHP 3,000 from her business activities.

Marlyn is a member in good standing. Her previous loan of PHP 19,000 was used to fund operation of her retail footwear business, and it had a positive impact on both the business and the family’s living conditions. Now she is borrowing PHP 19,000 for her 12th loan, which she intends to use as additional capital for her footwear and cafeteria businesses. Marlyn is working hard to achieve her dreams and aspirations for her family, which are to provide them with a brighter future and a more comfortable life.

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Jose Miguel

texts.es:
