José tiene 65 años de edad, es casado y tiene cuatro hijos ya independientes. Vive junto a su esposa en el distrito de Paiján, provincia de Ascope, en la región La Libertad, ubicada a tres horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Desde hace treinta años tiene instalada en su vivienda una bodega en donde ofrece a sus clientes todo tipo de bebidas. El nos comenta que pudo instalar este negocio con los ahorros que tenía de las ganancias de su trabajo como costurero, que ejerce desde muy joven. Con estas dos actividades el ha podido salir adelante y solventar sus gastos familiares.

El negocio goza de buena acogida, especialmente en época de verano que es cuando más demanda tiene, es por ello que se encuentra solicitando a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a comprar más bebidas con los cuales pueda ampliar su negocio.

José es un hombre honrado y muy trabajador. El ya ha trabajado anteriomente con Nuestra Institución en muchas oportunidades, demostrando en todas puntualidad y responsabilidad al momento de asumir sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Jose is 65 years old, married with four children who are all independent adults. He lives with his wife in Paijan, Ascope in the Libertad province, about three hours from the city of Chiclayo. For the past 30 years, he has run a small store out of his home offering a variety of beverages. He was able to start the store with his savings that he earned from his job sewing and making clothing, a job he started when he was young. Through these 2 businesses, he has been able to progress and cover his household expenses. His business has a steady flow of customers, especially during the summer when demand is high; this is why he is requesting a $700 loan from Edpyme Alternativa which will help him buy more drinks to grow his business. Jose is a very honest, hard-working man. He has worked with our institution many times prior, showing great responsibilitiy and punctuality in fulfilling his payments.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of drinks to grow his business during the summer

loans.name: Amparo Justina

texts.es:
La señora Amparo Justina M., de 49 años vive en el Barrio Lomas de Guadalupe, es casada y su esposo se desempeña como contador idependiente, es madre de 8 hijos pero a su cargo tiene a una hija la cual estudia la secundaria. Ellos son una familia muy unida y que tienen buenas intenciones para sobrevivir y cambiar gracias a su trabajo la forma de vivir.

Dentro de las principales prioridades que se tienen planeadas esta la remoelacion de su hogar, es por esta razon que solicitan un prestamo para la construcción de una pared lateral este, esta construcción le ayudara a mejorar la estética de su vivenda y mejores comodidades para su familia.
texts.en:
Amparo Justina M. is 49 years old and lives in the Lomas de Guadalupe neighborhood; she is married and her husband is an independent accountant. She is the mother of 8 children but she only has one daughter living with her while she finishes high school. They are a very united family who hope to improve their standard of living through their labors. One of their big priorities is to remodel their home which is why they are seeking a loan. They would like to build another wall for their home which will improve the aesthetics and provide a more comfortable living for the family.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction of a wall in their home

loans.name: Aminata

texts.fr: Madame Aminata S. est une yoffoise de 46 ans. Elle habite plus précisément  dans le quartier de Layenne. Elle est sociétaire de la caisse de l’u-Imcec  à Yoff depuis décembre  2002. Elle est mariée et mère  de 2 enfants dont l’âge varie entre 15 et 19 ans. C’est une commerçante  vendeuse d’aliment de bétail  céréales  et d’autres produits divers utilises par les tradipraticiens. Elle évolue dans ce secteur depuis  2005. A cause du fait qu’elle n’ait pas réussi dans ses études, elle a choisi cette activité par passion et pour ne pas rester inactive. Elle sollicite un crédit de 500 000 frs destine a l’achat de mil, mais, blé, d’aliment de moutons et de cheval pour renforcer son activité. Ses bénéfices  réalisés lui permettent de satisfaire ses besoins personnels et d’améliorer le cadre de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Ms. Aminata S. is a 46-year-old woman from Yoff.  She lives in the Layenne district to be more precise.  She has a been a member of the lending group U-IMCEC in Yoff since December 2002.  She is married and the mother of two children, who range from 15 to 19 years of age.  Aminata is a merchant who sells grain, livestock feed, and various other items used by traditional practitioners.  She has been advancing in this sector since 2005.  Due to the fact she was unsuccessful in school, she chose this business out of passion and to be active. Aminata is requesting a loan of 500,000 francs destined for buying millet, corn, wheat, and feed for sheep and horses in order to bolster her business.  Her profits enable her to satisfy her personnel needs and to improve her family's living conditions. 

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing her funds

loans.name: Dina Magda

texts.es:
Nuestra socia Dina pertenece al Banco Comunal “Qory Orcco” de la Asociación Arariwa, tiene 47 años, es conviviente y tiene cuatro hijos. Dina alterna sus actividades del hogar con la atención de su botica “Cristo San Salvador” de la ciudad de Izcuchaca de la provincia de Anta del Departamento del Cusco. La socia nos cuenta que ya es un  año que participa en el banco comunal y para este nuevo ciclo, ella requiere el crédito para comprar más mercadería como por ejemplo pastillas y antibióticos.  

La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.

(Los socios del banco comunal se reúnen cada treinta días en la ciudad de Pucyura que es distrito de la ciudad de Anta del Departamento del Cusco, Pucyura se encuentra ubicada a 40 minutos de la ciudad de Cusco).
texts.en:
Dina belongs to the communal bank "Qory Orcco," which is part of the Asociación Arariwa. She is 47 years old, lives with a partner and has 4 children. Dina alternates her activities in the home with attending to her pharmacy "Christo San Salvador" in the city of Izcuchaca in the Anta province of the department of Cusco. She tells us that she has already participated in the communal bank for a year. For this new loan cycle, she needs a loan to buy more merchandise such as, for example, pills and antibiotics. Dina is grateful for the opportunity provided through these means and likewise pledges to make her payments according to the established schedule. (The members of this communal bank meet every 30 days in the city of Pucyura in the Anta district of the department of Cusco. Pucyura is located 40 minutes from the city of Cusco.)

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy merchandise including pills and antibiotics

loans.name: Doña Nubia Group

texts.es:
The Doña Nubia Group is made of three women that mutually support one another.  The coordinator of the group is Señora Nubia Mejía, she began her business eight years ago.  Nubia sells cooked black beans which are a high demand product because it is a very big part of the Nicaraguan diet.  With the income from this business she began making pinol and pinolillo, these are typical Nicaraguan drinks made from corn and coco, repochetas, which is a dish consisting of fried tortillas with refried black beans, cheese and a cabbage salad, and costuras, another typical Nicaraguan dish. Nubia would like to invest the money from this loan to purchase an industrial kitchen so she can begin making her own tortillas. 

Also in the group are Natalia A. Sánchez and Agustina P. O..  Natalia has a small store, while Agustina sells tortillas, cooked beans, cheese, cream, moronga, sausage, and more.
texts.en:
The Doña Nubia Group is made of three women that mutually support one another. The coordinator of the group is Señora Nubia Mejía, she began her business eight years ago. Nubia sells cooked black beans which are a high demand product because it is a very big part of the Nicaraguan diet. With the income from this business she began making pinol and pinolillo, these are typical Nicaraguan drinks made from corn and coconut, repochetas, which is a dish consisting of fried tortillas with refried black beans, cheese and a cabbage salad, and costuras, another typical Nicaraguan dish. Nubia would like to invest the money from this loan to purchase an industrial kitchen so she can begin making her own tortillas. Also in the group are Natalia A. S. and Agustina P. O.. Natalia has a small store, while Agustina sells tortillas, cooked beans, cheese, cream, moronga, sausage, and more.

Translated from Spanish by Esteban Riojas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase an industrial kitchen so she can begin making her own tortillas

loans.name: Paterna

texts.en:
Paterna M. is a married woman who supports her family by running a general store and fish vending. She lives in Brgy Culipapa, Hinoba-an, Negros Occidental with her husband Noel and their seven children who are 14 to 25 years old. Two of her children have their own families and the other five are going to school.

She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 1999 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her general store and fish vending business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She earns an average monthly income of PHP 20,000.

Paterna is now borrowing PHP 29,500 so that she can maintain operation of her general store and fish vending business. This will be her 20th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 29,500, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Paterna aspires to elevate her family’s living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the “Dungganon” way.  

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Herlinda

texts.es:
Herlinda, de 50 años, es una mujer muy sencilla y trabajadora, vive en su propia casa junto a sus dos hijos de 29 y 23 años, a quienes desea dar una mejor vida.

El trabajo al que se dedica es el cultivo de papas, zanahorias, alverjas, etc. Todos los días, muy temprano por la mañana, trabaja en sus chacras, ya que sabe que el dinero que obtenga por sus productos dependerá mucho de la calidad de su cosecha. Ella vende sus productos en los mercados de Tarma y La Merced, puesto que es donde mejor le pagan.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cosechar sus tierras, ya que así siente que los meses de trabajo han tenido sus frutos. Lleva 20 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es fumigar sus tierras, puesto que siempre hay el peligro de que los químicos la enfermen.

Este es el sétimo préstamo de Herlinda con MFP, manifiesta que el dinero del crédito le ayudará mucho en el progreso de su trabajo. En su banco comunal es muy querida por el resto de sus compañeras, ya que es muy solidaria con ellas. Los dos mil nuevos soles solicitados los invertirá en la compra de insecticidas, ya que desea tener unos campos libres de plagas.
texts.en:
Herlinda, 50, is an unassuming and hardworking woman who lives in her own home with her 2 children who are 29 and 27. She hopes to give them a better life. She cultivates potatoes, carrots, peas, etc. Each day, very early in the morning, she works in her fields, since she knows that the money she gets for her products will depend very much on the quality of her harvest. She sells her products in the markets of Tarma and La Merced, since this is where they pay the most. What she likes most about her job is harvesting her lands, since this is when the months of hard work bear fruit. She has worked in agriculture for 20 years, and what she considers most difficult is to fumigate her fields with insecticide, since there is always the risk that the chemicals will make her sick. This is Herlinda's 7th loan with MFP, and she states that the money from the loans will help her very much in making progress in her work. In her communal bank she is well-liked by her fellow members, since she is very supportive of them. The 2,000 Peruvian soles requested will be used to purchase insecticides, since she wants to have fields that are free of pests.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy insecticides

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Julia, de 35 años, es una madre de familia muy amorosa y trabajadora, vive en una casa alquilada junto a su esposo Iván de 40 años y sus tres menores hijos, a los que desea dar una mejor vida.

Junto a su esposo trabaja todos los días en sus cultivos. Con mucho esfuerzo ha logrado que sus tierras sean muy productivas y ahora siembra de todo, ya que sabe que todo producto que obtenga será de calidad. Principalmente siembra alverja, ya que esta menestra se está vendiendo muy bien en el mercado.
Por otro lado, lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cuidar sus sembríos de las plagas que pueden afectarlas, lleva 10 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus cultivos hasta el mercado mayorista de la ciudad.
Para el futuro de su negocio, espera juntar el dinero necesario para tener un puesto de venta en el mercado mayorista, ya que actualmente vende de forma ambulatoria.

Este es el sexto préstamo de Julia con MFP, siente que este crédito le ayudará mucho en el desarrollo de su actividad. En su banco comunal es una socia muy responsable, de lo cual se siente muy orgullosa. Los dos mil nuevos soles solicitados los invertirá en mejorar sus cultivos, para ello comprará abono e insecticidas.
texts.en:
Julia, 35, is a hardworking and loving mother who lives in a rented home with her husband Ivan, 40, and their 3 minor children. She wants to give her children a better life. She works with her husband each day on the crops they are growing. With a lot of effort, they have managed to make their lands very productive and now they cultivate everything, since they know that all of the products they obtain will be of a good quality. They mainly plant peas, since pea stew is selling very well in the markets. What she likes most about her work is to care for the crops so they can avoid the pests that can affect them. She has been doing this work for 10 years and what she considers most difficult is to transport her harvested crops to the wholesale market of the city. For the future, she hopes to gather together the money to have a stall in the wholesale market, since currently she sells as a street vendor. This is Julia's 6th loan with MFP, and she feels that this loan will be a great help in developing her business. In her communal bank she is proud of the fact that she is a very responsible member. The 2,000 Peruvian soles requested will be used to improve her cultivations; to do this she will buy fertilizer and insecticides.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and insecticides

loans.name: Jogemma

texts.en:
Jogemma P. is a married woman who supports her family by fish vending. She lives in Brgy Jose Mina, Sipalay City, Negros Occidental with her husband who helps her in selling fish and their two children who are 14 and 29 years old. Their older child is already married and the younger child is currently going school.

She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 1998 of August and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her fish vending business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 20,000.

Jogemma is now borrowing PHP 26,500 so that she can continue maintaining her fish vending business. This will be her 12th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 25,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Jogemma aspires to elevate her family’s living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the “Dungganon” way.  What you see in the picture is Jogemma and her husband selling fish.

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: As additional working capital

loans.name: Luzmila

texts.es:
Luzmila, de 30 años, es una madre de familia que siempre ha luchado por salir adelante. Vive en la casa de su suegra, junto a su esposo Fredy de 25 años y su querido hijo Bryan, a quien desea brindar unos buenos estudios.

Los verdes campos del poblado de “Huaracayo” han sido, en la vida de Luzmila, un lugar muy agradable para trabajar. Desde muy pequeña sus padres le enseñaron esta labor y ahora ella tiene sus propias tierras en las que trabaja con mucho esmero y sacrificio.
Lo que más le gusta es cultivas las alverjas y choclos, lleva 20 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus cultivos, hasta el lugar donde los vende en el mercado de la ciudad. Con el tiempo, espera poner un pequeño puesto en el mercado, ya que siente que pierde mucho al vender sus productos al por mayor.

Este es el sétimo préstamo de Luzmila con MFP, sabe que tiene la responsabilidad de pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente y está dispuesta a hacerlo. Dentro su banco comunal siempre está al tanto de todos los acuerdos a los que llegan sus compañeros. Con los quinientos nuevos soles solicitados comprará semillas de alverja, ya que esta menestra se está vendiendo muy bien en el mercado.
texts.en:
Luzmila is 30 years old. She is a mother who has always worked hard to get ahead. She lives in her mother-in-law's house, along with her husband Fredy, age 25, and their beloved son Bryan, whom they hope to provide with a good education. Luzmila has always found the green fields of the village of Huaracayo a very agreeable place to work. Starting when she was very small, her parents taught her how to farm, and now she has her own land, which she cultivates with great dedication and sacrifice. What Luzmila likes most is growing peas and corn. She has been doing this work for 20 years, and she thinks the hardest part is transporting her crops to be sold in the city's market. Someday she hopes to open a small stall in the market herself, since she feels that she loses a lot by selling her products wholesale. This is Luzmila's seventh loan with MFP. She knows she is responsible for making all of her payments on time, and she is ready to do so. Within her communal bank, she is always well-informed about the agreements made by her fellow members. With the five hundred Peruvian new soles she is requesting, she will buy pea seeds, since peas are currently selling very well at the market.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying pea seeds

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Peter is a 30-year-old father to a one-year-old child. He owns rental houses in Kibera slums in Nairobi and earns extra income through housing agency services. He has requested his third loan of Kes. 80,000 to renovate his rental houses. He describes himself as ambitious and thus hopes to own rental houses in high class estates of Nairobi. Since joining Faulu, Peter claims that his income has grown.

loans.use: To renovate his rental houses

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce J. is a married woman who supports her family by operating a general store and selling rice. She lives in Brgy. Payao, Binalbagan, Negros Occidental with her husband Jonathan and their four children who are in school.

She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2000 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her general store and rice retailing business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 10,000.

Joyce is now borrowing PHP 29,500 so that she can maintain her general store and rice retailing business. This will be her 17th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 29,500, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Joyce aspires to elevate her family’s living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the “Dungganon” way.  

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: As additional working capital

loans.name: Los Tesoro Group

texts.en:
The Tesoro Group is a group of three woman entrepreneurs. This group is very familiar with ADIM and has participated in the development programs ADIM offers. The program focuses on gender differences, business development, and is intended to help entrepreneurs, especially female ones, to value themselves as business owners and to be very successful.

The coordinator of this group is Señora Deyanira D. C. M. M.. Two years ago, at the insistence of her son Charly, Deyanira began a video game arcade called “Club de Nintendo Charly”. When she began this business she only had one Nintendo; now, thanks to the loans with ADIM, she has three PlayStations and the business has grown a lot. She would like to have a more diverse array of gaming devices, but for now she will use this loan to buy one more PlayStation and to maintain those she has.

The other group members are Yaneth Sánchez Medieta and Flor de María Q. Sevilla. Yaneth sells lingerie and Flor makes and sells tortillas. Both of them will use this loan to buy merchandise and ingredients for their respective businesses.

loans.use: To buy another PlayStation gaming console and maintain the ones she already has

loans.name: Ines Aurora

texts.es: La Sra Inés Aurora M. D. C. D. 56 años D. edad, es viuda tiene 1 hijo menor que depenD. D. ella. Tiene casa propia D. material noble. Trabaja como obrera D. campo en una empresa agroindustrial desD. hace 2 años. Adicionalmente percibe otro ingreso como pensionista en la ONP por Viudez. Gracias a su empeño y esfuerzo esta sacando adelante a su hijo, esta logrando adquirir sus bienes. Requiere el crédito para mejoramiento D. vivienda ya que fue afectada por el terremoto del 2007. Su sueño es terminar D. construir su vivienda para lograr una mejor calidad D. vida. Esta muy agradecida por el apoyo que le podamos brindar a través D. este financiamiento.
texts.en:
Inés Aurora M. D. C. is 56 years old. She is a widow with one child who is still dependent on her. She has her own house, which is constructed from solid materials. For the past two years, she has worked as a rural laborer for an agroindustrial company. She also has income from a pension she receives from the ONP (government pension office) as a widow. Thanks to her hard work and dedication, she is helping her son make progress and get what he needs. She is requesting this loan to improve her home, since it was affected by the 2007 earthquake. Her dream is to complete the construction of her home in order to achieve a better quality of life. She is very grateful for the support that we are able to proviD. to her through this financing.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Improving her home

loans.name: Pamela

texts.en:
Pamela S. is a married woman who supports her family by operating a mini grocery store and sugarcane farm. She lives in Payao, Binalbagan Negros Occidental with her husband, Joey, and their 5 children. The children are all of school age.

She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2000 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her mini grocery and sugarcane plantation business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 10,000.

Pamela is now borrowing PHP 29,500 so that she could continue having sufficient inventory to sell in her mini grocery. This will be her 19th cycle loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 29,500, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Pamela aspires to elevate her family’s living conditions and to ensure their future wellbeing by following the “Dungganon” way.  

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe D. is a married woman who supports her family by fattening pigs to resell and also by selling rice grain. She lives in Bungyod, Cabacungan La Castellana Negros Occidental with her husband and their 8 children who are 23 to 42 years old.  Some of their children have their own families and the single ones are working to help the family.

Fe has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 1993 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her pig fattening and selling rice grains business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 5,000.

Fe is now borrowing PHP 20,000 so that she could continue with her pig fattening and rice grains businesses. This will be her 18th cycle loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 19,500, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Fe aspires to elevate her family’s living conditions and to ensure their future wellbeing by following the “Dungganon” way.  

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Agbéhomilo

texts.fr:
Cette femme  exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce en gros de bijoux et bazins, elle s’approvisionne  à  Dubaï, elle fait ce commerce depuis 2008, beaucoup de revendeuse du grand marché viennent s’approvisionner chez elle, voulant se réapprovisionner elle sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour se réapprovisionner en bijoux et bazins
Elle est célibataire et c’est avec le revenu de son commerce qu’elle subvient à ses besoins.
texts.en:
To make a living, Agbéhomilo A. buys and sells wholesale jewelery and damask fabric. She stocks up on supplies in Dubai. She has done this work since 2008. Many traders from the central market come to buy supplies from her. Wanting to restock, she is asking for a loan from WAGES to purchase more jewelery and damask. She is single, and she meets her needs with the revenue made from her trade.

Translated from French by Kelly Percival, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of jewelery and damask fabric

loans.name: Giovanna Janeth

texts.es:
Giovanna tiene 25 años de edad, es casada y tiene un hijo de tres años, su esposo trabaja en la ciudad de Lima y vive con ellos por temporadas cortas, durante sus vacaciones. Su vivienda está ubicada en el distrito de Paiján, provincia de Ascope, en la región La Libertad, ubicada a tres horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Desde hace más de dos años instaló en su vivienda una bodega en la que ofrece a sus clientes productos de primera necesidad, abarrotes y todo tipo de bebidas. Ella nos comenta que pudo instalar en negocio gracias al dinero que su esposo le envía desde la ciudad de Lima, donde trabaja como operador de maquinaria pesada.

El negocio goza de buena acogida, ya que su vivienda está ubicada al lado de la carretera Panamericana (la principal via asfaltada del país que atraviesa la ciudad), por lo que no sólo sus vecinos, sino que también los choferes que frecuentan la zona llegan a consumir los productos que ofrece.

Giovanna está solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles que planea utilizar en la compra de más bebidas para ampliar su negocio por temporada de verano.

Ella es una joven alegre y muy dinámica, su mayor anhelo es poder brindarle a su hijo una educación de calidad que le garantice un futuro prometedor.
texts.en:
Giovanna is 25 years old and married with a three-year-old son. Her husband works in the city of Lima and lives with them on a seasonal basis, during his vacations. Their house is located in Paiján District, Ascope Province, in the La Libertad Region about three hours from the city of Chiclayo. For more than two years, she has been running a small neighborhood store from her house. She offers her customers basic necessities, grocery items and a variety of drinks. She tells us that she was able to launch this business thanks to the money her husband sends her from Lima, where he works as a heavy machinery operator. Her business does well, since it is located next to the Pan American Highway (the main paved road that goes through the city). She not only serves her neighbors; the drivers who pass through the area also visit her store to consume the products she offers. Giovanna is requesting her first loan from Edpyme Alternativa. She is asking for 2000 Peruvian Soles to buy more drinks in order to expand her business for the summer season. She is a very cheerful, dynamic young woman. Her greatest dream is to provide her son with a high-quality education in order to secure him a promising future.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy drinks to expand her store for the summer season

loans.name: Fatimas De La Concepcion

texts.es: Fátima tiene 49 años, su actividad económica es la venta de mercadería en general y una pulpería. Hace más de 6 años que se dedica a este negocio ya que desde que inicio ofrece sus productos de manera ambulante y ha luchado fuertemente para obtener estos ingresos. Los propósitos de ella para su negocio son de aplicar nuevas técnicas de pago para sus clientes ya si pueda obtener su dinero en tiempo y forma. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo en la compra de mercadería en general como ropa, cosméticos y otros productos variados. Los deseos de ella son de mejorar su condición económica de su familia.
texts.en:
Fátima is 49 years old and sells general merchandise and runs a snack stand. She has had this business for more than six years. In the beginning she worked as a street vendor, and she has fought hard to earn a living. With her business, she strives to offer her clients new payment options so that she can receive her income in a timely manner. She is requesting this loan to use as working capital in order to buy general merchandise like clothing, cosmetics and a variety of other products. Her dream is to improve her family's economic situation.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy clothing, cosmetics and a variety of other products

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena Q. is a 47-year old married woman who lives in Binucot Pob, Sta. Catalina Negros Orriental. She earns her living by running a general store and also from hog-raising.

Elena’s husband, Fernando, is a 48-year-old truck driver who does his best  to provide for his wife and any children that they might have in the near future. Elena joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1999 in the hopes that she would be able to help her husband improve the quality of life of their family. With the help of her loans from NWTF-PD she has been able to increase their family income by engaging in a general store and hog-raising business. Now she earns an average monthly income of PHP 6,000 from her business activities.

Elena is a member in good standing. Her previous loan of PHP 19,500 was used to fund the operations of her general store and her hog-raising business. The loan process had a positive impact on both the business and the family’s living conditions. Now she is borrowing her 11th cycle loan, amounting to PHP 19,500. She also intends to use this loan towards her general store and hog-raising businesses. Elena is working hard to achieve her dreams and aspirations for her family, which is to provide them with a brighter future and a more comfortable life.

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Mario Antonio

texts.es:
El señor Mario Antonio M. A., es casado tiene 2 hijos pequeños y con su familia vive en el humilde Barrio San Igancio, el señor tiene 39 años de edad, y se dedica a la siembra de la piña desde hace 16 años.

Dentro de las prioridades a futuro esta la compra de un vehiculo para transportar la produccion y venderla de forma rápida y segura, dentro de las planificaciones que tiene para su siembra esta diversificación de otros cultivos tales como el café, pero como ha tenido problemas de afectacion de sus tierras por la quema de sol, solicita un prestamo para la compra de materiales agricolas que brinden un mantenimiento óptimo a las tierras que lo beneficien a futuro en la buena cosecha de sus cultivos, este apoyo les ayudara de sobremanera en la venta de un producto de calidad, permitiendoles un aumento en los ingresos para la inversión de futuros proyectos de familia.
texts.en:
Señor Mario Antonio M. A. is married and has two small children. He lives with his family in the humble neighborhood of San Ignacio. He is 39 years old and has been planting pineapples for the past 16 years. In the future, he hopes to buy a vehicle to transport his fruit and sell it quickly and safely. He also hopes to start planting other crops such as coffee, but he has had trouble with his land getting overexposed to the sun. He is requesting a loan to buy agricultural inputs to nourish his lands so that he will have good harvests in the future. This will help him grow quality products and earn more so that he can invest in future projects for his family.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fertilizers and agricultural inputs

loans.name: Delia Filomena

texts.es: Delia Filomena H. M. tiene una pequeña pulpería la cual inicio con la comercialización de chiverías, gaseosas, dulces pero con el tiempo y los préstamos fue mejorando el negocio con la compra de mayor variedad de productos. Actualmente esta señora de 51 años  invertirá en  granos básicos, carne, embutidos, enlatados, refrescos etc.… ya que estos son productos muy buscados por sus clientes.
texts.en:
Delia Filomena H. M. runs a small grocery store. She started out by selling dairy products, soft drinks and sweets, but over time and with the help of loans, she has gradually expanded her business by stocking a greater variety of products. Currently, this 51-year-old woman will invest in bulk grains and beans, meat, sausages, canned foods, soft drinks, etc., since these products are very popular with her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing bulk grains and beans, meat, sausages, etc.

loans.name: Rafatou

texts.fr: Cette dame, est une femme  mariée elle vit dans le quartier d’agoè zongo avec son mari. En 2005 elle s’est lancée dans le commerce de pagnes et de tissus bazins, elle s’approvisionne au grand marché de Lomé, le revenu de son activité lui permet de contribuer aux dépenses de son foyer, voulant se réapprovisionner, elle sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour acheter des pagnes et des tissus bazins.
texts.en:
Rafatou T. is a married woman who lives in the Agoè Zongo quarter with her husband. In 2005 she entered the pagne (a traditional wrap-around) and damask fabric trade. She stocks up on supplies at the central market in Lomé. The revenue she makes from this work allows her to contribute to her household expenses. Wanting to restock, she is asking for a loan from WAGES to purchase pagne and damask fabric.

Translated from French by Kelly Percival, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of pagne and damask fabric

loans.name: Ronard

texts.en: Ronard is the 43-year-old father of five children who are in school. He owns a welding and fabrication business in Nairobi and says he has been doing well in his business. He has requested his first loan of Kes. 30,000 to buy a place to display his wares. He describes himself as a man of excellence and hopes to excel in business and get big contracts for his welding business.

loans.use: Buy a place to display his wares

loans.name: La Vi Map Cherche Group

texts.en:
The La Vi Map Cheche or I'm looking for Life group 4 is happy to be receiving their 1st loan. After hearing about all the good things from other group members, the group is excited to create their own success stories. Though the group is from a small rural town it has a variety of businesses, including animal sales, charcoal making, furniture making and sales, and purchasing of goods from the border town of the Dominican Republic. Morel J. P., a group representative, is a husband and father to 5 children.

Morel makes a living by selling animals, which he buys in rural towns, to sell in more urban areas. He is a community leader and was excited to help other business people develop their activity with a loan from Esperanza. He hopes to grow his business and see the community continue to develop with the help of Esperanza. On behalf of Morel, La Vi Map Cheche, and Esperanza we thank you for your support.

loans.use: To purchase animals to raise and sell.

loans.name: Los Bailarines Group

texts.es:
El grupo los Bailarines está integrado por tres personas humildes y trabajadoras ellos son  Blas Antonio F., María Ines M. Mejía y Jenny Vanessa M. García. El señor Blas Antonio F. apesar de tener 78 años de edad es una persona muy activa e independiente quien desde 2002 tiene su propio negocio una pulperia en la cual va invertir el credito con la compra de productos como granos básicos, queso, confitería, pollo, coca-cola y  pan entre otros.
 
Mientras Jenny Vanessa M. García comenzo vendiendo por encargo luego puso su pequeña tienda donde incio con una docena de ropa. Actualmente su negocio es más gran y requiere de mayor cantidad de inverción  en ropa y    María Ines M. Mejía de 25 años de edad comercializa perfumes desde el 2006.
texts.en:
The group "Los Bailarines" (The Dancers) is made up of three humble and hard-working people. They are Blas Antonio F., Maria Ines M. M. and Jenny Vanessa M. G.. Sr. Blas Antonio F. is 78 years old, and is a very active and independent person. Since 2002, he has had his own business, a local store in which he will invest the loan for the purchase of products such as basic grains, cheese, pastries, chicken, Coca-cola and bread, among other things.

Meanwhile, Jenny Vanessa M. G. began selling to order, then she put her small store where she began with a dozen clothes. Currently, her business is bigger and requires a greater amount of investment in clothing. Maria Ines M. M. is 25 years old and has been marketing perfumes since 2006.

Translated from Spanish by Amy McGinty, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase basic grains, meat, fruits, and vegetables, etc.

loans.name: Safy

texts.fr: Madame Safy M. est une femme mariée de 29 ans. Elle habite a Ouest-Foire une cite de la banlieue qui se trouve non loin de la localité de Yoff. Elle est societaire de la caisse de l’U-IMCEC Yoff depuis juillet 2009. Elle n’a jamais bénéficié de prêt au sein de l’institution. Madame M. a 4 enfants dont l’âge varie entre 2 ans et demi et 14 ans.  Elle est secrétaire a Polyconsult  une entreprise de la place. Son objectif actuel est de démarrer une activité commerciale de vente de produits  cosmétiques. Elle est secrétaire depuis 5 ans. L’idée d’avoir une activité parallèle lui est venue du conseil de son mari. Elle sollicite un crédit de 500 000 frs pour acheter les produits cosmétiques  et des tissus à placer. Son intention avec les profits qu’elle va réaliser est d’assister son mari et prendre en charge une partie des dépenses quotidiennes qui deviennent de plus en plus lourdes.
texts.en:
Madame Safy M. is a 29-year-old, married woman. She lives in Ouest-Foire, a city on the outskirts of Yoff. She has been a member of the U-IMCEC bank of Yoff since July of 2009. She has never received a loan from this organization. Mrs. M. has four children between the ages of two and fourteen. She is a secretary at Polyconsult, a local business. Her current goal is to enter the cosmetics trade. She has been a secretary for five years. The idea of having an alternative activity came at the advice of her husband. She is asking for a loan of 500,000 FRS to buy cosmetic products and fabrics. With the profits, she intends to help her husband and contribute to their daily expenses which are becoming more and more difficult.

Translated from French by Kelly Percival, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Start-up fund

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase livestock

loans.name: Essohanam

texts.fr: Cette dame est une résidente du quartier d’agbalépédo, elle vit avec son mari et ses 02 enfants. Elle s’est lancée en 2007 dans le commerce des céréales, plus précisément le maïs qui est très utilisé dans la cuisine togolaise pour préparer la pâte. Elle s’approvisionne à notsè parce que le maïs est moins  coûteux dans cette ville, ainsi elle réalise plus de bénéfice sur ses ventes. Son stock est en baisse, elle veut se réapprovisionner raison pour laquelle elle sollicite de WAGES son premier crédit pour acheter 20 sacs de céréales et assurer le transport des marchandises.
texts.en:
Essohanam K. is a resident of the Agbalépédo quarter. She lives with her husband and their two children. She entered the cereal trade in 2007, more specifically trading maize which is used often in Togolese cuisine to make dough. She stocks up on supplies in Notsè because maize is less expensive there; she can thus make a larger profit from her sales. Her stock is diminishing, and she would like to restock. She is asking for her first loan from WAGES to buy 20 bags of cereals and assure the transport of her merchandise.

Translated from French by Kelly Percival, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cereals

loans.name: Isaura Suyen

texts.es: El principal comercio de la joven Isaura, es la venta de ropa y cosméticos, tiene 28 años de edad, madre de dos hijos que junto a su esposo trabajan para poder cubrir los gastos, su esposo trabaja en la empresa Pepsi como contador. Este negocio de Isaura lo inicio con fondo que  su esposo dio y ganancias de ventas que le daban a vender es por eso nace la iniciativa de vender variedad de productos. Lo que mas desea Isaura es poder tener su propia casa ya que aun vive con su mama, es por eso se esfuerza mucho en las ventas ya que su esposo con el dinero que gana esta pagando una casa financiada por los proyecto del gobierno que espera pronto poder gozar de esta bendición de tener su casa. Afodenic avenido a mejorar el ámbito del comercio ya que ha logrado invertir en su negocio lo cual con este préstamo invertirá en la compra de cosméticos, ropa, zapatos ya que tiene poca mercadería la cual vende al contado y al crédito a sus clietes.
texts.en:
Isaura's primary business is the sales of clothing and cosmetics. She is 28 years old and the mother of 2 children. Together, Isaura and her husband work to be able to cover the expenses. Her husband works at Pepsi as an accountant. Isaura began her business with her husband's funds that he gave her and with the profits that the sales gave them, the idea was born to sell a variety of products. What Isaura wishes for most is to be able to have her own house since she still lives with her mother. For this reason, she puts forth a lot of effort in her sales. Her husband, with the money that he is earning, is paying for a house financed by a government project. She soon hopes to be able to enjoy the blessing of having her own house.

Afodenic is well-suited to improve the business environment since it is investing in her business. With this loan she will invest in the purchase of cosmetics, clothing, and shoes, since she has little merchandise to sell by cash and by credit to her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Amy McGinty, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothing, shoes, and cosmetics to improve her sales

loans.name: Maria De Los Angeles

texts.es: Maria De los Ángeles tiene la edad de 46 años, ella es casada y tiene 1 hijos que trabaja de manera independiente. Su actividad económica es la venta de abarrotería. Hace más de 4 años que se dedica a este negocio, así es como ella da comienzo a este medio de vida, por lo que le ayudo mucho en su economía. Es por esto que el principal propósito es invertir en productos de calidad para satisfacer a sus clientes. El financiamiento de que solicita es para capital de trabajo y con esto comprar los productos como golosinas en general, refrescos naturales y detergentes. El deseo de ella es  convertir su abarrotería en una distribuidora.
texts.en:
Maria De los Ángeles is 46 years old. She is married and has one son who works in an independent manner. Her business is the sale of groceries. She has been in this business for more than four years, and she only started it in the middle of her life, and it helps her economic situation a lot. The main purpose is to invest in quality products in order to satisfy her customers. The loan that she is requesting is for working capital, with which she will buy products such as general candies, natural soft drinks, and detergents. Her wish is to convert from a grocery store to a distributor.

Translated from Spanish by Amy McGinty, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Tsalom

texts.fr: Ce jeune homme  est un célibataire et réside dans le quartier de Tokoin wuiti, pour subvenir à ses propres charges, il s’est lancée en 2005 dans le commerce de cartes de recharges, ce commerce marche très bien à Lomé, car il y a 3 entreprises de téléphonie mobile sur place  et les togolais consomment beaucoup en crédit de communication, il fait ce commerce de façon ambulante. Actuellement la demande de ses clients est élevée pour se réapprovisionner, il sollicite donc de WAGES son premier crédit pour l’achat de cartes de recharges de TOGOCELL, MOOV et ILLICO.
texts.en:
Tsalom K. is a single young man who lives in the Tokoin Wuiti quarter. To provide for his needs, he entered the top-up card trade in 2005. This trade is very good in Lomé because there are three cellular phone businesses and the Togolese use a lot of communication credit. He does his business moving place to place. Nowadays, his clients' demands are very high. He is asking for his first loan from WAGES to restock and purchase top-up cards from TogoCell, Moov, and Illico.

Translated from French by Kelly Percival, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of top-up cards

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase livestock

loans.name: Joséphine

texts.fr: G. Joséphine est née vers 1967 à Kpomassè à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Joséphine vit à Cocotomey, un quartier de Cotonou, depuis environ 18 ans. Mariée à VIHO Antoine, un cuisinier,  Joséphine est mère de quatre enfants qui sont tous scolarisés. Joséphine a également un autre enfant à charge. Joséphine vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Joséphine vient en aide à son mari pour supporter les charges de la famille. Pour subvenir aux besoins de la famille, Joséphine exerce comme activité, la vente de sacs d’oignons, de piments et de façon secondaire Joséphine vend également de la tomate fraiche. Joséphine effectue ses achats au marché de Sékou, dans le département de l’atlantique, et à Ouègbo au Bénin. La livraison de ses produits se fait aux revendeuses de Cococodji, un quartier de Cotonou. Cela fait bientôt 8 ans que Joséphine exerce son activité bien que n’ayant pas fréquenté l’école. Joséphine a déjà obtenu un crédit auprès de ALIDé, crédit qui a été bien remboursé. Joséphine désire augmenter sa quantité d’approvisionnement afin de mieux faire face à la demande sans cesse croissante des revendeuses des marchés de Cocotomey mais est limitée par les moyens financiers. C’est la raison pour laquelle Joséphine sollicite auprès de ALIDé un deuxième crédit.
texts.en:
G. Joséphine was born around 1967 in Kpomassè in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. She has been living in Cocotomey, a district of Cotonou, for about eighteen years.  Married to VIHO Antoine, a cook, she is the mother of four children, who have all had schooling.  She also has another child to support.  Joséphine helps out her husband in supporting the family. To provide for the family, Joséphine has a business selling sacks of onions, and she sells chili peppers on the side.  She also sells fresh tomatoes. She makes her purchases at the Sékou market, in Atlantique County, and in Ouègbo, in Benin.  Her goods are delivered to retailers of Cococodji, a district of Cotonou.  She has been in this business for nearly eight years, even though she did not attend school.  She has already had an ALIDé loan, which has been repaid.  She would like to have more supplies in order to cope better with the ever-growing demand of the retailers of the Cocotomey market.  But she is limited by her financial means.  This is the reason why Joséphine is requesting a second loan from ALIDé. 

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying five baskets of tomatoes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To make improvements to her farm

loans.name: Kokouvi

texts.fr: ce monsieur est un père de famille et a 05 personnes à sa charge, il exerce comme activité la soudure des automobiles, il a ouvert son propre garage, il achète aussi des pièces détachées qu'il revend à ses clients. il exerce ce commerce depuis 2006, la qualité de ses services fait grandir sa clientèle. actuellement il a besoin de moteur pour réparer le véhicule d'un de ses clients, pour cela il sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour l'achat d'un moteur de voiture.
texts.en:
This gentleman is a family man who has five people in his care.  His work involves welding and automobiles.  He has opened his own garage.  He also buys replacement parts, which he resells to his customers.  He has been in this business since 2006.  His customer base is expanding due to the quality of his services.  Right now, he needs a motor for repairing a customer's vehicle.  To do so, he's requesting a loan from WAGES for buying an automobile engine. 

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying a car engine

loans.name: Anne-Marie

texts.fr: Née le 30 juin 1969 à Agbangnizoun au Bénin, K. Anne-Marie vit depuis 22 ans à Cocotomey, un quartier de Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Mariée à ZOUNDJIHANDE Françis, un revendeur de pièces détachées, Anne-Marie est mère de trois enfants qui sont tous scolarisés. Le couple vit ensemble avec ses enfants et se partage les charges familiales. Pour venir en aide à son mari, Anne-Marie vend à son domicicle dans une baraque,  des condiments (cubes, épices écrasés)  et des poissons fris. C'est à Ouègbo et Comè, que Anne-Marie s'approvisionne. Anne-Marie n'a pas fréquenté l'école mais exerce son activité depuis 10 ans. Anne-Marie avait déjà obtenu un crédit qu'elle a bien remboursé auprès de ALIDé. Anne-Marie désire augmenter son sotck de produit et c'est pour cela qu'elle sollicite un deuxième prêt.
texts.en:
Born on the 30th of June, 1969 in Agbangnizoun, Benin, Anne-Marie K. has lived for the past 22 years in the Cocotomey quarter of Benin's economic capital, Cotonou. She is married to Françis Zoundjihande, who makes his living selling spare machine parts, and the couple has three school-educated children. They live together with their children, and both parents see to the family's needs. To help her husband, Anne-Marie works from home, selling condiments (stock cubes and ground spices) and fried fish; she sources these goods from Ouègbo and Comè. She did not attend school, but has been working for ten years. She has already received one loan from ALIDé that has been successfully repaid. Anne-Marie is looking to increase her stock levels and so is seeking her second loan.

Translated from French by Danielle Treharne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The purchase of condiments and fish

loans.name: Salamba

texts.fr: Madame Salamba S.  est une sociétaire de la caisse de l’U-IMCEC depuis novembre 2003. Elle a déjà bénéficié  de 4 prêts  antérieurs au sein de l’institution.  Elle habite à Yoff Ndeungagne. Elle est âgée de 40 ans et s’active depuis plus de 10ans dans la couture. Sa spécialité est la confection de pagnes tisses. Parallèlement  elle vend des tissus, des draps et des chaussures. C’est sa mère qui l’a  influence dans l’activité  de couture. Ce qui la passionne dans cette activité c’est le fait de confectionner de jolies créations. Elle sollicite un crédit de 500 000 frs en vue d’acheter des tissus. L’accroissement de ses bénéfices lui permettra de mieux assister sa famille dans l’amélioration de sa condition de vie.
texts.en:
Ms. Salamba S. has been a member of the lending group U-IMCEC since November 2003.  She has already benefited from four previous loans with this micro-finance institution.  She lives in Yoff Ndeungagne. She is 40 years old and has been active for over ten years as a clothier.  Her specialty is making woven pagnes (colorful West African cloth).  Along with this, she sells fabrics, bed sheets, and shoes.  Her mother is the one who guided her work as a clothier.  What makes Salamba passionate about her work is being able to create pretty things.  Salamba is requesting a loan of 500,000 francs with the aim of buying some fabrics.  The growth in her profits will enable her to help her family further in improving living conditions.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing her working capital

loans.name: Emani Doris

texts.fr: cette jeune dame est mariée mais elle n'a pas d'enfants, elle vit avec son mari dans le quartier de Kégué, elle a appris le métier de la coiffure et a ouvert son propre atelier depuis 2006, elle a appelé son atelier "GALAXY COIFFURE", elle a associé à son commerce la vente de  produits de beauté et de mèches, elle a déjà obtenu de WAGES un crédit qu'elle a remboursé sans difficulté, voulant se réapprovisionner en produits de beauté et en mèches, elle sollicite de WAGES un deuxième crédit pour l'achat de divers produits de beauté et de mèches.
texts.en:
This young lady is married, but she has no children.  She lives with her husband in the Kégué, district.  She learned the trade of sewing and opened her own workshop in 2006.  She named her workshop "GALAXY COIFFURE".  She has included with her business the sale of beauty products and hair extensions.  She has already had a WAGES loan, which she repaid without difficulty.  Wanting to resupply herself with beauty supplies and hair extensions, she's requesting a second loan from WAGES to do so.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buing beauty products and hair extensions

loans.name: Guillermo

texts.es:
Gillermo G. Rodriguez, tiene la edad de 35 años, está casado, y vive con el esposo  y un nieto. El crédito lo quiere para la compra de artículos para su negocio. Desea tener un inventario más amplio y variado de los artículos de su bazar. Tiene varios años de haber empezado con este negocio, y cuenta con muy buenos clientes, por eso ve la necesidad de ofrecer mayor variedad de productos en el negocio, además de aportar mayores ingresos para la economía de su hogar. Es la primera vez que realiza un crédito con FUDECOSUR y está muy agradecido con las facilidades que se le brindaron. El espera en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mayor estabilidad económica, y de poder seguir creciendo como persona y como comerciante.

About FUDECOSUR:
The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org
texts.en:
Guillermo Godinez Rodriguez is 35 years old, married, and lives with his wife and their son. He would like this loan for the purchase of items for his business. He wishes to have a larger and more varied inventory of items in his store. He has several years of experience with this business, as well as very good clients. For this reason, he sees the need to offer a greater variety of products, and also to earn a greater income to help with household expenses. This is the first time he has requested a loan through FUDECOSUR, and he is very thankful for the ease that it has provided him. In the future, he hopes to give his family a better quality of life and greater economic stability, and in this way continue growing as a person and a business owner. About FUDECOSUR: The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org

Translated from Spanish by Mark Broscoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase items for his business

loans.name: Abodonwa Owodon

texts.fr: cette jeune femme est une mère de famille très entreprenante, elle a 02 enfants et est mariée, elle vit avec son mari dans un quartier périphérique de la ville de Lomé, elle a ouvert un Bar qu'elle a appelé " BAR LABALADAN" dans son quartier, les weekend son bar est très animé et elle réalise de bonnes recettes. vu la taille de sa clientèle elle veut augmenter son stock de boissons c'est pour cela qu'elle sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour l'achat de 30 casiers de boissons et 30 liqueurs.
texts.en:
This young woman is a very enterprising mother with a family  She has two children and is married.  She lives with her husband in an outlying district of the city of Lomé.  She opened a bar that she named "BAR LABALADAN" in her area.  On weekends, her bar is very busy, and she brings in good revenues.  Given the size of her customer base, she wants to increase her stock of beverages.  This is why she's requesting a loan from WAGES for buying 30 cases of drinks and 30 of liqueurs.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying cases of drinks and liqueurs

loans.name: Señor De Lagunas Group

texts.es:
El centro focal de Panamericana se encuentra al inicio de la carretera que lleva a orillas del Lago Titicaca.  La asociación comunal Señor de Lagunas es parte de este centro focal, y le debe su nombre al Santo encargado de las lagunas. Esta asociación, formado por 9 mujeres, tiene los mejores deseos de llevar adelante su segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer. 

Los negocios de las socias son: tejido de mantas, venta de zapatos, albañilería, tejido de mantas de vicuña, venta de papas fritas, venta de mantas, ropa y zapatos, abarrotes.

La presidenta de 29 años de edad, señora Rosmery Huriste, casada  desde hace varios años.  Ella tiene el negocio del comercio de Mantas en la Feria 16 de Julio, los días jueves y domingo, entre las ocho de mañana y 4 de la tarde.  Ya lleva en el negocio 5 años.
texts.en:
The Panamericana regional center is located at the beginning of the highway which leads to the shores of Lake Titicaca. The communal bank "Señor de Lagunas" is part of this regional center, and it owes its name to the saint who is believed to watch over the lakes. This association is made up of 9 women with a strong desire to undertake their second loan cycle with Pro Mujer. The members' businesses are: weaving blankets; selling shoes; masonry; weaving vicuña wool ponchos; selling fried potatoes; selling ponchos, clothing and shoes; and selling groceries. The group's president, Rosmery Huriste, is 29 years old and has been married for several years. Her business is selling ponchos at the "16 de Julio" market, on Thursdays and Sundays from 8 a.m. to 4 p.m. She has operated this business for 5 years.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing ponchos to sell

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es: Ana es una joven de 28 años de edad, madre soltera de tres hijos, vive en el barrio Memorial Sandino, su vida no ha sido nada fácil pues trabaja como domestica en una casa particular que su abuelita la recomendó ya que tiene que dar alimentación y educación  a sus hijos. Poco a poco ha ido construyendo su casa ya que aun vive con su mama, no la a terminado por falta de dinero ya que todo esta caro es por eso opto al financiamiento para poder cerrar su casa ya que falta levantar paredes, repellar, techo, puertas, pero lo esencial es el techo para pasarse ante de que comience el invierno. Para ella es difícil pero no imposible poder tener un techo digno para sus hijos. Sus planes es poder apoyar a sus hijos, terminar su casa y poder seguir trabajando para poder seguir obteniendo esta posibilidad de los créditos, el cual es una gran oportunidad para las familia de poco recursos.
texts.en:
Ana is a twenty-eight-year-old young woman. She is a single mother of three children and lives in the Memorial Sandino neighborhood. Her life is not easy; she works as a maid in a home through the recommendation of her grandmother. She has to feed and educate her children. Though she still lives with her mother, little by little she has been building her house. She has not finished her house because she lacks money. Everything is expensive and therefore she has chosen to apply for this loan. She still needs to build walls, plaster, put on the roof and doors, but it is essential to finish the roof before winter begins. It is difficult but not impossible for her to have a decent home for her children. Her plans are to support her children, finish her house, and continue working in order to obtain this loan, which is a great opportunity for a family with few resources.

Translated from Spanish by Jeff Schell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction materials to build walls and put a roof on her house, which she expects to soon complete

loans.name: Jessica

texts.es:
Jessica tiene 32 años, es una empeñosa mujer que trabaja en la venta de jugos. Vive con sus 3 hijas, quienes la apoyan en su negocio. 

Desde hace 8 meses se dedica a la atención de su restaurante ubicado a 3 horas de donde vive, es por ello que esta actividad la realiza sólo los fines de semana. El resto de días los ocupa en la venta de jugos en su propia casa, donde puso un letrero y es muy visitada por todos sus vecinos, quienes le solicitan jugos de diferentes sabores y luego ella los entrega hasta a domicilio. Su negocio va muy bien y siente que puede seguir mejorando, es por ello que en un futuro está pensando agrandar su restaurante y equiparlo de mejor manera para poder ganar más clientela, además tiene planes de acondicionar su casa para el alquiler de cuartos. Jessica está muy contenta y con muchas ganas de seguir trabajando, pues sabe que con mucha persistencia hará realidad sus metas.

Este es su primer crédito con MFP y su grupo: “Mujeres triunfadoras de Ventanilla”, se compromete a ser muy cumplido con los pagos. El dinero que solicita lo invertirá en la mejora de su domicilio para el alquiler de habitaciones, pero también comprará ingredientes y utensilios para preparar helados de hielo, puesto que en este verano son muy demandados.
texts.en:
Jessica is 32 years old. She is a hard-working woman who sells juices. She lives with her 3 daughters, who help her in her business. Eight months ago she began to work at her restaurant that is a 3 hour commute from her residence. Due to the length of this commute, she is only able to work in her restaurant on the weekends. On weekdays she sells juices from her home, where she posted a sign. Her business is very popular with all her neighbors. They order juices of a variety of flavors, and Jessica later delivers the juices to their homes. Her business is successful, and she can continue to improve it. She is thinking of expanding her restaurant and purchasing better equipment in order to attract more customers. She also has plans to remodel her house to rent rooms. Jessica is very content and wishes very much to continue working because she knows that with persistance she will be able to achieve her goals. This is her first loan from MFP, and her group, "Mujures triunfadors de Ventanilla" (Women triumphant at the sales counter), is committed to timely repayment. The loan will be invested in home improvement in order to rent rooms, but also she will buy ingredients and utensils to prepare ices, which are in great demand in the summer.

Translated from Spanish by Jeff Schell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase food ingredients and home improvement

loans.name: Hanu

texts.fr: A 33ans cette dame est mariée à un monsieur qui est un chauffeur, ils ont 02 enfants, elle s'est lancée en 2000 dans le commerce du bois de chauffage, avec ce qu'elle gagne de ce commerce elle contribue financièrement aux charges de sa famille, elle s'approvisionne au nord du Togo parce que le coût d'achat du bois de chauffage lui revient moins chers et elle veut rehausser son stock de bois de chauffage raison pour laquelle elle sollicite de WAGES  son tout premier crédit pour l'achat de 20 tas de bois de chauffage et assurer le transport de la marchandises.
texts.en:
At 33 years of age, this lady is married to a gentleman who is a driver, and they have two children. In 2002, she embarked on a business of selling firewood, and devotes the revenue generated by this activity to family expenses. She gets her supplies from the North of Togo, because of lower prices for firewood. She wants to increase her stock of firewood which explains why she is requesting a first loan from WAGES, to buy 20 loads of firewood including transportation costs.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy firewood

loans.name: Olga

texts.es:
Olga, de 38 años, es una laboriosa mujer que se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza. Vive con su esposo y sus tres hijos en su casa propia.

Se inició en la venta de productos de belleza gracias al consejo de una amiga, la cual ya estaba inmersa en este negocio y en el cual lograba buenos ingresos. Es por ello que Olga animada a correr con la misma suerte, incursionó en esta actividad comprando algunos productos para probar suerte, felizmente su buen poder de convencimiento la favoreció para lograr buenas ventas y desde entonces se dedica completamente a este negocio, dedicándole prácticamente todo el día para visitar y ofrecer sus productos. Esta actividad le ha servido de mucho para el sustento de su familia y ella espera consolidar su negocio.

Este es su primer crédito con MFP y se siente muy segura de cumplir con todos los pagos puntualmente. Con el dinero que solicita comprará mayor cantidad de cosméticos para tenerlos en stock, especialmente bloqueadores solares que es lo que más se vende en esta época de verano.
texts.en:
Olga is 38 years old and a hard working woman who sells beauty products. She lives with her husband and three children in their own home. She started selling beauty products thanks to the advice of a friend who was already earning a good income in the business. Olga was motivated to try her luck, so she bought a few items to give it a try. Happily, her good salesmanship helped her make good sales, so now she does this full time, spending practically the whole day visiting customers and offering products. This has helped her support herself and her family. Now she would like to consolidate her business. This will be her first loan through MFP and she feels very certain that she will be able to make all of her payments on time. She will use the money to buy larger quantities of cosmetics, in order to keep them in stock. She especially wants to have sun block available, as this is what she sells most of during the summer.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Inventory

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
Carmen, de 26 años, es una persona muy jovial, vive con Andi su esposo y su pequeño 7 años de edad. Gracias a varios años de trabajo lograron adquirir su casa propia a pocas cuadras de la de su madre.

La venta de cosméticos por catálogo es la actividad a la que se dedica desde hace 3 años, tiempo en el cual ha aprendido todos los secretos para lograr una buena venta. Su carisma es de gran ayuda, pues pocas clientes se pueden negar a realizarle una compra por el gran poder de convencimiento que tiene. Además se ha instruido en los tonos y colores que van de acuerdo con los tipos de piel, además de varios secretos de belleza. Carmen está contenta con su trabajo y cada vez tiene clientes más asiduos, los cuales la buscan para solicitarle las novedades que ofrece. Asimismo, puso una vitrina en la tienda de su madre donde se muestra mejor la mercadería y puede lograr mayores ventas. Para el futuro, quiere instalar una tienda bazar, pero aún debe esperar a que su pequeño este más grande y no dependa tanto de ella, así que espera cumplir su meta poco a poco.

Este es su tercer crédito con MFP y pertenece al banco comunal llamando “Cristo Morado”, donde está muy contenta. Con el dinero que ahora solicita comprará mayor cantidad de cosméticos para aumentar su stock.
texts.en:
Carmen is 26 years old and very jovial. She lives with her husband, Andi, and her seven year old son. Thanks to several years of working, they were able to acquire their own home a few blocks away from her mother's. She has been selling cosmetics from a catalog for three years, during which she has learned all of the secrets to making good sales. Her charisma helps as well and few customers are able to resist buying from her, thanks to her salesmanship. She has also learned which colors and tones complement her customers' various skin types, and other beauty secrets. Carmen is happy with her work and has regular customers who seek her out to ask about any new products that she has. She installed a display case in her mother's store in order to better showcase her merchandise and increase her sales. In the future she would like to open her own shop, but she wants to wait for her son to get a little older, when he will not depend so much on her. She hopes to be able to read her goal little by little. This will be her third loan through MFP and she belongs to the "Cristo Morado" communal bank. She is very happy there. She will use the money from this loan to increase her stock.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Inventory

loans.name: Ariatou

texts.fr:
cette femme exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce de charbons de bois, elle a associé à ce commerce la vente de bananes et d'oranges, elle fait ce commerce depuis 2005 et s'approvisonne à l'intérieur du pays et parfois à lomé, son stock est en baisse, elle voudrait se réapprovisionner raison pour laquelle elle sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour l'achat de 15 sacs de charbons de bois, des bananes, des oranges et divers.
elle est mariée et mère de 02 enfants
texts.en:
This lady has an income-generating activity trading in charcoal. At the same time she also sells bananas and oranges. She has been doing this business since 2005 and gets her supplies inland and sometimes at Lomé. Since her stock is declining, she would like to get fresh supplies, and it is for this reason she is applying for a loan from WAGES in order to buy 15 bags of charcoal, bananas, oranges and other items. She is married with two children.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of charcoal, bananas, oranges and other items

loans.name: Francisco Manuel

texts.es: Manuel es un joven muy dedicado al trabajo, tiene 26 años de edad, y vive junto con su mama, con esfuerzo de su mama que vendía en un mercado de Masaya y ayuda de sus tíos, logro terminar sus estudios y se graduó de abogado. Actualmente trabaja como gestor de cobro en una institución. No tuvo el apoyo de su papa ya que emigro a los estados unidos, es por eso esta muy contento por haber logrado su meta y el apoyo de sus seres querido. Con sus ahorros ha venido a mejorar la casa de su mama, pero ahora desea hacer un caraje con verjas para reguardar una moto que es la que día a día trabaja, para mejor seguridad y comodidad de la misma. Para esto necesita comprar soldadura, verjas, pinturas, cemento, arena y piso para poder cerrar mejor. Sus planes es seguir estudiando para lograr mejores oportunidades de trabajo en un futuro.
texts.en:
Manuel is a dedicated 26 year old young man who lives with his mother. With his mother’s support, who used to sell in a Masaya market; and help from his uncles, he managed to complete his studies and graduate as an attorney. He currently works as an account manager for a company. He did not have his father’s support, who immigrated to the United States, so this is why he is very happy for having reached his goal with the help of his loved ones. He made improvements to his mother’s home with his savings, and now he would like a loan in order to build a lockable storage area to store a motorcycle that he uses daily. He needs to buy solder, metal bars, paint, sand, cement and flooring. He plans to continue his studies in order to have better job opportunities in the future.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Iron bars and building supplies

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr: âgée de 40 ans, cette dame est très dynamique, elle exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu la vente de charbons de bois, elle s'est engagée dans ce commerce en 2007, elle y a associé plus tard la vente de bois de chauffage, elle s'approvisionne dans les villages à l'intérieur du pays ainsi elle arrive à bénéficier d'une réduction sur ses prix d'achat. voulant rehausser son stock, elle sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour l'achat de 22 sacs de charbons de bois, 10 tas de bois de chauffage et assurer le transport de la marchandise.
texts.en:
This 40-year old woman is very dynamic and has an income-generating activity selling charcoal. She started up in this business in 2007 and later on complimented it with the sale of firewood. She gets her supplies in villages inland and thereby manages to benefit from a reduction in the purchase price. In order to increase her stock, she is applying for a loan from WAGES in order to buy 22 bags of charcoal, 10 piles of firewood and cover the cost of the transport of the goods.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of charcoal

loans.name: Kayembe Women's Group, Rukungiri

texts.en: Adrine T., pictured at top left as well as in the group photo, is the leader of her lending group. She is a jolly and hard-working lady who has been running a business selling produce such as beans, maize and rice from the Rukungiri trading centre for eight years. She has a store where she keeps all her produce for sale and she hopes to expand this store so that it can hold more stock. Adrine is married with four children, all of whom are in school, and she works very hard to ensure that they attain the best education. She needs a loan to be able to buy more beans, maize and rice from the villagers and bring it to her store where her customers come.

loans.use: Buying more beans, maize and rice for resale.

loans.name: Jessica Elizabeth

texts.es:
Jessica N. de 24 años, vive en una zona periurbana en la Perimetral de Guayaquil, su casa es de cemento pero solo cuenta con luz como servicio básico. Es madre soltera tiene un hijo. 

Jessica desde pequeña vendía con su mama comida a trabajadores del sector por donde vivía. Cuando creció invirtió sus ahorros en un pequeño comedor. 

Ahora ella trabaja todo los días desde las 07h30 hasta las 16h00 todos los días. Hace platos llapingachos, arroz con pollo, etc. Uno de los inconvenientes que tiene son las lluvias que hay en su sector.

Con el préstamo quiere comprar pescados, carnes, arroz para tener más variedad en los platos de su restaurante. En  el futuro quiere comprar una cocina industrial y tener otro restaurante.
texts.en:
Jessica is 24 years old and lives in the outskirts of Guayaquil. She has a cement home but the only service she has is electricity. She is a single mother with one son.
