When Jessica was a little girl, she used to help her mother sell food to the workers in her neighborhood. When she grew up, she invested her savings in a small canteen (dining room). Now she works every day from 7:30 am to 4:00 pm. She makes “llapingacho”dishes (potato patties stuffed with cheese and cooked on a hot griddle until crispy brown), chicken with rice, etc. One of her challenges is dealing with the rain in her part of the country. She will use the money from this loan to buy fish, meats, and rice in order to be able to offer a greater variety of dishes in her restaurant. Some day she would like to buy an industrial sized kitchen and open another restaurant.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Ingredients including fish, meats, and rice

loans.name: Heyler Geovany

texts.es:
El Joven Heyler Geovany C. es soltero vive con sus padres y tres hermanos tiene un buen espíritu de superación en su familia y su trabajo, es empleado activo de la alcaldía Chinandega en el departamento de contabilidad.
El joven Heyler C. trabaja con créditos desde hace dos años, ha tenido cinco créditos el cual ha demostrado responsabilidad en la administración de ellos.  
El joven C. L. utiliza el crédito para ayudar a sus padres, ya que ellos se dedican a la siembra para el consumo  propio y otra parte para comercializar, pero en pocas cantidades, ya que su mayor preocupación es si la cosecha le será rentable al hacerlo en mayor proporción.
texts.en:
The young Heyler Geovany C. is single and lives with his parents and three siblings. He has a good spirit with his family and his job. Currently, he is employed at the mayor's office in the accounting department. He has been working with credit for two years now, and he has demonstrated responsibility in managing five loans. This credit will be used to help his parents, who work in agriculture, both for their own consumption and for commercialization. However, they do it in small quantities, since their biggest worry is whether the harvest will be profitable for them if they do it in greater proportion.

Translated from Spanish by Mark Broscoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To cover family expenses

loans.name: Massan

texts.fr:
cette femme exerce depuis 1990 le commerce de produits d'alimentation générale,elle exerce ce commerce dans sa propre boutique et s'approvisionne au grand marché de Lomé, sa clientèle  est composée de toutes personnes et aussi d'étudiants et d'écoliers, elle se fait aider par une personne voulant agrandir son stock, elle sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour l'achat d'une dizaine de pâte alimentaire, une quinzaine de boîte de conserves et des légumes
elle est mariée et mère de  enfants c'est avec le revenu de son commerce qu'elle  contribue aux dépenses du foyer
texts.en:
This lady has sold a variety of food products since 1990; she has her own shop and sources her goods from the large market at Lomé. She has one assistant. Her customer base is varied, and includes students and schoolchildren. In order to enlarge her range of stock she is seeking a loan from WAGES; she would use this to buy a dozen lots of pasta, and a dozen jars of jam and vegetables. She is married with children, and uses the revenue generated by her business to see to her family's needs.

Translated from French by Danielle Treharne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: the purchase of various food products

loans.name: El Comienzo Group

texts.en:
The Comienzo Group consists of four women entrepreneurs: Esmirna G. V., Deysi del Socorro V., Serapia Gómez Alemán and Doris del Socorro. The principal activity in Esmirna’s business is selling tomatoes, bell peppers, and onions in the Oriental Market, where she has been working for 20 years. Recently her situation has been more difficult due to rising prices for these products as well as a shortage. Her husband, who lost his job, has recently begun a new business of purchasing and selling wood and lumber.

The other women in the group hope to grow their respective businesses: Deysi sells lumber; Serapie has a small general store, and Doris sells beverages and foods such as vegetables in the busy Oriental Market.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: N'gname

texts.fr: cette dame est mariée et mère de 03 enfant,elle exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce de détail des ignames, elle a associé plus tard à ce commerce la vente de céréales, elle a plus de 10 années d'expérience dans ce commerce, son mari est à la retraite donc son activité lui permet d'aider ce dernier dans les dépenses du foyer.elle s'approvisionne à bassar une ville située au nord du Togo, sa clientèle est composée de toutes personnes. elle veut s'approvisionner pour pouvoir bien satisfaire ses clients raison pour laquelle elle sollicite de WAGES son premier prêt pour l'achat de 12 sacs d'ignames, 7 sacs de maïs et 7 sacs de sorgho.
texts.en:
This lady is married and has three children. She has an income-generating activity retailing yams and she has subsequently complemented this with the sale of cereals. She has more than ten years experience in this business. Her husband is retired so that her business allows her to help him with the household expenses. She gets her supplies in Bassar, a town which lies in the north of Togo. Her customer base comprises all types of people. She would like to get fresh supplies in order to satisfy customer demand and this is why she is applying for a loan from WAGES, her first loan, in order to buy 12 bags of yams, seven bags of corn and 7 bags of sorghum.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of yams, corn and sorghum

loans.name: Mary Margoth

texts.es:
Cuando hace 14 años Mary E. S., de 40 años, quedó viuda se le presentó el mayor desafío de su vida, responsabilizarse por su familia y por el almacén que dejó su esposo y que no pudo continuar.
Mary persistente en su trabajo, logró desarrollar un taller de modistería y  comercializar  artesanías para sostener a su familia,  razón por la cual hoy es  bien recomendada en el municipio de San Jacinto-Departamento de Bolívar y ha sido posible que sus 4 hijos de 22 a 30 años puedan seguir una profesión.
Este es su quinto crédito recibido por parte de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y está aplicando por un monto de $ 2.300.000 para comprar telas y hacer uniformes escolares, comprar hamacas y poder cumplir sus pedidos. Ingresó como cliente de esta organización desde el año 2004 recibiendo un crédito por valor de 1500.000 estos le han aumentado su capital de trabajo y le han ayudado a atender nuevos clientes y progresivamente ha ido aumentándolos hasta el actual, con ellos  fue capaz de aumentar sus recursos económico que le han ayudado tanto en el mejoramiento de su negocio como en la educación de sus hijos.
Su sueño es seguir progresando en su negocio y aspira a  que cuando sus hijos terminen de estudiar pueda montar un almacén y mas adelante tener su casa propia porque aun la época en que murió su esposo
texts.en:
Fourteen years ago Mary E. S., 40, was widowed and this presented the greatest challenge of her life, as she had to take responsibility for her family and for the store that her husband left behind and that she could not keep going. Mary, persistent in her work, managed to develop a workshop where she makes clothing and sells handicrafts to support her family. Today her business is well recommended in the municipality of San Jacinto (in the Bolivar department) and this has made it possible for her 4 children, ages 22 to 30, to enter a profession. This is the 5th loan that she has received from the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, and she is applying for a sum of $2,300 to buy fabrics to make school uniforms and to buy hammocks so that she can fulfill her orders. She became a client of this organization in 2004, receiving a loan of $1,500 to increase her working capital. This helped her to attract new customers and she has been gradually increasing her customer base up until the present. With this business she was able to increase her economic resources and this has helped her so much in improving her business and also with the education of her children. Her dream is to continue to make progress in her business; she aspires to open a store once her children finish their studies, and later to have her own house, which she has not had since her husband died.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy fabric to make school uniforms and to buy hammocks to sell

loans.name: Ketty Judith

texts.es: Ketty Álvarez Vásquez tiene varios negocios: vende mercancías, minutos telefónicos y junta con su mamá comidas, pero su principal oficio es la producción de artesanías, que son comunes en San Jacinto Bolívar, un municipio reconocido por la calidad de sus hamacas, mochilas y bolsos, donde en general las mujeres realizan artesanías, mientras los hombres se dedican a labores de campo. Tiene tres hijos entre 21 y 16 años de edad y vive con su cónyuge que se dedica a hacer mantenimiento y pintura de neveras y otros electrodomésticos. Ketty solicita un crédito con monto de $1.500.000 que invertirá en la compra de de hilos para tejer hamacas y tambien comprar mercancías. Ella se vinculó con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo en el año 2008 y manifiesta que desde entonces ha aprendido manejar las deudas, hecho que se demuestra en sus pagos muy puntuales. Durante esta época tanto han aumentado sus ingresos familiares, como han mejorado las condiciones habitacionales. Además, tiene el negocio de venta de minutos gracias a la Fundación. Ha tenido situaciones difíciles debido a un accidente del hijo en el cual descapitalizó un poco su  negocio hace ya un tiempo; sin embargo, se concentra en sus sueños de mejorar su vivienda, aumentar los ingresos ampliando la venta de mercancías, promocionando sus artesanias y en brindarles educación a sus hijas. Se siente muy agradecida de pertenecer a la Fundación como usuaria
texts.en:
Ketty Álvarez Vásquez has various businesses. She sells merchandise, telephone minutes, and she sells food with her mother. But, her main job is making handicrafts that are common in San Jacinto Bolívar. It is a municipality that is known for the quality of its hammocks, backpacks, and purses. The women generally make handicrafts, and the men work in the fields. She has three children between 21 and 16 years old. She lives with her life partner. He performs maintenance and paints refrigerators and other domestic appliances. Ketty is requesting a loan for 1,500,000 COP to buy thread to weave hammocks. She will also buy merchandise. She associated with the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation in 2008. From then on she has learned to manage her debts, which she demonstrates with her very punctual payments. During this time her family income has increased a lot, and her living conditions have improved. Also, thanks to the Foundation, she has a business selling minutes. She has had difficult situations because of an accident her son had. She had to take a little money out of the business for some time. Nevertheless, she concentrates on her dreams of improving her house, increasing her income by expanding the sale of merchandise, promoting handicrafts, and giving her daughters an education. She is very grateful to belong to the Foundation as a user of their services.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy thread to weave hammocks, and also buy merchandise

loans.name: Marlon Alexander

texts.es:
El Joven Marlon Alexander M. R., es casado tiene dos hijos a su cargo trabaja en la alcaldía de Chinandega desempeñándose como vigilante en el mercado, ha demostrado ser un joven responsables ya que son cinco años de trabajar con nosotros el cual ha trabajado muy bien.

El señor Marlon M. utilizara el crédito para realizar reparaciones en  su casa, ya que la tiene forrada de plástico y lo tiene un poco viejo y el techo se le pasa cuando llueve, además comprara unas cosas que utilizara en su hogar, como alimentos para su familia.
texts.en:
The young Marlon Alexander M. Rodriguez is married and has two children. He works in the Chinandega mayor's office as a guard in the market. He has demonstrated himself to be a responsible young man in the five years that he has worked with us. Mr. Marlon M. will use this loan to make repairs to his house, since it is lined with plastic and a little bit old, and the roof leaks when it rains. Furthermore, he will purchase a few things that will be utilized in his home, such as food for his family.

Translated from Spanish by Mark Broscoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase construction materials

loans.name: Taison Group

texts.en:
The Taison Group is made up of three entrepreneurs -- Cecilia S. Picado, Martha Ramona García, and Maribel del Rosario López. The coordinator of this group is Cecilia who has a small store stocked with basic products such as rice, black beans, sugar, cooking oil, eggs, onion, tomato, soap, matches, and more. She has two children, 15 and 23 years old.  

Martha sells soup, nacatamales (a traditional Nicaraguan dish), sausages, cold drinks, and more. Maribell started her business 25 years ago; she sells fruits, vegetables, and nacatamales on the street.

loans.use: to expand her inventory

loans.name: Natividad Julia

texts.es:
La señora Natividad Julia L. A. tiene 55 años de edad es soltero tiene cinco hijos solo una vive con ella habita en el barrio la florida, es comerciante desde hace mas de 20 años hecha tortillas para vender todos los días de la semana en su casa de habitación.

La señora Natividad A. tiene tres años y medios de trabajar con crédito se le han otorgado 26 créditos cancelados cada dos meses, la señora A. ha demostrado ser una persona con mucha responsabilidad y trabajadora todos los créditos otorgados le han ayudado a mantener estable su negocio.
texts.en:
Señora Natividad Julia L. A. is 55 years old. She is single and has 5 children, only one of whom lives with her. She lives in the suburb of Florida, and has been a business woman for more than 20 years, making tortillas at home that she sells every day. Natividad has been working with loans for 3.5 years. She has been granted 26 loans, which she's paid off every 2 months. Señora A. has demonstrated to be a very responsible and hard working person. All the loans granted to her have helped her to keep her business stable.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Tortilla sales

loans.name: Maria Angeles Group

texts.en: The María is beginning a small business of her own where she will sell a variety of merchandise, such as, clothing, cosmetics, nail polishes, and more.  María realizes that it will be difficult at the beginning, but she desires to develop it into a very good business. She plans to use the loan to begin the business, but also use a little bit of it to start saving.

loans.use: en la compra dercadria en ropa, cosmeticos y plastico

loans.name: Grethel

texts.es:
Grethel es una mujer muy laboriosa, está felizmente casada con el padre de sus 6 hijos, 4 de ellos son mayores y viven aparte. Los otros 2 y su nieta viven en su casa en un barrio populoso de la ciudad de Lima.

Desde hace 3 años trabaja en la puerta del mercado de su localidad vendiendo bisutería. Inicialmente le costó mucho ubicarse en esta zona porque los inspectores municipales le quitaban su mercadería porque no hay permiso para la venta ambulante. Pero afloró su persistencia y ahora le va bien, además está muy contenta porque con esas ganancias ayuda a su esposo quien es policía, en cubrir los gastos del hogar. A su vez, a su hija que madre soltera le viene enseñando el negocio para que aprenda su forma de trabajar. En adelante, quiere comprar un puesto dentro del mercado, porque le es muy rentable y así podrá brindar la educación adecuada a sus hijos.

Este te su doceavo préstamo con MFP, donde ratifica su compromiso de seguir siendo muy puntual en sus pagos, como hasta ahora. Asimismo comenta que está orgullosa de pertenecer a su grupo, pues tiene compañeras muy responsables. El dinero que solicita lo invertirá en el incremento de accesorios para el cabello y otros artículos de ese tipo.
texts.en:
Grethel is a very hard-working woman. She is happily married to the father of their six children; four of whom are adult and live apart, the other two and a granddaughter live with her in a densely populated neighborhood of Lima. For the last three years she has sold costume jewelry at the entrance to the local market. Initially it was very difficult to set herself up in this area because municipal inspectors would confiscate her merchandise because there are no permits for street vending. However, her persistence bore fruit and now she does well; besides, she's happy because she can help her husband, who is a police officer, meet household expenses. At the same time, she is teaching the business to her daughter, who is a single mother, so that she will learn how to work. In the future, she wants to buy a stand inside the market because it is very profitable and she will be able to provide her children with an adecuate education. This is her third loan with MFP and she reconfirms her commitment to continue being very punctual with her repayments, as she has been until now. Also, she comments that she is proud to belong to her group because she has very responsible fellow members. She will use the requested funds to buy hair accessories and similar items.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy hair accessories and similar items.

loans.name: Lethy Dodania

texts.es:
Lethy Gómez de 36 años, vive en una zona periurbana en el Paraíso de Guayaquil, su casa es de cemento pero solo cuenta con luz como servicio básico. Su esposo es guardia privado con el tiene 2 hijos. 

Lethy empezó vendiendo ropa en casi todos los sectores de Guayaquil. Después que ahorro lo suficiente decidio tener en su casa una pequeña tienda. 

Ella ya tiene 15 años con la tienda trabaja desde las 07h00 hasta las 22h00 todos los días. Vende arroz, aceite, enlatados, bebidas, etc. También ha implementado artículos para papelería. Una de las dificultades para atender la tienda es su salud.
 
Con el préstamo quiere comprar arroz, bebidas, enlatados para su negocio y algunas medicinas para ella. En el futuro quiere surtir mas el negocio y terminar su casa.
texts.en:
Lethy Gómez is 36 years old, and lives in a semi-urban zone in Paraíso de Guayaquil. Her house is made from cement but she only has light as a basic service. Her husband is a private guard and she has 2 children with him. Lethy began selling clothes in almost all the sectors of Guayaquil. After she had saved sufficient money she decided to open a small shop in her house. She has had this shop for 15 years and works from 7am to 10pm every day. She sells rice, oil, canned goods, drinks etc. She has also implemented stationery items. One of the difficulties about attending the store is her health. With the loan she is seeking to purchase rice, drinks, and canned goods for her business and some medicines for her. In the future she wants to stock her business more and finish her house.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase rice, beans and canned goods

loans.name: Bwanda Lending Group, Rukungiri

texts.en: K. Miria is a hard working lady with a retail shop in Bwanda trading centre that has been in existence for five years. Some of her goals are to be a successful business lady plus having a well established and beloved family, since she is a married lady with school going children. Miria needs a loan to be able to purchase more stock for her shop so that she could make more sales.

loans.use: Restocking her shop with more goods.

loans.name: Lidia

texts.es:
Lidia V. V., tiene la edad de 50 años, está casada, y tiene 5 hijos que son su mayor prioridad. Ellos tienen 24,19,19,13 y 12 años de edad. El crédito lo quiere para la compra de ganado, la idea es tener ganado para doble propósito (leche y carne). Desea darle el adecuado mantenimiento al ganado para obtener el mayor ingreso posible cuando se vendan. No es la primera vez que realiza un crédito con FUDECOSUR y está muy contenta con las facilidades que se le han brindado siempre. Doña Lidia trabaja desde hace varios años con el ganado. Ella espera en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mayor estabilidad económica, y de poder seguir creciendo como persona y como productora.

About FUDECOSUR:
The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org
texts.en:
Lidia V. V. is 50 years old, married, and has 5 children who are her biggest priority. They are 24, 19, 19, 13 and 12 years old. The loan she is seeking is to purchase livestock, with the idea being to have livestock with 2 purposes: milk and meat. She wants to give them adequate care to obtain the best earnings possible when she sells them. It's not the first time she has had a loan with FUDECOSUR and she is very content with the facilities that they have always given her. Lidia has worked with livestock for several years. She hopes in the future to bestow her family with a better quality of life and more economic stability, and to be able to continue growing as a person and producer. About FUDECOSUR: The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase livestock

loans.name: Rebeca Group

texts.es:
The Rebeca Group is formed by three female entrepreneurs, Rebeca Rosalina L. E., María del Carmen S., and Ileana Angelica C..  The coordinator of the group is Señora Rebeca, she began her clothing and shoes sales 10 years ago. Rebeca is a strong woman who has supported her two children. She works fervently for them.  

Lleana sells fruits and pastries Monday through Friday and on the weekends she sells soup, a typical dish with yucca and beef called baho, and more.  María also sells cloths as well as tortillas, fruits and vegetables.

loans.use: Purchase clothes

loans.name: Manuel De Jesús

texts.es:
En un barrio de Soledad llamado Nuevo Milenio, donde funcionan muchos negocios informales producto del esfuerzo que hacen sus habitante para autosostenerse, vive Manuel de Jesús B. Amaya de 52 años,  con su cónyuge y 2 hijos en las edades de 13 y 22 años. Él, al igual que la mayor parte de sus vecinos también tiene un negocio, el suyo consiste en fabricar y vender  productos como: jabones líquidos, desinfectantes esencias y en general  productos de aseo, los cuales forman parte de los requerimientos de amas de casa, tiendas y otros negocios, que conforman su demanda rutinaria, unida a la de clientes potenciales a quienes también quiere responder de manera oportuna;  este es el propósito de su crédito solicitado a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo por valor de $ 2.000.000, el cual invertirá en la compra de materia prima  para fabricar  esencias florales, desinfectantes, jabones líquidos  y poder satisfacer las necesidades de  su nueva clientela. Manuel dice que con este negocio, ha logrado responder a los gastos de sostenimiento de su familia y que nació porque el desempleo a su edad  no le dejó otra alternativa, pero se siente satisfecho de tenerlo y por eso le va bien.   
Sus metas están dirigidas a su crecimiento personal y  empresarial y darle estudios superiores a sus hijos para poder realizarse como padre y esposo a la vez. Su mayor desafío es desarrollar constantemente su capacidad innovadora en el desarrollo de sus productos  para estar a la par de los grandes almacenes que son su competencia.
texts.en:
In a suburb in Soledad called Nuevo Milenio, where there are many informal businesses run by the inhabitants in order to be self-sustaining, lives Manuel de Jesús B. Amaya, 52, with his spouse and 2 children (13 and 22). Manuel, as many of his neighbours do, has a business. His consists of making and selling products such as liquid soap, disinfectants and hygiene products in general, which form part of the necessities that housewives, shops and other businesses need. They routinely create demand, together with potential customers that he wants to respond to in opportune moments. He is seeking a loan from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo for the value of $2,000 which he will invest in the purchase of primary material to make floral essences, disinfectants, liquid soaps and to be able to satisfy the necessities of his new customers. Manuel says that with this business he has been able to meet the costs of sustaining his family and that the business was born because being unemployed at his age left him no alternative. He feels satisfied about having the business and because of this he is doing well. His goals are directed at his personal and empresorial growth and he wants to give his children superior study opportunities, wanting them all to come true at the same time. His biggest challenge is to constantly develop his capacity to innovate the development of his products so they are on par with the big stores that are his competitors.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase primary materials to make floral essences, disinfectants, liquid soaps

loans.name: José De La Concepción

texts.es:
El señor José H. se dedica a atender su negocio de venta de electrodomésticos en el mercado Mayoreo donde a diario ofrece los electrodomésticos tales como planchas, tostadoras, radios, licuadoras, cocinas, entre otros electrodomésticos.

Actualmente está solicitando un crédito el que será invertido directamente en la compra de dichos electrodomésticos para continuar ofreciéndolos en su establecimiento en el mercado.
texts.en:
Señor José H. works in his electrical appliance business in the Mayoreo marketin where he daily offers his wares such as irons, toasteres, radios, blenders, cookers and other appliances. He is seeking a loan which will be inverted in the purchase of more electrical appliances to continue offering them in his establishment in the market.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase electrical appliances

loans.name: Armando Ciriaco

texts.es: Armando Ciriaco de 36 años de edad es casado con la Sra. Lourdes Lopez, tiene 3 hijos, el mayor que le ayuda con el cuido dela finca y el ganado y los 2 menores estudiando la primaria.  Esta solicitando su 5to credito a esta institucion para el cultivo de 10 mnz de platanos para posteriormente comercializarlos a un buen precio que le permita obtener ganancias que le permitan brindarle a su familia mejores concidiciones de vida.  Adicionalmente se dedica a la ganaderia obteniendo otros ingresos que le permiten el sustento familiar.  En su comonidad don Armando es conocido como un hombre honrado, honesto, y trabajador.
texts.en:
Armando Ciriaco is 36 years old. He is married to Lourdes Lopez and they have 3 children. The oldest helps Armando with the care of the farm and livestock and the 2 youngest study at primary school. Armando is seeking his 5th loan with this institution to cultivate 10 mnz of plantains to later sell them at a good price, which permits him to obtain earnings that allow him to bestow better living conditions on his family. Additionally he also breeds livestock, earning more income which allows him to sustain his family. Don Armando is known in his community as an honorable, honest and hard-working man.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Cultivate plantains

loans.name: Jose Alberto

texts.es:
el sr. Jose Alberto H. M. tiene 23 años de edad, vive en la colonia Villanueva, tiene un pequeño negocio en el que brinda el servicio de corte de cabello, tiene clientes locales y de otras colonias aledañas a su negocio. sus clientes salen satisfechos del trabajo que el realiza.
Jose en estos momentos tiene la necesidad de ampliar su negocio, constriur para hacerlo mas grande y poner otra silla para dar servicio de cortes de pelo, tiene un  ayudante y quiere que el haga tambien el trabajo de cortes de pelo, Jose esta preparando a su ayudante para que sea un buen barbero, el es joven y esta casado, tiene un hijo.
Jose con este credito hara crecer su negocio y tendra mejores ganancias, asi mismo ayudara a su empleado a tener mejores ingresos por los cortes de pelo.
texts.en:
Jose Alberto H. M., 23, lives in Colonia Villanueva. He has a small barber shop. His customers are both locals and from neighboring areas. His customers leave satisfied with the work he does. Jose needs to enlarge his business and has to build in order to do so. He wants to add a second barber chair. He has an assistant and he wants him to do haircuts, too. Jose is training his assitant to be a good barber; he is young, married and has a son. Jose will use the funds to enlarge his business so that his profits will be better; he will also help his employee to have a better income by doing haircuts.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cement, sand, stone and bricks.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Simona

texts.es:
La Señora Simona Cossío D. A.  tiene 58 años y está casada con el Señor Antonio A. Rocha  por más D. 30 años, La señora se dedica al comercio D. productos agrícolas, venD. en la feria D. colomi  solo los días D. feria, el  esposo es productor D. papa, papa lisa haba y también tiene  ganado vacuno D. engorD.  que para él  los ganados son como caja D. ahorro que pueD. disponer a la venta cuando tiene necesidad D. dinero para sus gastos. Los insumos que utiliza para la siembra D. tubérculos y hortalizas es abono orgánico D. gallinaza, semilla certificada  y para el ganado siembra  personalmente la  avena forrajera.

La señora Simona C. y su familia  viven en la comunidad D. liquintaya,  sobre la carretera a santa cruz  a 4 km del pueble D. colomi, para ellos es difícil acudir a los bancos en busca D. préstamo, por lo tanto el Cidre  está en la zona que  ellos y pueden solicitar un crédito  para comprar insumos agrícolas que necesitan para la siembra.

La señora Simona  nos cuenta que su mayor sueño es sacar a su hijo menor profesional  ya que los demás hijos no tuvieron la misma oportunidad para estudiar, y para ello continuara con la producción agrícola y la cría D. ganado D. engorD..
texts.en:
Simona Cossío D. A. is 58, and she has been married to Antonio A. Rocha for over 30 years. She sells agricultural products. She sells only on fair days at the fair in Colomi. Her husband grows potatoes and beans. He also has cattle that he fattens. To him the cattle are like a savings box that he can use to sell when he needs money for his expenses. The supplies he uses for planting his tubers and vegetables are organic fertilizer from hens and certified seeds. He personally plants oatmeal as fodder for his cattle. Simona Cossío and her family live in the Liquintaya community near the road to Sana Cruz, which is four km from the town of Colomi. It is difficult for them to go to banks looking for a loan. Cidre is in the area, and they are able to ask them for a loan to buy farming supplies that they need for planting. Simona tells us that her biggest dream is to have her youngest child become a professional. The rest of the children did not have the same educational opportunity. To reach this dream she will continue with the farming production and raising cattle to fatten.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy agricultural supplies

loans.name: Elvira Josefina

texts.es:
Elvira Josefina V. A. tiene 49 años y vive con sus hijos  en el barrio Villa Katanga ubicado en Soledad; ella desde hace tres años se dedica al negocio de vender mercancías mediante guías especializadas de productos surtidos y también comercializa productos que no están exhibidos es su revista; este es el motivo de acceder a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo para obtener su tercer  crédito por valor de $2.000.000  el cual lo utilizará para comprar de contado y poder financiar a una nueva clientela que le hizo pedidos de vestidos femeninos ropa deportiva masculina, cosméticos y calzado para hombre y para mujer.
Su negocio lo inició cuando una empresa le ofreció vender sus productos cosméticos y como sus hijos trabajan y estudian, ella pudo hacer una buena gestión de ventas con sus amigos, luego acudió a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, a través de una vecina que recibe créditos en esta organización y la recomendó; con su financiamiento ha logrado aumentar su capital de trabajo y tener una referencia crediticia, que le ha ayudado a que muchas empresas le ofrezcan sus productos y con ello ha logrado diversificar su oferta.
Su sueño mas adelante es comprar un carro de servicio publico que le genere un nuevo ingreso y que igualmente le sirva  para trasladarse y responder oportunamente en sus actividades de negocio.
Siempre ha tenido grandes desafíos, pero su  fe en Dios y su capacidad de superación y su forma de resolverlos apoyada por sus hijos, que trabajan en buenas empresas, les ha permitido salir adelante y responder a cualquier problema que se le presente.
texts.en:
Elvira Josefina V. A., 49, lives with her children in the Villa Katanga neighborhood in Soledad. For the last three years she has sold assorted catalogue merchandise; she also sells articles that are not included in the catalogue. This is the reason for calling upon Fundación Mario Santo Domingo to request her third loan, valued at $2.000.000, to pay cash for articles, like women's dresses, men's athletic clothes, cosmetics and shoes for men and women, that new customers have ordered. Her business started when a company offered her the opportunity to sell cosmetics. Since her children were working and going to school, she was able to focus on selling to her acquaintances. Then, she called upon Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, thanks to a recommendation from a neighbor, who gets loans from this organization. She used the financing to increase her working capital and establish a credit history. This, in turn, made it possible for several companies to offer her their products and she has been able to diversify the products she offers. Her dream for later on is to buy a public transportation vehicle that will produce new income and that will provide her with mobility so that she can respond to her business' needs in a timely fashion. She has always had challenges but her faith in God and her capacity for improvement and the way she has faced them, with her children's support, who work for good companies, have made it possible for her to continue forging ahead in life and to respond to any problem that may arise.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To pay cash for women's dresses, men's athletic clothing, cosmetics and shoes for men and women.

loans.name: Albertina

texts.es:
La señora Albertina C. C. es casada tiene cuatro hijos una a su cargo, habita en el barrio el Rosario es profesora de primaria en el  centro educativo Jesús de Nazareth desde hace quince años.

La señora Albertina además de ser profesora también tiene un taller de bordado y confección todo para bebe en su casa de habitación, cabe señalar que es primer crédito que se le otorga.
texts.en:
Señora Albertina C. C. is married and has 4 children, 1 in her care. She lives in the suburb of Rosario and has been a primary school teacher at the education centre Jesús de Nazareth for 15 years. Apart from being a teacher Albertina also has an embroidery and children's clothes workshop in her house. She would like to point out that this is the first loan that she has sought.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Personal use

loans.name: Erika

texts.es:
Erika es una madre de familia de 35 años de edad que vive junto a su esposo y a sus dos hijos en el sector El Pancal, en la zona rural del distrito de Paiján, en la provincia de Ascope, en la región La Libertad, ubicada a tres horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace cinco años a la crianza y venta de animales en carne. Ella compra todo tipo de animales en la ciudad de Paiján y los engorda para luego venderlos en su domicilio a sus vecinos. Este negocio es de mucha utilidad tanto para ella como para sus vecinos, ya que a ella le ayudan a colaborar con la economía familiar y a sus vecinos les permite adquirir carne fresca sin tener que ir a la ciudad, que queda muy lejos de la zona.

El negocio está creciendo y Erika desea ampliarlo con la compra de alimentos para el engorde de sus animales, por ello se encuentra solicitando por primera vez a  Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que piensa utilizar en el logro de su objetivo.

Erika es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora. Su mayor anhelo es poder adquirir una casa en Paiján, ya que la que actualmente tienen no es propia.
texts.en:
Erika is a 35 year old mother who lives with her husband and 2 children in the El Pancal neighborhood of Paijan, Ascope in the Libertad province, about three hours from the city of Chiclayo. For the past 5 years, she has worked raising and selling animals. She buys all kinds of animals in Paijan and feeds them in order to, later, sell them to her neighbors. It's a great business both for her and for her neighbors since, for her, it allows her to help with household expenses and, for her neighbors, it allows them to buy fresh meat without having to go to the city which is far from their neighborhood. The business is growing and Erika would like to expand it by buying more food to give to the animals; this is why she is seeking her first loan from Edpyme Alternative for $350 which will help her reach her goal. Erika is a very hard-working, enterprising woman; her dream is to own her own home in Paijan since she currently lives in a rented house.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of feed for her animals

loans.name: Yenny María

texts.es:
Yenny María García Barreto tiene un taller de modistería y produce mochilas en crochet en el municipio de San Jacinto-departamento de Bolívar, población de artesanos y agricultores, donde los vecinos son muy solidarios. Está casada y tiene un hijo de diez años; su esposo es enfermero   titulado por el SENA y ha trabajado en hospitales, aunque en estos momentos  no ejerce su profesión y se dedica al servicio de mototaxi con su propia moto. Yenny solicita un crédito de $1.500.000 que lo invertirá en la compra de telas para hacer uniformes escolares y aprovechar  la entrada a los colegios; también piensa usar el crédito para hacer mantenimientos necesarios a sus máquinas y para comprar hilo para la elaboración de mochilas.
A pesar de sus 29 años, Yenny tiene este taller desde los 17 años: inicialmente trabajaba con una amiga con la cual aprendió su oficio, luego realizó cursos de modistería y se capacitó en el SENA en bordado a mano. Se vinculó a la Fundación en el 2008 y desde entonces ha ampliado el negocio y en la actualidad  tiene otra máquina y presta un mejor servicio a sus clientes. Su forma de trabajar ha mejorado durante esta temporada y se siente muy agradecida de los créditos otorgados por la Fundación, aunque todavía hay momentos difíciles: en temporadas de ventas disminuidas cuando los ingresos familiares bajan, le toca trabajar en un taller de modistería donde la pagan por producción; o cuando en una ocasión se accidentó su esposo y los gastos del hogar los tuvo que asumir ella con las utilidades de su negocio. Yenny y su esposo aún no tienen casa propia, pero sí tienen un lote, el cual compraron con sus ahorros y una de sus  metas es tener una casa de su propiedad con local incluído para adecuar allí su taller. Es más, sueña con aumentar las ventas, estudiar el diseño de moda y tener otro hijo.
texts.en:
Yenny Maria G. Barreto runs a textile shop where she makes crochet backpacks in the city of San Jacinto, Bolivar, a population full of artisans and farmers where neighbors are very unified. She is married with a 10 year old son; her husband is a SENA nurse and has worked in hospitals; however, currently he is not working in the medical field and is running a moto-taxi service with his own vehicle. Yenny is requesting a loan of $800 which she will invest in the purchase of cloth to make school uniforms and take advantage of kids entering school; she will also use it to perform maintenance on her sewing machines and to buy thread to make her backpacks. In spite of being only 29 years old, Yenny has worked in her shop since she was 17. Initially she worked with a friend who taught her the job, but later she took sewing classes and trained in the SENA how to embroider. She enrolled in the Foundation in 2008 and has grown her business; she has another sewing machine and offers great customer service. Her work has improved and she is very grateful for the loans she has received from the Foundation. Even though she still has difficult moments when sales drop and her family income drops, luckily she works in a shop where she is paid by her own production. Additionally, once when her husband was in an accident and she had to assume all household expenses, she was able to do it through her business. Yenny and her husband don't own their home but they do own a piece of land which they purchased with their savings. One of their goals is to build their own home and place her workshop in it. She also dreams of increasing her sales, studying fashion and having another child.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase thread for embroidery on backpacks, cloth for school uniforms, and machine maintenance

loans.name: Freddy Raul

texts.es:
En el barrio La Bajera de San Jacinto  Departamento de Bolívar, queda “Vidrios  y Aluminios San Jacinto”, ese es el nombre del negocio de propiedad de Freddy M. R. que tiene 48 años y en que trabaja con su esposa con quien tiene   3 hijos  en edades de  10 y 3 años.
Con ellos llegó a este municipio después de 10 años de estar administrando fincas en el departamento del Magdalena , porque quiso que sus hijos estudiaran pues estando en una finca estaban los colegios bien distantes, así que solo con  sueños un ahorro y decisión firme emprendieron su negocio cuando un vecino del pueblo inspiró y apoyó su deseo ayudándolo con su experiencia y en talleres de Cartagena aprendió a cortar sus primeros vidrios; desde ese momento consiguió un local  para fabricar puertas y ventanas y vender vidrios aluminio y otros accesorios; este negocio lo atiende  él y su esposa y cuando tiene  mucho trabajo busca trabajadores con el fin de responder a la clientela oportunamente. Con este propósito  está solicitando su segundo crédito a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo por valor de $1.500.000, que será utilizado para comprar aluminio, vidrios y accesorios para la elaboración de puertas y ventanas. 
Con su primer crédito fue muy aplicado tanto en su inversión como en su reembolso  por eso logré aumentar sus utilidades  y simultáneamente  mejoró su historial creditito lo cual para el es muy importante como empresario.
Algún día quiere tener su casa propia, invertir también en ganadería, pero sobre todo sacar adelante a sus hijos mediante una buena educación formal.
El desafío más importante está relacionado con su negocio que la época  de ventas bajas debe proveerlas para  prepararse a responder a sus obligaciones y esto lo hace muy bien porque  tiene su negocio controlado.
Su situación mas difícil fue el cambio del la finca a San Jacinto, aun se sorprende de su capacidad de riesgo ante todas las dificultades que se presentaron, pero eso es cosa del pasado y lo importante es el deseo de superación y la gran alegria que constantemente Freddy expresa.
texts.en:
San Jacinto Glass and Aluminum is located in the La Bajera de San Jacinto neighborhood of the Bolivar province. Freddy M. R. is 48 years old and runs the business with the help of his wife, with whom he has 3 children from 3-10 years old. They moved to this city 10 years ago from Magdalena where he managed some farms. He wanted his kids to be able to study and they lived very far from the schools on their farm. He decided to start his business when a neighbor in Cartagena encouraged him to do so after teaching him how to cut glass. He found a storefront to start making doors and windows and selling glass, aluminum and other accesories. He and his wife run the business and he contracts other workers when things get busy in order to serve his clientele. He is seeking his second loan from Mario Santo Domingo Foundation of $800 which he will use to buy aluminum, glass and accesories to make his doors and windows. With his first loan, he was very diligent both in investing his money and in paying it back; he improved his business and his credit history which is very important for him as an entrepreneur. Someday, he would like to have his own home, invest in livestock, but more than anything he'd like his kids to receive a formal education. His biggest challenge is meeting his obligations during periods of low sales but he has learned to manage his business very well and get through those times. His most difficult time was when he changed work from farming to what we does now; he's still surprised at the risk he took, but he considers it part of his past and his dream now is to move forward and his happiness shows that he is doing so.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase aluminum, glass, accesories to make doors and windows

loans.name: Antonio

texts.es: Don. Antonio es pequeño productor del sector de Muelle de los Bueyes, habita en la comarca Las Pavas junto a su familia compuesta por su esposa Maria Simona y sus 2 hijos, Mariela de 14 años y Ezequiel de 12 años, ambos estudiando la primaria.  Su finca es apta para el manejo de semovientes ya que tiene galera, corral de madera, diversos tipos de pastos (taiwan, retana, brizanta) aguajes, praderas. Esta solicitando su 5to credito para la compra de 5 toretes para cuidarlos y engordarlos y cuando tengan un buen peso comerciarlizarlos a un mejor precio que le permita obtener ganancias que ayuden a brindarle a su familia mejores condiciones de vida.  Expresa que los creditos obtenidos en AFODENIC  le han permitido mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia, ya que poco a poco ha incrementado su inventario ganadero y mejorado su finca para mejor cuido de su ganado. Don Antonio se caracteriza por ser un hombre muy responsable con sus compromisos, trabajador y buen padre de familia.
texts.en:
Mr. Antonio is a small producer from the Muelle de los Bueyes sector. He lives in the Las Pavas region with his family, composed of his wife Maria Simona and their two children, Mariela who is 14 years old and Ezequiel who is 12 years old. Both children are studying in primary school. His plot is suitable for livestock since he has a galley, a wood corral, and diverse types of pastures, water supplies, and meadows. He is asking for his fifth loan to purchase 5 small bulls and take care of them, grow them, and when they have a good weight he will sell them at a better price that will allow him to increase his earnings and help him provide his family with better living conditions. He says that the loans obtained from AFODENIC have allowed him to improve the living conditions for his family, since little by little he has increased his livestock inventory and improved his plot in order to better care for his livestock. Mr. Antonio characterizes himself as being a very responsible man with his commitments, hardworking, and a good father.

Translated from Spanish by Kelley Maynard, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cattle for development

loans.name: Teofilo

texts.es:
El  Señor Teofilo P. C.  tiene 40 años y está casado con la Señora Hilaria Torrez Bautista por más de 15 años, El señor se dedica en su chaco o lote agrícola a la producción de frutas tropicales como el banano y naranja, y su esposa le ayuda con los trabajos de mantenimiento de las plantaciones de frutales, sus productos vende en el  lugar.

El  Señor Teofilo P. C. vive en la zona de Senda E, en Chimore,  es una zona bastante alejada de la ciudad y por lo tanto para ellos es difícil acudir a los bancos en busca de préstamo por eso fue que el CIDRE tuvo la iniciativa de abrir una agencia en esta zona y descubrimos que el estado en el que trabajan es en condiciones muy difíciles por el clima del trópico y la distancia de cuatro kilómetros que tiene que recorrer todos los días desde su casa hasta su chaco, por tanto el señor Teofilo utilizara este crédito para comprar una motocicleta y poder dedicar más tiempo al mantenimiento de su chaco y por ende con su familia. 

El  Señor Teofilo nos cuenta que su mayor sueño es continuar con la producción de frutas tropicales ampliando sus cultivos y ver a sus hijos y nietos tener un futuro bueno y que algún día tenga una plantación bien establecida para dejarles una herencia a sus hijos que les ayude en la vida. Que cada vez está más dura en el país.
texts.en:
Mr. Teofilo P. C. is 40 years old and has been married to Mrs. Hilaria Torrez Bautista for more than 15 years. He works in his farm or agricultural lot to produce tropical fruits such as bananas and oranges. His wife helps him with the work of maintaining the fruit plantations. They sell their products from this location. Mr. Teofilo P. Condoria lives in the area of Senda E, in Chimore. It is a fairly remote area from the city and therefore for them it is difficult to access banks in search of loans. It was for this reason that CIDRE took the initiative to open an agency in this area and we discovered that the state in which they work has very difficult conditions because of the tropical climate and the 4-kilometer distance that he has to travel every day from his house to his farm. Because of this Mr. Teofilo will use this loan to buy a motorcycle and be able to dedicate more time to maintaining his farm and therefore with his family. Mr. Teofilo tells us that his biggest dream is to continue producing tropical fruits and increasing his crops and to be able to see his children and grandchildren have a better future and that one day he will have a well-established plantation in order to leave them an inheritance that helps them in life. Because every day gets harder in this country.

Translated from Spanish by Kelley Maynard, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a motorcycle

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es: La señora M. es trabajadora active del Banco popular (BANCENTRO). Ella quiere el crédito para comprar cemento y repellar su casa de habitación y así mejorar su condición de vida y la de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Señora M. is an active worker of the popular bank BANCENTRO. She is seeking a loan to buy cement and repair her house to be able to improve the living conditions for her and her children.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cement

loans.name: Lisímaco

texts.es:
Lisímaco B. A., tiene la edad de 65 años, está casado, y tiene 3 hijos que son su mayor prioridad. Ellos tienen 25,18 y 12 años. El crédito lo quiere para la compra de algunos terneros y su alimentación. Desea darle el adecuado mantenimiento al ganado para obtener el mayor ingreso posible cuando se vendan. También desea aumentar el número de animales y poder mantenerlos en mejores condiciones, cuenta con un área idónea para el mantenimiento y cría del ganado. Es la primera vez que realiza un crédito con FUDECOSUR y está muy contento con las facilidades que se le brindaron. Don Lisímaco tiene varios años dedicada al ganado. El espera en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mayor estabilidad económica, y de poder seguir creciendo como persona y como productor.

About FUDECOSUR:
The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org
texts.en:
Lisímaco B. A. is 65 years old. He is married and has 3 children who are his top priority. They are 25, 18 and 12 years old. He wants the loan to buy some calves and to feed them. He wants to care for the cattle adequately to make the most income possible when they’re sold. He also wants to increase the number of animals and care for them in the best conditions. He has an ideal area to care for and breed cattle. It’s the first time he has had a loan from FUDECOSUR and he’s very happy with how easy they made it for him. Mr. Lisímaco has worked with cattle for various years. He hopes to offer his family a better quality of life and greater economic stability in the future. And he hopes to continue to grow as a person and as a laborer. About FUDECOSUR: The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org

Translated from Spanish by Susan Haynes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase Cattle

loans.name: Manos Asendosas Group

texts.es:
Las integrantes del grupo Manos Asendozas son tres mujeres muy trabajadoras, este grupo esta ubicado en El Municipio de El Paraiso, se conocen bien y siempre han trabajado juntas ya que son vecinas. el apoyo que se les brinde este credito sera de mucha importancia ya que podran adquirir mas mercaderia y materia prima para sus negocios, a contunuacion se detallan las diferentes actividades que ellas realizan para ganarse la vida:
YOLANDA R. D.: se dedica al comercio, cuenta con una pequeña tiendita donde vende ropa y calzado, tiene 3 años de laborar en este tipo de actividad comercial, las ganancias que su negocio genera le permiten contribuir con los gastos del hogar a su esposo, tiene 3 hijos que cursan la educacion primaria.   
JUANA LUCILA R. V.: Cuenta con una taller de satreria,  tiene 19 años de tenerlo, esta es su fuente de generacion de ingresos los cuales le permiten cubrir gastos familiares y otros compromisos. en estos momentos Juana necesita el credito ya que tiene mucho trabajo por realizar y ella necesita tener toda la tela para poder hacer los trabajos y que los clientes le paguen cuando tenga terminado los pedidos.  
MARIA DEL ROSARIO Z. : Su actividad principal es el comercio, cuenta con un pequeño taller donde 
se dedica a la elaboracion y venta de piñatas y manualidades.
actividad que tiene mas de 19 años de experiencia, lo que le permite tener muy buena clientela, su producto lo vende a diferentes confiterias, negocios y personas particulares que le solicitan piñatas para la celebracion de cumpleaños y fechas especiales en que las personas revientan piñatas.
texts.en:
The members of the group Manos Asendozas are three very hardworking women. This group is located in the municipal of El Paraiso. They know each other well and have always worked together since they are neighbors. The support that this loan gives them will be very important since they will be able to acquire more merchandise and raw material for their businesses. Below they will describe the different activities they do to earn a living. Yolanda R. D.: She has a small store where she sells clothing and shoes. She has worked in this way for 3 years and the earnings her business generates allows her to contribute to her husband’s household expenses. She has 3 children who are in their primary studies. Juana Lucila R. V.: She has owned and worked in her tailor’s shop for 19 years. This is her source of income generation that allows her to cover family expenses and other commitments. Currently Juana needs the loan since she has a lot of work to do and she needs to have all the fabric to be able to do the jobs and then the customers will pay her when she has finished their requests. Maria del Rosario Z.: Her primary activity is in trade, she has a small shop where she makes and sells piñatas and handicrafts. She has more than 19 years of experience in this activity, and it allows her to have a very good clientele. She sells her products to different candy stores, businesses, and particular people who ask her for piñatas for birthday celebrations and special days in which they resell the piñatas.

Translated from Spanish by Kelley Maynard, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of clothing, shoes, fabric, thread, sponges, lace, decorations,  decoraciones, paper, glue, pumps, wire, and forros, and linings

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Enjeru Group 2, Kyenjojo

texts.en: Simon Peter is the leader of his lending group in Kyenjojo. He is a hard working married man who sends his children to school while he takes care of other family members. Simon is a hard working and friendly man with a produce business in Enjeru trading center, and he is grateful that his efforts are yielding fruits. His goal is to ensure that his business grows in stock and customer base so that he could continue feeding his family and as well educate his children. He needs a loan to be able to buy more produce for resale, and this will enable him bring in an extra income.

loans.use: Buying more produce like beans, maize and irish for resale.

loans.name: Maria Del Socorro

texts.es: En el municipio de Somotillo barrio sagrada familia la señora Maria Pérez realiza la venta de sus productos utilizando una canasta en los campos de futbol y beisbol. Ella quiere el crédito para la compra de productos variados para tener surtida su venta y así aumentar su capital de trabajo y de esta manera agrandar sus ingresos familiares y mejorar su condición de vida.
texts.en:
In the town of Somotillo, and the neighborhood of Sagrada Familia, Maria sells her goods from a basket at the soccer field and basketball court. She wants this loan in order to buy various products to stock her business and to increase her business capital, and in this way to grow the household income and improve her standard of living.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Hynd, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Travelling vendor (sells sweets from a basket)

loans.name: Lidia Sumelda

texts.es: Lidia Sumelda tiene 46 años, su actividad económica es la venta de refrescos y por las noches ofrece el servicio de comida. Ella dio inicio a este negocio hace mas 5 años que se dedica a este negocio, por lo que siempre está buscando la forma de generar ingresos a su familia. Ella dio inicio, a esta actividad porque tenía desde muy joven le ha gustado trabajar y ganarse el pan de cada día humildemente. Ella sueña con tener una tienda grande en donde ofrezca una variedad de productos. El financiamiento que solicita es para la compra de materia prima, este no es el primer financiamiento pues han sido muy beneficiosos.
texts.en:
Lidia Sumelda, 46, sells soft-drinks and during the evening, prepared meals. She started this business over 5 years ago and is always looking for ways to produce income for her family. She started this business because she has always enjoyed working, even from a very early age, to earn her keep. She hopes with having a large store where she can stock a variety of products. She will use the funds to buy raw materials. This is not her first loan because they have been of great benefit to her.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients for meals preparation.

loans.name: Edwin

texts.es:
Edwin es un joven de 27 años está casado con la señora Karina Villegas juntos tienen 2 hermosos hijos el menor apenas tiene 3 semanas, son muy responsables y dedicados a su trabajo.

Edwin y su familia viven en la ciudad de Cochabamba en la comunidad de la maica central en la casa de sus padres, su principal actividad es la producción de la leche cruda cuyo producto entregan a una empresa que se dedica a la elaboración de productos lácteo, actualmente cuentan con 10 cabezas de ganado lechero, así como también Edwin trabaja en un taller de rectificador de motos.
El préstamo será destinado para la compra de forraje para su ganado, que ya actualmente esta temporada el costo de los insumos agrícolas se incrementa.

Entra sus sueños y metas es aumentar las cabezas de ganado lechero y de esta manera incrementar la producción de leche, uno de sus sueños más importantes es terminar de construir su casa, ya los padres le heredaron un terreno en la cual ya empezaron a construir y de esta manera ofrecerles una casa, en la cual cada uno de sus hijos puedan tener una habitación ya que actualmente viven muy incómodos en la casa de sus padres.
texts.en:
Edwin, 27, is married to Karina Villegas; they have two beautiful children, the youngest of whom is just three weeks old. They are very responsible and dedicated to their work. Edwin and his family live in the city of Cochabamba in the Maica Central community, in his parents' house. His main activity is the production of raw milk which is delivered to a firm that produces dairy products. They currently have 10 head of dairy cattle. Edwin also works at a motorcycle repair shop. The funds will be used to buy forage for his cows because the price of farm supplies rises during this season. Among his dreams and goals is to increase the number of cows so that milk production will increase. One of his most important dreams is to finish building his house since his parents willed him a piece of property on which they already have begun to build in order to give him a house in which each of his children can have a bedroom; currently they are quite uncomfortable in their parents' house.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy feed for his dairy cows.

loans.name: Francisco José

texts.es:
En el municipio de Nagarote, en León, el señor Francisco N. R. se dedica con gran esfuerzo a la actividad de la ganadería donde a diario dedica gran parte del tiempo a la crianza de ganado tales como vaquillas que posteriormente le saca el máximo provecho en la extracción de leche para su respectiva comercialización.

Está solicitando un crédito para invertirlo directamente en la compra de una vaquilla para aumentar su hato ganadero y de esta manera proceder a su crianza y en un futuro muy corto obtener el ingreso para el mantenimiento de su familia que tanto depende de él.
texts.en:
In Nagarote municipality, in León, Señor Francisco N. R. engages energetically in rearing livestock, spending a large part of each day tending his heifers that previously have provided him great benefit through milk production for commercialization. He is requesting a loan to invest directly in the purchase of a heifer to enlarge his herd, so he will soon be able to provide the income to maintain his family that is so dependent on him.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of livestock

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Maria Luisa

texts.es:
La señora Maria luisa G. Álvarez es trabajadora active del Instituto (Alfonzo cortes). Ella quiere el crédito para comprar cemento y de 100 bloques para la construcción de una división en su casa de habitación y así mejorar su condición de vida y de su familia.
Ella nos dice que los crédito que ha recibido con CEPRODEL la ha beneficiado ya que con ellos levanto su casa y hoy la esta acondicionando.
texts.en:
Señora Maria luisa G. Álvarez is a worker in the Alfonzo Cortes Institute. She needs this loan to purchase cement and 100 blocks to construct a wall in her house, improving her living conditions and those of her family. She tells us that the loans she has received through CEPRODEL have helped her, enabling her to construct her house, which today is being equipped.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of construction materials

loans.name: Yojana Lisbeth

texts.es:
En el municipio de Somotillo barrio las colinas la señora Yojana Lisbeth Ríos M. realiza la venta de sus productos (ropa Variada) en su tramo ubicado en el mercado municipal de esa localidad. Ella quiere el crédito para comprar ropa variada y así aumentar su inventario de mercadería y de esta manera agrandar su s ingresos familiares y mejorar sus condiciones de vida de ella y la de su familia.
Ella nos dice que los crédito que ha recibido de CEPRODEL la ha beneficiado ya que con ellos compro el tramo que hoy utiliza para vender sus productos y también lo acondiciono.
texts.en:
In the city of Somotillo in the neighborhood of Las Colinas, señora Yojana Lisbeth Ríos sells her products (various clothing items) at her location in the city market in the area. She wants this credit to be able to buy clothing and to increase her inventory so she can earn more income for her family and improve their living conditions. She tells us that the loans she has received from Ceprodel have benefitted her, and with them, she bought her location in the market that she uses to sell her products. She has also used her loans to fix up this location.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pants and shirts for her business

loans.name: Maria Margarita

texts.es:
La actividad principal a la que se dedica la Sra. María C. es la elaboración y venta de tortillas de Maíz, actividad a la cual se dedica desde hace siete años. Según va pasando el tiempo su negocio sigue en crecimiento; actualmente esta moliendo 14 medidas de Maíz diario, su negocio ya posee una empleada permanente a la cual le paga según la producción que elabora. 
Doña María vende sus tortillas a una sola persona y esta otra señora las vende en un puesto que tiene el mercado municipal de esta ciudad.
Doña María le hace entrega de las tortillas diario pero le cancelan los fines de semana y para moler esta cantidad de maíz ella nos comento que se levanta a las 2:00 a.m.
Doña Maria es una persona muy trabajadora y de reconocida solvencia moral, pero en la actualidad ella no cuenta con el capital de trabajo suficiente para la compra de maíz y también tiene un proyecto de construir una pieza mas de su casa pero que por los momentos solo va comprar los materiales para después construir y aprovechar en esta época los precios que estan mas bajos de lo normal,  y ella quiere tenerlos ya comprados.
texts.en:
The main work that Mrs. Maria C. does is making and selling corn tortillas. She has been doing this for the past seven years. As time passes, her business has grown and she is currently grinding 14 lots of corn every day. She has a permanent employee whom she pays according to how much she produces. Maria sells her tortillas to one person and this lady sells them in a stand that she has in the main market of this city. Maria delivers the tortillas every day but not on weekends. She tells us that to grind this quantity of corn, she needs to get up at 2:00 am. Maria is a hard-working woman and well-known for her reliability and morality. She tells us that now she doesn’t have enough working capital to buy corn, and also she has a project of building one more room in her house. At this time she wants to buy the construction materials to build later on. She would like to take advantage of this period when prices are lower than normal, and have the materials bought.

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy construction materials and corn

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Cirila

texts.es:
Cirila C. es una señora de 36 años, ella es muy responsable y dedicada a su trabajo, ya que hace 3 años que falleció su madre y entonces tuvo que hacerse cargo de sus dos hermanos menores a su padres no lo conoce ya que los abandono cuando eran muy pequeños.

La señora Cirila vive en la Ciudad de Cochabamba en la comunidad de Vinto chico, vive en la pequeña casa  casa que le dejo su madre, su principal actividad es la producción de la leche cruda cuyo producto entrega a una empresa que se dedica a la elaboración de productos lácteos, actualmente tiene 6 cabezas de ganado lechero.

El préstamo será destinado para la compra de un ganado lechero, con lo cual incrementara la producción de la leche y mejorara el nivel de ingresos.
Entre sus sueños y metas es incrementas la cantidad de ganado lechero, y lo más importante seguir ayudando a sus dos hermanos , y que puedan estudiar una carrera profesional ya que ella no pudo estudiar ni el bachillerato por la extrema escases de recursos económicos por que la madre enfermo durante 3 años y ella tuvo que cuidarla y trabajar.
texts.en:
Cirila C., 36, is a very responsible woman who is dedicated to her work. Three years ago her mother died and she had to take in her two younger brothers; she does not know her father because he abandoned them when they were very young. Cirila lives in the city of Cochabamba in the Vinto Chico community, in a small house that her mother left her. Her main activity is raw milk production that is delivered to a firm that manufactures dairy products. Currently, she has 6 head of dairy cattle. The funds will be used to by another cow which will increase milk production and thereby income. Among her dreams and goals is to increase her herd of dairy cattle and, most importantly, to continue to help her two brothers so that they can study professional careers since she wasn't even able to finish high school because of the extreme poverty which led to her mother's illness that lasted three years during which time she had to care for her mother and work.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy dairy cows.

loans.name: Albis

texts.es:
Albis M. Z., tiene la edad de 62 años, está casado, y tiene 2 hijos que son su mayor prioridad. Ellos tienen 26 y 22 años. El crédito lo quiere para la compra de algunos terneros y su alimentación. Desea darle el adecuado mantenimiento al ganado para obtener el mayor ingreso posible cuando se vendan. También desea aumentar el número de animales y poder mantenerlos en mejores condiciones, cuenta con un área idónea para el mantenimiento y cría del ganado. Es la primera vez que realiza un crédito con FUDECOSUR y está muy contento con las facilidades que se le brindaron. Don Albis tiene varios años dedicada al ganado. El espera en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mayor estabilidad económica, y de poder seguir creciendo como persona y como productor.

About FUDECOSUR:
The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org
texts.en:
Albis M. Z., is 62, married, and has 2 children who are his top priority. They are 26 and 22. He wants this loan to buy some calves and feed for them.He hopes to give them adequate care so he can make the most income possible when he sells them. He also wants to increase the number of animals he has and keep them in better conditions. He has a suitable area for caring for and raising the cattle. This is his first loan with FUDECOSUR, and he is very happy with the terms they have offered him. Don Albis has raised cattle for several years. In the future, he hopes to offer his family a better quality of life and more economic stability and to continue growing as a person and a producer. About FUDECOSUR: The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase cattle

loans.name: Purificacion

texts.es:
La Sra. Purificación A., tiene dos años de dedicarse al comercio y su actividad principal es la venta de Ropa nueva.- dicha actividad la realiza de manera ambulante y domiciliar.
Doña Purificación sale a vender la mercadería en diferentes comunidades y aldeas circunvecinas al Municipio de Teupasenti, lugar donde casi no tiene competencia, viaja para vender en lugares donde los demás comerciantes es muy raro que lo hagan.  
Ella vende una gran variedad de ropa como ser: Pantalón Jeans de varón y de mujer, blusas, camisas, cameras, sandalias de hule, toallas, ropa interior para ambos sexos, cobijas etc.
necesita el credito para comprar mas mercaderia y asi poder vender mas en los lugares que visita.
las ganancias las necesita para sacar adelante a su familia que es lo mas importante que ella tiene en su vida.
texts.en:
Purificación A. has been a merchant for two years; her main product is new clothing. She sells door-to-door and from home. Purificación goes out to the various neighborhoods and villages surrounding Teupasenti, where she hardly has any competition; she goes to areas where it is rare that other merchants visit. She sells a wide variety of articles of clothing like: jeans for men and women, blouses, shirts, rubber sandals, towels, underwear for both men and women, blankets, etc. She needs funding to buy more merchandise so that she can sell more in the areas she visits. The profits are needed to support her family, who are the most important thing in her life.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pants, t-shirts, blouses, pajamas, sandals, underwear.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Eduardo

texts.es:
El  Señor Eduardo L. V., tiene 58 años y está casada con la señora Lidia Martha Pinto de L.  por más de 25 años, La esposa tiene una  tienda de abarrotes que vende diariamente en el pueblo de colomi, el esposo se dedica a la producción de tubérculos , hortalizaslos  los productos son vendidos en la fría de colomi. Los insumos agrícolas que utiliza para la siembra de tubérculos y hortalizas son  abono orgánico de gallinaza, semilla de papa certificada que son adquiridos de las tiendas que venden los insumos agrícolas.

El señor Eduardo L.  y su familia  viven en el pueblo de colomi  la actividad principal es la agricultura que realiza en la comunidad de liriuni. Para ellos es difícil acudir a los bancos en busca de préstamo, el Cidre  está en la zona de colomi que  para ellos es más fácil  solicitar un crédito  para comprar insumos agrícolas que necesitan para la siembra.

El mayor sueño de don Eduardo y su esposa Lidia, es sacar profesionales a sus tres hijos, el mayor  tiene 18 años, el que sigue 16 años y el ultimo 14 años, para ellos necesita ampliar mas la producción agrícolas  y tener ingresos suficientes que pueden cubrir los gastos de estudio de sus tres hijos.
texts.en:
Eduardo L. V., 58, has been married to Lidia Martha Pinto de L. for over 25 years. The wife has a grocery store that she tends to daily in the town of Colomi; the husband is a farmer. He sells his products in Colomi's market. The farming suppies he needs for his tuber and vegetable crops are: organic hen dung manure and certified potato seed. These are available in farming supply stores. Eduardo L. and his family live in the town of Colomi; his main activity is farming, which he does in the community of Liriuni. It is difficult for them to access bank loans. Cidre, however, is in Colomi and it is easier for them to ask for funds for the farming supplies they need for their crops. Eduardo and Lidia's greatest dream is to have their three children become professionals. The oldest is 18, the next one is 16 and the youngest is 14 years old. He needs to increase his agricultural production for them in order to have sufficient income to cover educational expenses for his three children.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy farming supplies.

loans.name: Fidel

texts.es:
el sr. Fidel C. tiene 46 años de edad, vive en la colonia Bella Orizonte en la ciudad de Choluteca. esta casado y tiene 4 hijos, su esposa se queda todos los dias en su casa para el cuidado de sus hijos y para estar pendiente de sus estudios ya que todos estan estudiando.
Fidel se levanta a las 4 de la mañana todos los dias para vender sus frutas, en estos momentos el necesita mas capital para comprar sandias y naranjas ya que las ventas estan buenas.
Fidel se transporta a otro lugar para comprar las frutas, cuando las frutas se le terminan rapido esto hace que tenga mas gastos porque tiene que estar viajando mas a dicho lugar, por eso es que quiere comprar mas y asi tener para varios dias sin tener que estarse movilizando para comprarlas. esto le ahorraria mucho dinero para el.
las ganancias las necesita para cubrir las necesidades de su familia.
texts.en:
Fidel C. is 46 years old, and lives in the Bella Horizonte Colony in Choluteca. He is married and has 4 children. His wife stays at home to take care of the children and oversee their studies, for they are all students. Fidel gets up every day at 4 in the morning to sell his fruit. Right now, he needs funds to buy watermelon and oranges, since sales are good. Fidel travels elsewhere to buy the fruit, and when he runs out quickly, he incurs additional expense, because he has to travel even more. For this reason, he wishes to buy more and have stock for several days, without having to travel to buy fruit. This would save him a lot of money. He needs his earnings to cover his family’s needs.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Jane Wilkie, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fruit:  watermelon and oranges

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase cattle

loans.name: Felix Pedro

texts.es:
el sr. Felix Pedro M. tiene 46 años de edad, vive en la aldea San Geronimo, Namasigue, departamento de Choluteca.
Felix se dedica a la venta de charamuscas de varios sabores, las elabora con frutas, leche, agua, y tambien en algunos casos utiliza saborizantes o refrescos en polvo.
las charamuscas son muy vendidas en esta comunidad ya que es una zona de altas temperaturas y las personas las compran para refrescarse un poco del calor que hace.
sus clientes lo prefieren ya que son elaboradas con mucha higiene, pero lo mejor de las charamuscas es su delicioso sabor.
ahorita don Felix necesita el credito para comprar mas frutas y materiales para la elaboracion de las charamuscas, viene la temporada escolar y la temporada de semana santa y este producto tiene mucha demanda.
con las ganancias que obtenga podra cubrir con los gastos de su familia y su hogar.
texts.en:
Felix Pedro M. is 46 years old. He lives in the town of San Geronimo, Namasigue, departament of Choluteca. Felix sells charamuscas- handmade popsicles frozen in baggies-in different flavors.
