He makes them with fruit, milk, water and in some cases he also uses flavorings or powdered drinks. The charamuscas sell very well in this community, since it is an area with high temperatures and people buy them to cool off a little from the heat. His clients prefer him since he makes them in a very hygienically, but the best part about the charamuscas is their delicious flavor. Right now, Felix needs the loan to buy more fruit and materials to make the charamuscas. The school year is about to begin and Holy Week is coming and this product is in high demand. With the earnings he will make he will be be able to cover his family's and his home's expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fruit, milk, water, sugar, bags.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Martha Lorena

texts.es: Martha Lorena D. en el 2004 instalo un pequeño taller de calzado que carecía de las condiciones necesarias para el trabajo pero con los créditos ella ha logrado además de invertir en la producción mejorar las instalaciones con sus ganancias. Esto hizo que establecer un negocio más prospero actualmente invertirá en la producción de una línea veraniega de calzado por lo que está cerca semana santa.
texts.en:
In 2004 Martha Lorena D. set up a small cobbler's shop that lacked the necessary components to do the work. However, with funding she has been able to invest in production and to improve the installations with her profits. This led to a more prosperous business and she will currently invest in a line of Summer shoes because Holy Week is approaching.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy shoemaking supplies and raw materials.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy cattle.

loans.name: Martha Del Carmen

texts.es: Martha  del Carmen de 33 años de edad es soltera, tiene una niña de 6 añitos edad estudia su segundo grado de educaciòn primaria, trabaja para el poder Judicial desde 5 años como Juez Local Civil,  actualmente està estudiando su segunda carrera licenciatura en Inglès,  es una profesional con muchos deseos de superaciòn profesional y laboral, se caracteriza por responsable, honesta y de buenas costumbres, esta solicitando su 2do credito para mejorar su vivienda, pues desea construir una habitaciòn para asì brindarle mayor comodidad a su pequeña hija y contar con mejores condiciones en el hogar, pues es el patrimonio que en el futuro le dejara a su pequeñita.
texts.en:
Martha del Carmen is 33 years old, single, and she has a little 6-year-old girl, who is completing second grade in primary school. For 5 years she had been working for the court system, as Civil Local Judge. She is currently studying for her second career, a degree in English. She is a professional, eager to grow professionally and in her work life. She is a reliable, honest person, with good habits. She is requesting her second loan in order to improve her house. She wants to build a room to offer a better home life for her little daughter, for the house is what she will leave the child in the future.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Jane Wilkie, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Building a room

loans.name: Pascuala Del Carmen

texts.es:
La señora Pascuala del Carmen P. de 52 años es una mujer trabajadora, fuerte, emprendedora y con mucho deseo de seguir adelante. Ella inicio en el 2000 con la comercialización de frutas de forma ambulante por los andenes del mercado de Masaya y algunos barrios aledaños a su hogar. En el 2003 decide invertir en la producción de pinolillo bebida típica a base de maíz y cacao los cuales se tuestan y se dan a moler.
P. con el préstamo comprara  maíz, leña, cacao y frutas para que su negocio siga creciendo y un día poder instalar una pequeña venta en su casa.
texts.en:
Pascuala del Carmen P., 52, is a strong, hard-working, enterprising woman with a strong desire to succeed. In 2000 she began to sell fruit along the sidewalks around Masaya's market and in some of the neighborhoods near her home. In 2003 she decided to invest in pinolillo (a typical beverage made from toasted, ground corn and cocoa). She will use the funds to buy corn, firewood, cocoa and fruits so that her business will continue to grow and someday be able to set up a small sales operation in her home.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fruits, corn, cocoa and firewood.

loans.name: Ide Del Carmen

texts.es:
En el Mercado Mayoreo de Managua, la señora Ide H. se dedica a diario a atender su negocio de venta de ropa ofreciendo todo tipo de ropa tanto para damas, caballeros y niños.

Actualmente ella está solicitando un crédito que será invertido en la compra de piezas tales como camiseta, calcetines, blusas, entre otros. Ella espera que dicho crédito le sea otorgado para comercializar la ropa y así generar ingresos para su negocio y familia.
texts.en:
Ide H. sells all kinds of clothes for women, men and children in her business in Managua's Mayoreo market. She is asking for funds to buy articles of clothing like: t-shirts, socks, blouses, among others. She hopes the loan will be approved so that she can sell the clothes and continue thereby to generate income for her business and her family.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothing.

loans.name: Lita

texts.es:
En el Mercado Mayoreo, la señora Lita M. se dedica a su negocio de venta de productos descartables como vasos, platos, cubiertos y bolsas plásticas siendo comercializadas todos los días desde muy tempranas horas de la mañana hasta el atardecer.

La señora Lita está solicitando el crédito para ser invertido en la compra de los productos descartables para continuar en la venta en el mercado.
texts.en:
Lita M. sells disposable items like: drinking glasses, plates, cutlery, plastic bags every day from very early in the morning until nightfall in Managua's Mayoreo market. Lita is asking for funds to buy disposable items to continue to sell them in the market.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy disposable items.

loans.name: María Jesús

texts.es:
En el Mercado Mayoreo, la señora María L. se dedica con gran ahínco a atender su propio negocio de elaboración y venta de alimentos vendiendo también las bebidas como son jugos, gaseosas y agua las que coloca en su refrigerador para exhibición a sus clientes.

Actualmente está solicitando un crédito para invertirlo en la compra de las bebidas y también en la compra de materia prima para la elaboración de los alimentos. Ella espera ser beneficiada con el crédito para así brindar un buen servicio a sus clientes.
texts.en:
María L. tends to her food preparation and sales business in the Mayoreo market with much care and dedication; she also sells beverages like fruit juices, soft drinks and water, which she stores in her cooler for display to her customers. She is asking for funding to buy beverages and also to buy ingredients for her meals. She hopes the loan will be granted so that she can continue to provide good service to her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients for her meals and to buy beverages.

loans.name: Elvia

texts.es:
Elvia M. Q., tiene la edad de 32 años, está casada, y tiene 2 hijos que es son mayor prioridad. Ellos tienen 7 y 4 años. El crédito lo quiere para la compra de una vaca para leche . La idea es tener ganado con producción de leche para consumo propio y para venderla  en la comunidad y así maximizar sus ganancias. Es la primera vez que realiza un crédito con FUDECOSUR y está muy contenta con las facilidades que se le brindaron. Ella cuenta con una propiedad de pasto para la alimentación y desarrollo de los animales.Doña Elvia trabaja desde hace muchos años con el ganado. Ella espera en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mayor estabilidad económica, y de poder seguir creciendo como persona y sobre todo como productora.

About FUDECOSUR:
The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org
texts.en:
Elvia M. Q., 32, is married and has two children, who are her greatest priority; they are 7 and 4 years old. She wants funding to buy a dairy cow. The idea is to have cattle so that the milk produced can be used both for her own consumption and to sell in the community thereby maximizing her profits. This is her first loan with FUDECOSUR and she is very happy with the loan terms she got. She has a pasturage area suited to the feeding and development of the animals. Elvia has worked with cattle for many years. She hopes to provide her family with a better quality of life and greater economic stability in the future and to continue to grow as a person and, above all, as a producer.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cattle.

loans.name: Alejandro Isabel

texts.es: El señor Alejandro O. Gaitán desde hace nueve años instalo una pequeña panadería en su hogar que en un principio solo trabajaban él y su esposa pero como no se daban abasto decidieron contratar a dos personas. Actualmente tienen muchos pedidos e invertirá el préstamo en la compra de materia prima para la producción.
texts.en:
Nine years ago, Alejandro O. Gaitán started a small bread bakery in his home. At the beginning, only he and his wife worked in it, but since they couldn't keep up anymore they decided to hire two people. At present they have a lot of orders and he will invest the loan in the purchase of raw materials for production.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For raw materials such as flour, eggs, milk, yeast, cheese, preserves, etc.

loans.name: Aura Lila

texts.es:
La señora Aura lila se dedica a la venta de ropa en general para adultos y niños su tramo esta ubicado en al mercado central, desde tempranas horas de la mañana llega a su tramo ya que tiene mucha demanda por parte de sus clientes.

Este crédito que solicito para la compra de camisas de bebe, camisa de colegios, pantalones, blusas, bóxer, bolsos.
texts.en:
Señora Aura Lila sells clothing for adults and children at a stand in the central market. She starts working early in the morning when she arrives to her stand since she has a lot of demand from her customers. She requested this loan to buy shirts for babies, shirts for school uniforms, pants, blouses, boxers, and purses.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise like shirts for babies, shirts for school uniforms, shorts, pants, boxers, purses, etc.

loans.name: Silvia Julia

texts.es:
Silvia tiene 44 años de edad, se separó hace 12 años y actuamente vive con tres de sus cuatro hijos en el distrito de Paiján, en la provincia de Ascope, en la región La Libertad. Ubicada a tres horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Desde hace más de diez años se dedica a la venta de emoliente (bebidas calientes elaboradas con hierbas naturales) en un carrito especialmente diseñado para esta actividad. Ella nos comenta que anteriormente trabajaba como obrera agrícola y que unos amigos la animaron a ofrecer su producto. Silvia ofrece su producto de 4am a 9am  el mercado de la ciudad y de 5:30pm a 8:30pm en el terminal terrestre de la ciudad.

Este producto goza de muy buena acogida en la zona por lo que Silvia desea ampliarlo, por ello se encuentra solicitando a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que desea utilizar en la compra de ingredientes para la preparación de más emoliente.

Silvia es una mujer alegre y muy emprendedora. Su mayor anhelo es darle a sus hijos la oportunidad de tener un futuro mejor, ella ya ha trabajado anteriomente con nuestra Institución y ha demostrado puntualidad y responsabilidad al momento de asumir sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Silvia, 44, has been separated for the last 12 years and currently lives with three of her four children in Paiján district, Ascope province, La Libertad region located three hours from the city of Chiclayo. For over 10 years she has sold emolientes (hot herbal beverages) from a small, specially designed for this activity, cart. She tells us that she used to work as a farmhand and some friends encouraged her to offer her product for sale. Silvia works from 4am until 9am in the municipal market and from 5:30pm until 8:30pm at the city's bus station. This product is very well received in the area so Silvia wants to increase production. She is asking Edpyme Alternativa for a 1000 new sol loan to buy ingredients to make more emoliente. Silvia is a cheerful, very enterprising woman. Her greatest wish is to provide her children with the opportunity for a better future. She has collaborated previously with our institution and has shown punctuality and responsibility with respect to her repayment obligations.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients for her soothing herbal teas.

loans.name: Ricarda

texts.es:
La señora Ricarda inicia su dia de trabajo abriendo su tramo desde las 8:00 Am ofertando los diferentes tipos de artisanias confeccionados en madera y palmas, su negocio esta ubicado en el mercado central.
 
Este crédito que solicito es  para la compra de perchas de madera, roperos, mesas, sombreros de palma, petates, cómodas de madera y otras variedades.

Cabe mencionar que la señora Ricarda gracias a los   créditos con Ceprodel le ha permitido hacer sus compras de contado lo que le genera mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
Ricarda starts her work day at 8am. She sells all kinds of crafts made from wood and palm fronds; her business is located in the central market. She is asking for funding to buy wood coat racks, armoires, tables, palm hats, palm frond mats, wood chests, etc. It is worth mentioning that Ricarda, thanks to Ceprodel loans, has been able to buy paying cash which generates better profits for her.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy wood, coat stands, closets, chests, hats, wood wisks, small tables, palm frond mats, etc.

loans.name: Dominga Anastacia

texts.es: La señora Dominga está solicitando un crédito  dice que los préstamos han influido favorablemente en su vida, ya que le ha ayudado a generar ganancias que le ayudan a suplir las necesidades familiares. Además de esto Dominga sabes muy bien la elaboración de repostería, pues lo realiza cuando no tiene mucho trabajo, ya que siempre está luchando con sus hijos  por lo que su único problema han sido las enfermedades que han atacado a su familia y a ella ultimadamente. Actualmente solicita este financiamiento para capital de trabajo que será destinado para la compra de ropa nueva. Sueña con mejorar su vivienda para dejárselas a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Dominga is asking for funding; she says that the loans have been a positive influence in her life because they have helped her generate profits that have helped her meet household expenses. Dominga knows how to make pastries very well; she makes them when she doesn't have a lot of work to do because she is always struggling with her children. Her only problem has been illnesses that have befallen her family and herself lately. She is asking for funding to buy new clothing. She dreams with improving her dwelling so that she can leave it to her children.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothing.

loans.name: Ramona Del Rosario

texts.es:
La señora Ramona se dedica a la venta de verduras en su tramo que esta ubicado en el mercado central, realiza sus compras de contado al por mayor.
  
Este crédito que solicito es  para la compra de plátanos, yuca, banano, naranja, remolacha, tomate, cebolla, apio, zanahoria y otros.

Cabe mencionar que la señora Ramona es madre soltera de dos niños lo cuales actualmente van a la escuela para tener un mejor futuro, el cual es el sueño de su mamá.
texts.en:
Ramona sells vegetables in her stand located in the central market; she buys wholesale and pays cash. This loan will be used to buy bananas, yucca, oranges, plantain, beets, tomatoes, onion, celery, carrots, etc. It is worth mentioning that Ramona is a single mother of two children, who are currently going to school to have a better future; this is their mother's dream.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy yucca, banana, plantain, oranges, beets, and pickling spices.

loans.name: Jehova Jireh Group

texts.es:
ALCANCIA COMUNAL JEHOVA JIREH 
Yolanda es una socia activa y líder del grupo que apoya de manera coordinada con las demás socias. Ella se dedica a la venta de productos naturales que le permiten mejorar su salud y ayudar con el bienestar de las demás personas.
Los trabajos de acuerdo a la campaña es una buena oportunidad para Lucila, en los primeros meses de verano vende helados, chupetes de frutas, hielo y otros productos. Ahora que empieza la campaña escolar, el crédito recibido lo invertirá en la compra de útiles escolares que le permita obtener ganancia para la mantención de sus hijos.
Katherine es madre soltera y tiene una  pequeña hija que es la razón de vivir y por lo que debe salir adelante, al igual que otras socias se dedica a la venta de zapatos Y ropa según la estación, compra mercadería de acuerdo a los pedidos que sus clientes le solicitan. Como en todo negocio tiene mucha competencia pero con mucho esfuerzo puede vender sus productos.
Diana se dedica a la costura hace varios años, además hace trabajos de bordados que le permiten aportar con los gastos en su casa.
Las socias tienen muchos objetivos y esperan cumplirlos gracias a la ayuda de EDAPROSPO y KIVA. Los préstamos otorgados los invertirán en sus diferentes negocios.
texts.en:
JEHOVA JIREH COMMUNAL BANK Yolanda is an active member and leader of the group; she supports her fellow members unconditionally. She sells natural products designed to improve the health and wellbeing of people. Lucila works according to school seasons. During the first months of Summer she sells frozen treats, fruit popsicles, ice and other products. Now that the new school term is about to begin she will use the funds to buy school supplies so that she can earn profits to support her children. Katherine is a single mother of a young daughter who is her main reason to live and continue forging ahead. Like other group members, she sells shoes and clothes. According to the season, she buys merchandise based on orders her customers place. As with any business, she has much competition but, with a lot of effort, she is able to sell her products. Diana has been a seamstress for many years; she also does embroidery which makes it possible for her to contribute to meeting household expenses. The members have many objectives and hope to meet them thanks to help from EDAPROSPO and KIVA. The loans will be invested in their various businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy products.

loans.name: Yorleny

texts.es:
Yorleny M. A., tiene la edad de 34 años, está en unión libre, y no tienen hijos. El crédito lo quiere para la compra de algunos terneros para así aumentar su número. Desea darle el adecuado mantenimiento al ganado para obtener el mayor ingreso posible cuando se vendan. También desea aumentar el número de animales y poder mantenerlos en mejores condiciones, cuenta con un área idónea para el mantenimiento y cría del ganado. Es la primera vez que realiza un crédito con FUDECOSUR y está muy contenta con las facilidades que se le brindaron. Doña Yorleny tiene varios años dedicada al ganado. Ella espera en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mayor estabilidad económica, y de poder seguir creciendo como persona y como productora.

About FUDECOSUR:
The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org
texts.en:
Yorleny M. A., 34, is in a common-law relationship and has no children. She will use the funds to buy a few calves. She wants to provide them with adequate care so that she can earn the highest possible profits upon their sale. She also wants to increase the number of animals and raise them under better conditions. She has a space that is suitablel for cattle raising. This is her first loan with FUDECOSUR and she is very happy with the terms she was offered. Yorleny has been in cattle raising for several years. She hopes to provide her family with a better quality of life and greater economic stability in the future; she also aims to continue to grow both as a person and as a producer.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a few calves.

loans.name: Candelaria

texts.es:
La señora Candelaria, inicia sus ventas de comida desde las 10:30, sus ricos platillos son elaborados en su casa de habitación para luego ser trasladados a su puesto de venta en el mercado central.

Este crédito que solicito es  para la compra de arroz, frijoles, aceite, pollo, carne, pescados.

Algo relevante de la señora Candelaria es que su negocio lo inicio en su casa con la ayuda de su mamá, y hoy en día ha incrementado su clientela por los ricos platillos de comida que solo ella sabes hacer.
texts.en:
Candelaria starts her food sales at 10:30. She makes her delicious meals at home and then transports them to her sales stall in the central market. The loan will be used to buy rice, beans, cooking oil, chicken, meat and fish. Something relevant about Candelaria is that she started her business with her mother's help and to date her customer base has grown thanks to the delicious meals only she knows how to make.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy basic grains like: rice, beans, cooking oil, chicken, meat and fish.

loans.name: Martha Agueda

texts.es:
La señora Martha se levanta de horas tempranas para elaborar los diferentes sabores de refresco para luego trasladarse a su puesto de venta en el mercado central finalizando a las 4:00 pm.

Este crédito que solicito es  para la compra de frutas como: zanahoria, naranjas, granadillas, papaya, azúcar, leña  y otros.
texts.en:
Martha rises very early in the morning to make the various flavors of beverages to then transport them to her sales stall in the central market where her work day ends at 4pm The loan will be used to buy fruits like: carrots, oranges, passion fruit, papaya, sugar, firewood and others.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy milk, sugar, papaya, oranges, passion fruit, linseed, firewood, pastries and others.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: For farm improvements.

loans.name: Denis Fernando M

texts.es: Este cliente es originario de la ciudad de Chinandega y es casado padre de 02 hijos los cuales mantiene con la actividad agrícola el crédito lo utilizara para la compra de insumos y alquiler de tierras para la siembra del primer siclo
texts.en:
This client is from the city of Chinandega; he's married and the father of two children, whom he supports through farming. He will use the funds to buy supplies and to lease farmland for the first planting cycle.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To lease farmland.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Maria Elsa

texts.es: La señora Maria Elsa  tiene 57 años. La señora Maria tiene 21 años de dedicarse a la venta de especies, este no es el primer financiamiento que ha realizado con Fundación León 2000, pues siempre le han sido de mucha ayuda. Por lo que siempre está ofreciendo sus productos de manera ambulante, pues es aquí en donde obtiene variedad de clientes, esto le ayuda en lo necesario para mantener a su familia. Ahora cuenta con una gran variedad de clientes. El crédito será invertido en la compra de mayor cantidad de mercancías. Su sueño siempre ha sido mejorar su nivel de vida y mejorar su vivienda.
texts.en:
Maria Elsa is 57 years old. For the past 21 years, Maria has worked selling spices. This is not the first loan she has taken out with the León 2000 Foundation, which has always been a great help to her. Maria sells her products by going from place to place, since in this way she reaches a wide range of customers. This business helps her support her family and provide for their basic needs. She now has a great variety of customers. The loan will be invested in purchasing a larger quantity of merchandise. Her dream has always been to improve her standard of living and improve her home.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Francisco

texts.en:
Francisco, 52, is a fisherman requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP from Community Economic Ventures, Inc. He is still single and devotes much of his time to fishing. He lacks capital to run his business, so that's why he sought help from CEVI.  He likes its services because of their low interest rates and this lets him have profit.

He started his fishing business way back in 2000 and now he wants it to grow more. He wishes to buy more nets for fishing with the loan he will be granted.

loans.use: To buy fishing nets

loans.name: Felisa

texts.en:
Felisa, 39, owns a "sari-sari" (variety) store. She sells various types of goods in her store to provide the daily needs for those in her neighborhood. 

She started this kind of business in 2000. Now she’s a member of Community Economic Ventures, Inc. to get a loan of 12,000 PHP, enough to provide additional capital to fill her store with groceries. She is still single and has more time for managing her store.

This loan will be a great help in providing more groceries for her store.

loans.use: To buy groceries.

loans.name: Rosa Delia

texts.es: Rosa Delia tiene 50 años de edad, por lo que tiene 3 hijos pero todos trabajan de manera independiente. La señora Rosa se dedica a una pulpería, principalmente golosinas, pan, detergentes, refrescos naturales, galletas entre otros productos. Hace más de 3 años que se dedica a este negocio, en ese tiempo empezó con un capital pequeño y fue ahorrando poco a poco hasta lograr tener suficiente clientela. El crédito será invertido en la compra de materia prima para su negocio. Su meta es llegar a tener una tienda variada que en donde ofrezca muchas cosas.
texts.en:
Rosa Delia, 50, has three children, all of whom work independently. Rosa has a grocery store where she sells, for the most part, snacks, bread, detergent, fuit juices, cookies, among other products. She has been in this line of work for over 3 years. She began with a small capital investment and gradually saved up until she had a suitable customer base. She will use the funds to buy stock items for her store. Her eventual goal is to have a store in which she stocks many things.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stock items for her store.

loans.name: Nohemí De Los Angeles

texts.es:
La señora Nohemí tiene una pulpería en el departamento de León donde ofertar sus productos tales como granaos básicos, galletas, golosinas, mantequilla y otros. También vende papel higienico, pastas dentales y otros productos de uso personal. 

Actualmente está solicitando un crédito para ser invertido directamente en la compra de granos básicos tales como: azúcar, maíz, trigo, aceite, frijoles, y otros para continuar ofertandolos en su pulpería.  

Cabe mencionar que la señora Nohemí trabaja arduamente en su tramo para darle una mejor forma de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Ms. Nohemí has a store front in the León market where she sells her products like basic grains, crackers, candies, butter and other things. She also sells toilet paper, tooth paste and other personal hygiene products. She is currently requesting this loan to invest directly in food stuffs like sugar, corn, wheat, olive oil, beans and other products to be sold at her storefront. Ms. Nohemí works very hard at her job to be able to improve the living conditions of her family.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy basic grains like rice, corn, beans; cooking oil, sugar, toilet paper, soap, shampoo, Nido brand milk, and others.

loans.name: Rosa Maria

texts.es: El negocio de doña Rosa, es la producción de ricas rosquillas y cosa de horno, elaboradas de maíz, queso, manteca, dulce y procesadas al horno Desde hace varios años es su fuente de ingreso. Tiene 44 años de edad, con dos hermosos hijos , su esposo se dedica ala agricultura, y quien dio dinero para comenzar a trabajar, luego opto por financiamientos para invertir en mas y desplazarse al mercado. Las dificultades es que el maíz se pone a veces caro lo que tiene que subir el precio al producto y se bajan las ventas,y se desequilibra un poco, con esta solicitud comprara productos paa seguir elaborando sus productos como; maíz, manteca, dulce, queso, azúcar, leña, entre otros, así como seguir reparando el horno por que le tiene que dar mantenimiento, ya que no ha construido el otro que tiene previsto. Unos de sus objetivos es poder ayudar a sus hijos para que concluyan el ciclo de estudio y expandir las ventas para una mejor ganancia.
texts.en:
Rosa's business is making delicious rosquillas (round pastries) and other baked goods, made from corn, cheese, shortening and cane sweetener, and baked in the oven. For the past few years, this has been her source of income. She is 44 years old and has two handsome sons. Her husband works in agriculture, and he provided her with the funds to get started with her work. Later, she chose to take out loans in order to invest more in her business and travel to the market. One of the difficulties she faces is that corn sometimes becomes expensive; she has to raise the price of her product, and her sales fall, throwing her business a little off balance. With the loan she is requesting, she will buy ingredients to continue preparing her products, such as corn, shortening, cane sweetener, cheese, sugar, and firewood, among others. She will also carry out repairs to her oven, since it currently needs maintenance; she has not built another one as she had earlier planned. Her goals include helping her sons complete their level of study and expanding her sales for greater profits.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying corn, shortening, sugar, cane sweetener, and cheese to prepare more rosquilla pastries, and servicing her oven

loans.name: Milton Javier

texts.es:
EL SR. M. ES UN CLIENTE QUE SE DEDICA A LA SIEMBRA DE AJONJOLI  EN LA ZONA DE EL INGENIO M,ONTE ROSA  EL SOLICITA EL CREDITO PARA LA COMPRA Y REPARACION DE IMPLEMENTOS AGRICOLA 
ES UN CLIENTE QUE CON ESFUERZO PROPIO A ESTADO SEMBRANDO AREAS PEQUEÑAS SOLICITA EL CREDITO PARA TECNIFICAR SUS LABORES AGRICOLAS.
texts.en:
Mr. M. is a client who is a sesame farmer in the Ingenio Monte Rosa area. He is asking for funds to buy and repair farming equipment. He is a client who has been, through his own efforts, planting in small areas and he wants the loan to make technical improvements to his farming tasks.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy farming supplies.

loans.name: Carol

texts.en:
Carol is a fish vendor and at the same time she also has a small garden where she grows her vegetables.  She joins in Community Economic Ventures, Inc. because it helps her finance her business with a low rate of interest.

She needs a loan amounting to PHP 12,000 to buy fertilizers for her garden and some items for her fishing business.  Like any other entrepreneur, she wants to be successful.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers

loans.name: Cirila

texts.en:
Cirila is managing a hog-raising business in Bohol.  She is 59 years old, and a mother of four children. She sustains her family with her business.  She wants her business to grow in order to help her family financially and to send her children to school.  

Cirila joined Community Economic Ventures, Inc. in 2006.  She is now requesting a loan of 20,000 PHP to acquire more pigs and to buy feed for them.

loans.use: to purchase more pigs and feed

loans.name: Dios Es Amor Y Mi Guia Group

texts.es:
DIOS ES AMOR Y MI GUIA
La Sra. Shirley que es socia del grupo fue quien invito y organizo a sus compañeras para formar  la Alcancía Comunal DIOS ES AMOR Y MI GUIA el cual se caracteriza por ser muy unidas. La mayoría de las socias se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza. 
Marina es una mujer emprendedora y responsable, es por eso que fue elegida presidenta del grupo, hace muchos años aperturo una tienda en su casa, eso la ayudo a mantener y educar a sus 5 hijos. Ahora el deseo de Marina es ayudar a sus vecinas enseñándoles todo lo aprendido a lo largo de su vida.
La venta de chupetes y gelatina en verano es un buen negocio para Lucila, esto lo viene haciendo hace 7 años, además en casa ella se dedica a la costura, es muy conocida por sus vecinos y es por eso que le traen mucho trabajo, ella está feliz ya que mediante estos trabajos puede mantener a su familia juntamente con su esposo.
Segunda se dedica a la venta de diferentes productos tales como zapatos, ropa, ropa interior y muchas veces vende hasta menú según el pedido que le solicitan. El único interés es el bienestar de su familia. 
El destino del financiamiento será para la compra de insumos y productos para surtir sus diferentes negocios. Los socios agradecen y valoran la oportunidad brindada a EDAPROSPO Y KIVA, asimismo se comprometen en cumplir con los pagos en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
DIOS ES AMOR Y MI GUIA (GOD IS LOVE AND MY GUIDE) Shirley is a group member and she invited and organized her fellow members to form the DIOS ES AMOR Y MI GUIA communal bank. They are noted for being very united. Most of the members sell beauty products. Marina is a very enterprising, responsible woman; that is why she was elected group president. She opened a store in her home many years ago. That helped her support and educate her 5 children. Marina's wish now is to help her neighbors by teaching them all she has learned during her life. Lucila sells gelatin snacks and popsicles. It has been a good business for her; she has been doing it for 7 years. She's also a seamstress and is very well-known by her neighbors who bring her much sewing work to be done. She is happy because these occupations allow her to support her family together with her husband. Segunda sells various products like: shoes, clothes, underwear. Often she even sells prepared meals as requested. Her only interest is the wellbeing of her family. The financing will be used to buy ingredients and products for their various businesses. The members are grateful and they value the opportunity that ENDAPROSPO and KIVA have provided. They pledge, as well, to repay in a timely fashion.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy products.

loans.name: Modesto Gilberto

texts.es: El señor Modesto Gilberto tiene  53 años de edad, actualmente tiene 3 hijos y todos trabajan.  El señor Modesto tiene su negocio de venta de hielo, bolsitas, refrescos y leña. En donde tiene una amplia variedad de clientes, el da inicio a este negocio porque se fracturo la columna y esto le impidió realizar trabajos muy pesado. Ya hace 3 años, que sigue con su actividad, porque tuvo la necesidad de sustentar a su familia. A pesar del desafío que enfrenta diario porque algunas veces no tiene servicio eléctrico y todos sus productos son trasladados en un termo. El crédito será invertido en la compra de mayor cantidad de mercancías. Su sueño con respecto al negocio es que este crezca.
texts.en:
Modesto Gilberto, 53, has three children, all of whom work. He has a business where he sells: ice, bolsitas (frozen treats sold in plastic bags), soft-drinks and firewood; he has a wide variety of customers. He started this business because he broke his back and couldn't do heavy work. This was three years ago. He continued with his work because he still had to support his family despite daily challenges (sometimes he doesn't have electricity and all his products have to be transported in thermoses). He will use the funds to buy a larger amount of merchandise. His dream, with respect to his business, is that it grow.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stock merchandise.

loans.name: Las Cien Flores Group

texts.es:
El grupo Las Cien Flores lo conforman tre mujeres trabajadoras, emprendedora y con muchos deseos de seguir adelante. Una  de ellas es la joven Ana Lorena López Hernández quien desde la edad  de 16 años empezó hacer tortillas como un medio de sus sistencia y en estos 8 años a logrado sacar adelante a su familia. Ella invertira el credito en la compra de materia prima para este producto tan demandado por la población.
 
Sus compañeras son Ayde García quien desde hace 10 años tiene una comideria y refresqueria y Marisol del Rosario García de 36 años de edad comercializa ropa.
texts.en:
The group "Las Cien Flores" ("The Hundred Flowers") is made up of three hard-working and enterprising women with a strong desire to get ahead. One of them is the young Ana Lorena López Hernández, who has made tortillas for a living since the age of 16. During these 8 years, she has succeeded in raising her family's standard of living. She will invest the loan in buying raw materials for her product, which is in great demand among the population. Her fellow members are Ayde García, who has operated a business selling food and soft drinks for 10 years, and Marisol del Rosario García, age 36, who sells clothing.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying corn and firewood

loans.name: Juana Sobeyda

texts.es:
La señora Juana Sobeyda se dedica a la venta de comida, desde horas tempranas hace las respectivas compras para luego ponerse a elaborar los ricos platillos que solo ella sabe hacerlos, su puesto de venta esta en su propia casa de habitación.

Este crédito fue para la compra de granos básicos para la  realización de sus platillos, tales como: gallo pinto, maduro con queso, carne desmenuzada, tacos y otros mas 

Un hecho relevante de la señora Juana ella inicio a vender comida con su mama hoy en día ella esta a cargo del negocio.
texts.en:
Juana Sobeyda sells food. She does her shopping very early in the morning and then makes the delicious meals as only she knows how; her sales stall is in her own house. The loan will be used to buy basic grains needed to prepare her dishes, such as: gallo pinto (rice and beans), maduro con queso (baked, cheese-filled plantain), carne desmenuzada (shredded beef), tacos and others. An interesting fact about Juana is that she started out selling food with her mother and now she is in charge of the business.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy basic grains like: rice, beans; sugar and firewood.

loans.name: Anecita

texts.en: Anecita is into gardening, and has a vegetable vending business. She is 34 years old with four children, the eldest of whom is 13 years old. She sells vegetables around her neighborhood.  She wishes to be successful in life someday.  She has joined Community Economic Ventures, Inc., and is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP. This will help her a lot in sustaining her family and her business.

loans.use: seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Valerio

texts.es:
Nuestro socio Valerio,  pertenece al banco comunal  pertenece al banco comunal  “Los solidarios”, nuestro socio está ubicado en la provincia de Urubamba ubicada en el departamento de Cusco a 1 hora de la ciudad del Cusco

Nuestro socio tiene 27 años de edad, es conviviente, tiene 1 hijo de 5 años de edad, nuestro socio tiene ganados y los compra y vende, también trabaja con cerámica, el está trabajando en un taller de cerámicas, nuestro socio alterna sus dos actividades y ahora solicita el préstamo para comprar un par de ganados vacunos.

Nuestro socio agradece  la oportunidad brindada y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus diferentes cuotas en los plazos establecidos.
texts.en:
Valerio is a member of the Communal Bank “Los Solidarios”. He lives in the Province of Urubamba, which is in the Department of Cusco and located an hour away from the City of Cusco.

Valerio is 27 years old, in a common law marriage, and has a 5 year old child. He has a business buying and selling cattle. Valerio also has a workshop where he works with ceramics. He divides his time between the two activities and is now requesting a loan in order to buy two heads of cattle.

Valerio is grateful for this opportunity and promises to complete his payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase two heads of cattle

loans.name: Miguel Ángel Maradiaga Sánchez

texts.es:
Es un ganadero de la zona de Cosiguina cuenta con una familia de 5 hijos los cuales trabajan con el, en el mismo  rubro 
El crédito lo ocupara para la compra de mas novillos para aumentar su hato ganadero y por ende sus ingresos
texts.en:
He is a cattleman in the Cosiguina area. He has five children, who work with him in the same line of work. He will use the loan to buy more bullocks to increase his herd size and thereby his income.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cattle.

loans.name: Francisco Javier

texts.es:
El señor Francisco es técnico de pista de la Gasolinera Texaco Guido, un día de trabajo para él es muy agitado y de riesgo.
Este crédito que solicito es para la compra de materiales como: arena, puertas, ventanas, cerámica etc. Esto con el fin de realizar algunas mejoras a su vivienda ya que desea brindarle una mejor seguridad a su familia.
texts.en:
Francisco works as an attendant at the Guido Texaco gas station; a typical work day for him is very agitated and risky. The loan will be used to buy some building materials like: sand, doors, windows, tile, etc. The goal is to make some improvements to his home because he wants to provide better security for his family.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Elisa

texts.en: Elisa, 33, has a buying and selling business in Bohol. She sells jewelry and accessories. She has 3 children to support, the eldest of whom is 11. She is requesting a loan of 7,000 PHP to put up additional capital. This loan will be very helpful for her in acquiring more jewelry to sell. This will provide her with more  income to provide for her family's needs and send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more jewelry to sell

loans.name: Maria De Jesus

texts.es: Maria De Jesús tiene la edad de 33 años. Esta no es la primera experiencia con los financiamientos pues ha logrado pagar sus cuotas en tiempo y forma. La actividad económica de ella es la venta de mercadería en general,  ya que tiene mucha experiencia con sus diferentes clientes. Hace más de 11 años que posee este negocio ella es una muy buena hija pues ayuda a su Mama, ya que tiene un negocio, además imparte clases en algunos centros de estudios. Poco a poco fue incrementando su inventario con las pocas ganancias que su negocio le generaba. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de mochilas, bolsos, cosméticos y ropa en general. Su mayor sueño seguir siempre adelante.
texts.en:
Maria De Jesús is 33 years old. This is not her first experience working with loans since she completed the payments from her previous loans in a timely fashion. Maria sells general merchandise and has plenty of experience working with different customers. Her business has been in operation for more than 11 years. Maria demonstrates that she is a good daughter by helping out her mother, who also owns a business and teaches school. Over time she has been able to increase her inventory using what little earnings her business was able to generate.

The loan she is requesting will be used as operating capital to purchase backpacks, handbags, cosmetics, and clothing. Her greatest wish is to continue moving forward.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase backpacks, handbags, cosmetics, and clothing

loans.name: Dionisio Salvador

texts.es: Don Dionisio vive en el barrio Villa Libertad en la capital de Managua, ha trabajado en diferentes actividades, trabajo de operador de maquinas industriales, en construcción y actualmente se dedica al servicio de taxi, pues para el ha sido difícil pero no imposible salir adelante con su familia, tiene 55 años de edad, junto con su esposa procrearon 4 hijos de los cuales solo el menor esta estudiando, tiene veintiún años de taxiar y las dificultades que ha tenido es cuando se le descompone el vehiculo que es su fuente de ingreso día  a día. Y no tiene el capital de dinero para repararlo. Con este préstamo dará mantenimiento a su taxi en tapizar los asientos y llantas para seguir dando el servicio a sus clientes, y andar en mejores condiciones para evitar un accidente. Sastifecho por el beneficio de estos préstamos pues han sido para el de gran utilidad para su trabajo como para apoyar a su familia.
texts.en:
Don Dionisio lives in the neighborhood of Villa Libertad in the capital city of Managua. He has worked in a number of different jobs as an industrial machine operator, a construction worker, and now as a taxi driver. Although life has been difficult for his family, it hasn’t been impossible for them to get ahead. Dionisio is 55 years old, married, and has four children, with the youngest one in school. He has been a taxi driver for 21 years and has encountered difficulties whenever his vehicle breaks down because it is his source of daily income. However, he does not have the money needed to make repairs.

With this loan, Dionisio will be able to maintenance his taxi, reupholster the seats, and replace the tires so that he can continue providing service to his customers. A vehicle that is in good condition will help him avoid an accident. He is satisfied with the benefit of these loans because they have been useful to his job and have helped him support his family.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Maintenance his taxi, reupholster the seats, and replace the tires

loans.name: Jilda Manuela

texts.es:
La señora Jilda es asistente de relaciones públicas de la Alcaldía, un día de trabajo para ella es de movilizarse en los diferentes lugares de león para obtener información.

El crédito que ha solicitado es para la realización de exámenes médicos la cual era de gran importancia.

 Cabe mencionar que este es su segundo crédito con nuestra institución, el primero fue para mejoras de vivienda ya que fue de gran ayuda para tener mejores condiciones en su hogar para su familia.
texts.en:
Jilda is a public relations assistant for City Hall. A typical work day for her involves going to various places in León to gather information. She will use the loan to pay for some medical exams that are of great importance. It is worth mentioning that this is her second loan with our institution. The first one was for home improvements and it was a great help to her to be able to improve her family's home conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For medical expenses.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.es:
Cristina tiene 53 años de edad, es viuda y vive junto a cuatro de sus siete hijos en el distrito de Paiján, provincia de Ascope, en la región La Libertad, ubicada a tres horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

La necesidad de sacar adelante a sus hijos a raíz de la defunción de su esposo hizo que empezara a ganarse la vida ofreciendo servicio de limpieza y de lavanderia. Ofrece servicio de limpieza en algunas casas de la ciudad, sus clientes la llaman y ella acude a limpiar. En cuanto a la lavandería opera del mismo modo. Esta actividad le provee los ingresos necesarios para mantener su hogar.

Las fuertes lluvias que se han presentado en la zona en las ultimas semanas hicieron que parte de su techo quedara afectado, por lo que se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 500 nuevos soles que planea invertir en la refacción de la parte afectada.

Ella es una mujer humilde y que lucha por salir adelante junto a sus hijos. Su mayor anhelo es poder ahorrar el dinero suficiente para instalar una pequeña bodega en su vivienda.
texts.en:
Cristina is 53 years old, widowed, and lives with four of her seven children in the District of Paiján, Province of Ascope, in the region of La Libertad. This community is located three hours away from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of the region of Lambayeque.

In order to support her children after the death of her husband, Cristina began offering cleaning and laundry services. She cleans houses in the city. Her customers call her and she goes to their houses to begin cleaning. The laundry service operates in the same manner. Both activities provide the income she needs to maintain her household.

The strong rains that hit the area in recent weeks damaged part of her roof. For this reason, she is requesting her first loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 500 PEN so that she can pay for repairs.

Cristina is a humble woman who struggles in order for her children to get ahead. Her greatest wish is to save enough money so that she can open a small grocery store in her home.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pay for roof repairs

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene P. is a 32 year-old rice farmer. She started farming in 1999. She lives in Surallah, Cotabato together with her two children. The farm that she has been tilling for several years is what helps her pay the daily expenses in their home. She desires a bountiful harvest so that she will be able to accommodate the needs of her family.

She has applied for a loan of 10,000 PHP from Community Economic Ventures Inc. She will use the loan to buy farm supplies. If ever she gets a loan, she will be able to increase her harvest.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies

loans.name: Nohemy

texts.es:
Nuestra socia  Nohemy,  pertenece al banco comunal  pertenece al banco comunal  “Los solidarios”, nuestra socia está ubicada en la provincia de Urubamba ubicada en el departamento de Cusco a 1 hora de la ciudad del Cusco

Nuestra socia tiene 36 años de edad, la socia es conviviente y tiene  3 hijos 16, 12, 9 años de edad; Nuestra socia es docente de profesión, y a su vez paralelamente alterna con el comercio minorista, nuestra socia alterna sus actividades del hogar con ambas labores; La socia es docente en Machupicchu de primaria; y ahora que están de vacaciones y con el problema de las lluvias se vieron perjudicados por que todo el poblado de Machupicchu está sin acceso y las clases escolares se postergaron por dos meses más con suerte. Nuestra socia cría cuyes y gallinas en su casa, la socia también trabaja con artesanía desde el 2009. L asocia está siempre pensando en ocupar su tiempo libre al máximo para poder apoyar a sus hijos con sus estudios porque ella quiere la mejor educación para sus hijos y las universidades particulares y buenas cuestan mucho dinero. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar cuyes y gallinas y venderlos.

Nuestra socia agradece  la oportunidad brindada y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus diferentes cuotas en los plazos establecidos.
texts.en:
Nohemy is a member of the Communal Bank “Los Solidarios”. She lives in the Province of Urubamba, which is in the Department of Cusco and located an hour away from the City of Cusco.

Nohemy is 36 years old, in a common law marriage, and has three children (ages 16, 12, and 9). She is a teacher by profession and also runs a small business. Nohemy divides her time between her household activities and both of her jobs. She is an elementary school teacher in Machupicchu, but the children are currently on vacation. Problems caused by the heavy rains adversely affected the entire village of Macchupicchu. Since access is limited, school has been postponed for at least two months. Nohemy raises chickens and guinea pigs at home, and has also been working with handicrafts since last year. She believes in making the most use of her free time so that she can support her children with their schooling. Nohemy wants for them to have the best education, but the good private universities cost a lot of money. She is requesting a loan in order to buy guinea pigs and chickens to sell.

Nohemy is grateful for this opportunity and promises to complete her payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase guinea pigs and chickens to sell

loans.name: José Fidel

texts.es:
Este cliente cuenta con un basta experiencia en le rubro ganadero y es por lo que hace la solicitud para la compra de vaquillas de vientres para la producción de leche 
 Es un hombre soltero y padre de 2 hijos los cuales trabajan con el mismo esfuerzo de padre para sacar adelante la producción
texts.en:
This client has vast experience in cattle raising. This is why he is asking for funding to buy young dairy cows for milk production. He is single and father of two children, who work with the same efforts as their father to move the production ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cattle.

loans.name: Norlan Jose

texts.es: El joven Norlan José tiene  36 años de edad, es casado y tiene tres hijos y todos dependen de él. Por lo que Norlan es el sustento de su familia se dedica a ofrecer el servicio de transporte en un triciclo. Dio inicio a su negocio hace 6 años, tiempo en el cual lo ha aprovechado al máximo pues les proporciona a su hijos los estudios necesarios ya que el no tuvo la oportunidad de finalizar sus estudios y no quiere que esto les suceda a sus hijo. El crédito será invertido en la compra de repuestos para su triciclo, para un mejor funcionamiento del mismo. Su meta principal es seguir creciendo y mejorar sus servicios.
texts.en:
Norlan José is 36 years old, married, and has three dependent children. In order to support his family, Norlan provides transportation services via a tricycle. He started this business six years ago and has taken full advantage of it by providing for his children’s eduction. Norlan did not have the opportunity to finish school, so he does not want the same thing to happen to his kids.

This loan will be used to buy spare parts for his tricycle so that it will function better. His main goals are to continue growing and improving his services.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase spare parts for a tricycle

loans.name: Dolores

texts.en:
Dolores A. has three children. Before receiving a loan, she said, it was really hard because she could not easily pay the price demanded for the farm supplies that she needs. Dolores wishes to have a productive farm so that she can help her husband pay the daily expenses in their home.

Dolores has requested a loan of 15,000 PHP from Community Economic Ventures Inc. She will use the loan to buy farm supplies to increase her harvest.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies

loans.name: Kari Marina

texts.es:
La señora Kari inicia abriendo su negocio desde las 5:30 Am vendiendo leche de vaca a sus clientes y a la vez ofrecer variedad de producto concluyendo sus ventas hasta las 9:30 pm, la pulpería esta ubicada en su casa de habitación.
Este crédito que solicito es  para la compra de de granos básicos, pollo, carne, leche, cosméticos y ropa.

Cabe mencionar que la señora Kari es madre soltera de dos hijos la cual ella trabaja arduamente para darle lo mejor a su familia.
texts.en:
Kari opens her store at 5:30am selling cow's milk to her customers. At the same time, she offers a variety of other products and stays open until 9:30pm. Her store is located in her house. The loan will be used to buy basic grains, chicken, meat, milk, cosmetics and clothing. It is worth mentioning that Kari is a single mother of two children for whom she works hard to provide the best for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy various products like: basic grains, meat, chicken, milk, cosmetics, clothing, etc.

loans.name: Amelia

texts.es: La Sra Amelia A. M. de  36 años de edad, cuenta con  casa propia de material de adobe ubicada en la Urbanización Sebastian Barranca de Santiago.Tiene 1 hijo en edad escolar. Trabaja como empleada del hogar con 3 años de experiencia. Adicionalmente percibe otros ingresos de pensión. Es una persona emprendedora, que gracias a su empeño a logrado adquirir sus bienes. Requiere el crédito para terminar de construir su vivienda que fue afectada por el terremoto del año 2007. Su sueño es lograr construir toda su vivienda con el fin de alcanzar una mejor calidad de vida. Esta muy agradecida por el apoyo que le podamos brindar a través de este financiamiento.
texts.en:
Sra. Amelia A. M. is 36 years old. She owns a home made of adobe in the Sebastian Barranca Housing Development in Santiago. Her child attends school. Amelia has been working as a housekeeper for three years. In addition, she receives income from a pension. She is an enterprising woman who, thanks to her efforts, was able to acquire her own property.

Amelia needs a loan to finish construction of her home, which was affected by the 2007 earthquake. Her dream is to have all of the construction completed on her home so that she can enjoy a better quality of life. She is very grateful for the support that has been provided to her through this financing.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Finish construction of her house

loans.name: Rafaela

texts.es:
La señora Rafaela todos los días inicia a ofertar sus productos desde las 6:00 am en su tramo que esta ubicado en la 4ta calle del mercado la terminal.

Este crédito que solicito es  para la compra de productos como: colas, diademas, prensas para el cabello, adornos de china, chapas etc.

Cabe mencionar que la señora Rafaela es madre de un hijo, la cual ya  concluyo con sus estudios y ahora le ayuda en el negocio.
texts.en:
Rafaela opens for business at 6am; she is located on the 4th aisle in La Terminal market. The loan is to buy varied hair accessories such as: pony tails, hairbands, hairpins, Chinese decorations, etc. It is worth mentioning that Rafaela has a son who has finished school and helps her at her store.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy hair accessories.

loans.name: Ayde

texts.es:
Nuestra socia  Ayde,  pertenece al banco comunal  pertenece al banco comunal  “Los solidarios”, nuestra socia está ubicada en la provincia de Urubamba ubicada en el departamento de Cusco a 1 hora de la ciudad del Cusco

Nuestra socia tiene 38 años de edad,  es conviviente y tiene 1 hijo de 10 años Nuestra socia es una mujer muy emprendedora, ella alterna sus actividades del hogar con la artesanía, Nuestra socia trabaja 8 años en una empresa taller de artesanía, ellos exportan y también venden  en su propio local los diferentes trabajos realizados por los empleados, Nuestra socia está encargada del pulido y el acabado final de la arcilla, la socia necesita el préstamo para comprar madera, porque su pareja abrió una carpintería en su propia casa gracias al apoyo que nuestra socia le brindo, juntos salieron adelante y pudieron comprar su terreno y todas sus cosas con préstamos de este banco comunal y con esfuerzo de su trabajo.

Nuestra socia agradece  la oportunidad brindada y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus diferentes cuotas en los plazos establecidos.
texts.en:
Ayde is a member of the Communal Bank “Los Solidarios”. She lives in the Province of Urubamba, which is in the Department of Cusco and located an hour away from the City of Cusco.

Ayde is 38 years old, in a common law marriage, and has a ten year old son. She is an enterprising woman who divides her time between her housework and making handicrafts. For the past eight years, she has managed a craft shop. Ayde exports her products and also sells them in her store. The different tasks are performed by her employees. Ayde is in charge of polishing and adding finishing touches to the pottery. She is requesting a loan to buy wood because her partner just started a carpentry business out of their home. Thanks to the support she will be bringing, Ayde and her partner will be able to get ahead, acquire a piece of land, and purchase all the things they need with the loans from her Communal Bank and through their hard work.

She is grateful for this opportunity and promises to complete her payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase wood for her partner's carpentry business

loans.name: Maxima

texts.en:
Maxima N. is a married woman with four sons. She is a busy entrepreneur who has been running a sari-sari store for almost two years. Her husband, Rodrigo, is also an entrepreneur in the community. To continue to build her business, Maxima is seeking a loan in the amount of 15,000 PHP ($350) to increase the inventory of goods sold in her sari-sari store. More specifically, she is planning to purchase additional products such as rice, cases of beer, and charcoal. Maxima believes that offering a wider assortment of goods to customers will increase traffic to her store and will maintain customer loyalty. Her dreams are to provide a better future for her family, sustain the profitability of her store, and start a savings account for her grandchildren so that they can finish their studies all the way through college.

Since 2008, Maxima has been a committed member of Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc. (ASHI), a Kiva microfinance partner in the Philippines. Indeed, Maxima has been a model member by regularly attending her weekly meetings and by promptly repaying her prior loans. Through hard work and determination, Maxima is focused on improving her quality of life through her entrepreneurial initiatives and support from ASHI and Kiva lenders.

About ASHI: ASHI has the distinction of being the oldest existing replication of Grameen Bank's approach of providing credit to the poor people of the Philippines. With its outstanding achievements over the years, it has become one of the pioneers of microfinance in the country.

loans.use: To improve her business by increasing her store's inventory of rice, beer, charcoal, etc.

loans.name: Eddy Roberto

texts.es:
Es un cliente que con mucho esfuerzo maneja los dos rubros tanto ganadero como agrícola para poder trabajar solicita este crédito el cual lo invertirá en ganado lechero 
Es un cabeza de familia y tiene  a su cargo una familia de 6 personas
texts.en:
He is a client who, with much effort, works at two occupations: farming and cattle raising. He is asking for funds to be able to continue working. He will invest the funds in dairy cows. He is a head of family with 6 people under his care.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To lease farmland.

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena D. is a 47-year-old woman who lives in Sto Nino, South Cotabato. To earn a living, she is a rice farmer and a duck breeder. She explains that she is doing her best to be the best possible mother for her children. Her business's income is what has sustained her family for many years.

Elena is now requesting a loan in the amount of 15,000 PHP ($350) via Community Economic Ventures Inc. She will use the loan proceeds to buy farm supplies, ducklings, and feed.

loans.use: To expand and improve her business by purchasing farm supplies, ducklings, and feed

loans.name: Mercedes Matilde

texts.es: La señora Mercedes Matilde tiene 43 años de edad ella se dedica a la venta de ropa de manera ambulante en sus comarcas, madre de 1 hija una niña de 7 años de edad, su esposo trabaja en una finca ubicada en las afueras como obrero. Mercedes tiene 3 años de trabajar de esta manera, ofrece sus productos a la gente del campo ya que ellos son sus principales clientes. Debido a esto ella decide realizar un financiamiento con el fin de comprar materia prima necesaria. Sus deseos son seguir apoyando a su hija en los estudios.
texts.en:
Sra. Mercedes Matilde is 43 years old and sells clothing as a traveling merchant in her neighborhood. She has a seven year old daughter. Her husband works as a field laborer on a farm located on the outskirts of town.

Mercedes has three years of experience in this business. She sells her products to residents of the rural areas, since they are her main customers. To keep her business going, Mercedes decided to request financing in order to purchase necessary materials. Her wish is to continue supporting her daughter with her education.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital for her clothing business

loans.name: Azucena Gioconda

texts.es:
La señora Azucena, se dedica al ramo de la belleza y venta de ropa, calzados y otros, todos los días abre su negocio desde tempranas horas de la mañana para recibir a su clientela, su tramo esta ubicado en el mercado la terminal.

Este crédito que solicito es  para la compra de cosméticos, productos de belleza, ropa, calzados y otros.
texts.en:
Azucena sells beauty products and she also sells clothing, shoes and other items every day. She opens for business very early in the morning to start receiving her customers; her stand is in the La Terminal market. She will use the loan to buy cosmetics, beauty products, clothing, shoes, etc.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cosmetics, beauty products, clothing and footwear.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn F. is a 58-year-old farmer. She started tilling a small parcel of a rice farm in 1975, and has been in this line of business ever since. She explains that her rice farm is doing well. To illustrate, on average, she is able to produce 80 sacks of rice grains per harvest.

She is now applying for a loan in the amount of 12,000 PHP ($275) from Community Economic Ventures Inc. She will use the loan proceeds to buy farm supplies to improve her harvest.

loans.use: To improve her harvest by purchasing additional farm supplies

loans.name: Rolando

texts.es: Rolando tiene 27 años de edad vive con su esposa hace mas de 7 años tiene un hijo de 5 años vive en casa de sus padres juntamente con su esposo es propietario de una mototaxi donde trabaja todos los dias  se dedica a esta actividad hace mas de 4 años, tiene buenas referencias personales experiencia crediticia, solicita dicho credito para mentenimiento de su movilidad se propone por contar con capacidad y sobre todo voluntad de pago.
texts.en:
Rolando is 27 years old and has been married to his wife for more than seven years. They have a five year old son and live in the home of his parents. Rolando and his wife own a motorcycle taxi that he has been driving for more than four years. He has excellent personal references and previous credit experience. The loan he is requesting will be used to pay for maintenance to his vehicle. He intends to sign up for the training classes and make all of his payments.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Vehicle maintenance

loans.name: Emilio

texts.es:
Nuestro socio  Emilio,  pertenece al banco comunal  pertenece al banco comunal  “Los solidarios”, nuestro socio está ubicado en la provincia de Urubamba ubicada en el departamento de Cusco a 1 hora de la ciudad del Cusco

Nuestro socio tiene  36 años de edad, el es conviviente, tiene 2 hijos de 5 y 3 años de edad,  Nuestro socio es una persona responsable y muy dedicada a la familia, el socio trabaja desde 1994 en una empresa de exportación de artesanía, el socio empezó de ayudante y hacia trabajos menores, pero poco a poco aprendió el arte y formar la arcilla y empezó a descubrir que sus manos podían elaborar maravillas y hasta hoy sigue trabajando considerado uno de los mejores trabajadores en su empresa, Nuestro socio desearía a futuro abrir su propio taller de artesanía, pero él siente que esta empresa le dio todo y le pagan muy bien y le permite seguir creciendo por lo que el poner un taller propio significaría la competencia del dueño a quien admira y respeta entonces no piensa hacerle la competencia, nos comenta que seguirá elaborando este arte en aquella que es su segunda casa, Nuestro socio solicita el préstamo para invertir en la construcción de su casa.

Nuestro socio agradece  la oportunidad brindada y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus diferentes cuotas en los plazos establecidos.
texts.en:
Our member Emilio belongs to “Los Solidarios” communal bank. He lives in Urubamba province in the department of Cuzco, an hour from the city of Cuzco. Our member is 36 years old and has a live-in partner. He has two children, aged 5 and 3. Emilio is a responsible person and very dedicated to his family. Since 1994, he has worked for a handicraft export company. He began as an assistant and did small jobs, but little by little he learned the art and how to shape clay, and he began to discover that his hands could make wonderful things. He still works there and is considered one of the best workers in the company. Our member would like to someday open his own workshop, but he feels that this company gave him everything, they pay him very well, and they permit him to keep growing, and he feels having his own workshop would mean he was competing with the company owner, who he admires and respects. Emilio does not want to compete with him and tells us that he will continue creating art for this company, which is like his second home. Emilio is asking for this loan to help build his house. He is grateful for this opportunity and promises to make his payments at the scheduled times.

Translated from Spanish by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Home construction

loans.name: Carla

texts.es:
Nuestra socia Carla pertenece al Banco Comunal “Qory Orcco” de la Asociación Arariwa, tiene 22 años, es soltera y todavía no tiene hijos. Carla estudia actualmente la carrera profesional de Derecho en la Universidad Nacional San Antonio de Abad del Cusco. La socia es una mujer joven, trabajadora y emprendedora, ella tiene su propio negocio de venta de bloquetas  de cemento. Ya es un año que se dedica al negocio y le ha ido muy bien gracias a su empeño pone en su trabajo. Carla nos cuenta que este negocio pertenecía a su mama pero ahora su mama le dio la responsabilidad de administrar el negocio, Carla tiene 3 empleados que producen las bloquetas. Carla requiere el préstamo para comprar 150 bolsas de cemento.     

La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.

(Los socios del banco comunal se reúnen cada treinta días en la ciudad de Pucyura que es distrito de la ciudad de Anta del Departamento del Cusco, Pucyura se encuentra ubicada a 40 minutos de la ciudad de Cusco).
texts.en:
Carla is a member of the “Qory Orcco de la Asociación Arariwa” comunal bank. She is 22 years old, single with no children. She is a student at “Universidad Nacional San Antonio de Abad del Cusco.” She is a young hard working and enterprising women who has her own business selling cement blocks. She’s been doing this for one year and is doing well, thanks the emphasis she gives. Carla tells us that this business once belonged to her mother, but her mother has passed the responsibility onto her. She has three employees who produce the blocks. She needs this loan in order to buy 150 bags of cement. She is thankful for the opportunity given through this media and promises to make her payments on schedule. (The members of this communal bank meet every thirty days in the city of Pucyura, located in the Anta district in the Cusco department, 40 minutes from Cusco)

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Cement

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria T. is 38 and married with 6 children (ages 1 - 18).  She owns a business venture, catching & selling ocean-caught fish .  Maria has 3 years of experience in this business.  Maria needs a loan of WST $1500 to purchase fishing equipment including hooks & nets.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 250 talas or US $104 per week) to financially support immediate members of her family.

In 2009, Maria joined SPBD.    This is her 2nd loan with SPBD.   SPBD's loans are Maria's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

The following social metrics for Maria T. are provided by SPBD*:
Overall Social Metric Score:                1.4 out of 3
Level of Education:                         1.3 out of 3
Level of total Household Income:            1.3 out of 3
Quality of Household Assets:                1.4 out of 3

*SPBD measures the living conditions of each of its borrowers to track her loan progress.  The overall social metric score, provided by SPBD, is based upon a number of factors, such as the condition of the house/household assets, health, education, income level, and family reputation.  A higher number represents a higher score.  For example, a ""3 out of 3"" on education would mean that the borrower has graduated from university; a ""2 out of 3"" = secondary/high-school, and a ""1 out of 3"" would mean that the borrower is uneducated.  

For more information on this score, please see SPBD's partner page at: http://partners.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=15

About  SPBD 
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.  

Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD: http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to purchase fishing equipment including hooks & nets

loans.name: Lucrecia Margarita

texts.es:
La señora Lucrecia diariamente inicia aperturar su negocio desde las 6:00 Am que se encuentra ubicado en el mercado la estación.

Este crédito que solicito es  para la compra de mercadería para aumentar su inventario y tener mas variedad para ofrecerles a sus clientes, tales como: vanidades, pinturas de uña, pinturas de labio, cremas, aretes, colas, diademas etc.

Cabe mencionar que la señora Lucrecia además de su negocio de cosméticos también elabora horneados y cuajadas lo cuales son puesto a la venta a un lado de su tramo ya que son de gran gusto para su clientela.
texts.en:
Lucrecia begins working in her business, located in the station market at, each day starting at 6:00 am. She will use the money from this loan to buy merchandise to increase her inventory and have a greater variety to offer her customers. Things such as vanity items, nail polish, lipsticks, creams, earrings, hair bands, head bands, etc. Lucrecia also makes and sells baked goods and milk curd alongside her stall. Her customers like this very much.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase inventory

loans.name: Osman Guillermo

texts.es: El señor Osman es casado y tiene 3 hijos los cuales son menores de edad y dependen de él. Osman tiene su actividad que es una pulpería, en donde ofrece los productos diarios y aquí sus clientes recurren a comprar los alimentos diarios básicos. El dio inicio a su negocio hace 6 años, cabe señalar que este negocio fue una alternativa de vida para él y su familia pues no tiene un trabajo estable y quería encontrar la manera de ayudarle a su esposa. El crédito será invertido en la compra de materias prima. Su meta principal es incrementar su negocio y obtener otra fuente de ingreso.
texts.en:
Osman is married and has 3 small children who are dependent on him. Osman has a business, a grocery store, where he offers products for daily use. His regular clients come to buy their basic daily food items. He started the business 6 years ago, and it's worth noting that it represented an opportunity in his life because he did not have a stable job and wanted to find a way to help his wife. The loan will be invested in the purchase of raw materials. His main goal is to grow the store and acquire an additional source of income.

Translated from Spanish by Nadine Riopel, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Charita

texts.en:
Charita F. is a 31-year-old, married woman with the determination and faith to get out from poverty. She is a mother to two young children. Her husband, Danilo, is a vendor. She explains that her husband's salary alone is insufficient to cover their family's daily living needs.

As a mother with big dreams, she joined Ahon SA Hirap, Inc. (ASHI) in 2004. ASHI is a microfinance institution and KIVA partner in the Philippines. Since then, she started selling ready-to-wear-clothes, which really helped to improve her family's standard of living. She is now seeking her fourth loan from ASHI, this time in the amount of 14,000 PHP ($325), to purchase additional inventory for her business. Specifically, the loan will be used to pay for blouses, shirts, sandals, jeans, short pants, and other supplies. She hopes that, with the help of ASHI and KIVA's field partners, she can reach her ambition to step out from poverty, expand her business, and pay for the needs of her two children in school. One of her dreams is to someday own their own house.

About ASHI: ASHI has the distinction of being the oldest existing replication of Grameen Bank's approach of providing credit to the poor people of the Philippines. With its outstanding achievements over the years, it has become one of the pioneers of microfinance in the country.

loans.use: To expand her business by purchasing additional inventory (e.g., blouses, shirts, sandals, jeans, and short pants)

loans.name: Guillerma

texts.en:
Guillerma C. is a 34-year-old rice farmer. She is not married and does not have any children. For more than two years, she has been managing a farm. She would like to have a larger harvest so that she can save more money for the future.

Therefore, she is requesting a loan of the amount of 10,000 PHP ($225) from Community Economic Ventures, Inc. She will use the loan proceeds to buy farm supplies and to pay her laborers for all their hard work in the field.

loans.use: To improve her harvest by purchasing additional farm supplies

loans.name: Mirna María

texts.es:
La señora Mirna María venda productos plásticos en el mercado la estación de león dando inicio a sus ventas  a las 7:00 Am donde recibe a su clientela para ofertar su mercadería.
Este crédito que solicito es  para la compra de vasos plásticos, platos, baldes, ollas, y otros.

Cabe mencionar que la señora Mirna trabaja arduamente en su tramo ya que es el pilar del sustento de sus tres hijos ya que es madre soltera.
texts.en:
