Mirna María sells plastic items in León's La Estación market; she opens for business at 7am and starts receiving her customers and offering them her merchandise. The loan will be used to buy plastic glasses, plates, buckets, pots, etc. It is worth mentioning that Mirna works very hard in her stand because she is her three children's sole source of support; she's a single mother.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise like: plastic glasses, buckets, plates, plastic pots, etc.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen G., 49 years old, is a rice grower from Surallah South Cotabato. She started her business in 1990 and she has pursued rice farming because it is a good business. The income that she gets from the farm has helped her family able to have an adequate supply of food, clothes and other basic needs.

She would like to apply a loan of Php 15,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. She will use the loan to buy farm supplies to grow more  harvest.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies

loans.name: Lucrecia Adelina

texts.es: Lucrecia Adelina  tiene la edad de 29 años. Tiene 2 hijos a su cargo. La actividad económica es la venta de frutas. Hace más de 8 años que posee este negocio. La ubicación de su negocio es en las afueras del mercado, por lo que siempre le ha gustado luchar. Sus inicios surgen con muy poco capital, pero con muchas ganas de salir adelante ya que fue por cuenta propia poco a poco fue incrementando su inventario con las pocas ganancias que su negocio le generaba. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de piña, bananos, naranjas, limones, tomate, cebolla entre otros. Su mayor sueño es que cada uno de sus hijos logren finalizar sus estudios y que sigan adelante con esta actividad que les ayudo mucho.
texts.en:
Lucrecia Adelina is 29 years old and supports her 2 children. She has had a business selling fruit for more than 8 years. Her store is located on the outskirts of the market, and she has always liked to work. She got her start with very little capital, but with a lot of drive and self reliance, little by little she increased her stock with the small earnings that her store produced. The financing that she is requesting is for working capital to buy pineapples, bananas, limes, tomatoes, onions, and more. Her greatest dream is that each of her children finish their studies and that they continue with their education, as it will be a great help to them.

Translated from Spanish by Nadine Riopel, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital for the purchase of produce

loans.name: Catalino

texts.es:
En el municipio de Somotillo, comarca jícaro bonito el señor Catalino M. Betanco, se dedica a la crianza de ganado bobino, porcino y Aviar, también establece cultivos como maíz, frijol blanco y sorgo los que brindan lo necesario para el sostén familiar.
El señor Catalino M. ha empleado la mayor parte de su vida realizando estas actividades, las desarrolla de 6 a 2 de la tarde todos los días de su vida, ya que al realizarlas provee lo necesario para la mantención de sus 5 hijos.
El crédito será empleado en la compra de dos vacas paridas las que ayudaran a aumentar el hato ganadero y aumentaran sus ingresos beneficiando su desarrollo económico.
texts.en:
Catalino M. B.raises cattle, pigs and fowl in Somotillo, Jícaro Bonito. He also farms corn, white beans and sorghum. These activities produce enough to support his family. Catalino M. has spent most of his life in these activities. He works from 6am until 2pm every day of his life because the work provides for the support of his 5 children. He will use the loan to buy two dairy cows to increase the size of his cattle herd and increase his income which will benefit his economic development.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy two dairy cows

loans.name: Ronald

texts.es: El Sr. Ronald A. H. de  24 años de edad, tiene 1 hijo menor. Cuenta con  casa propia de material de ladrillo ubicada en el Caserío de Lujaraja. Trabaja como obrero de campo en una empresa agroindustrial  con 1 año de experiencia. Su conyuge también es obrera de campo por temporadas de cosecha. Es una persona emprendedora, que gracias a su empeño logró adquirir sus bienes. Requiere el crédito para terminar de construir su vivienda que fue afectada por el terremoto del año 2007. Su sueño es lograr construir toda su vivienda con el fin de alcanzar una mejor calidad de vida. Esta muy agradecido por el apoyo que le podamos brindar a través de este financiamiento.
texts.en:
Ronald A. H. is 24 years old, and has 1 small child. He has his own brick house located in Caserio de Lujaraja. He works as a field labourer with one year's experience in an agroindustrial company. His spouse is also a field labourer during harvest season. He's an enterprising person, who thanks to his determination has been able to achieve his goals. He needs this loan to finish building his home which was damaged by the earthquake of 2007. Ronaldo's dream is to be able to finish construction on the house and achieve a better quality of life. He is very thankful for the support that we are able to offer him through this financing.

Translated from Spanish by Nadine Riopel, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Housing improvements

loans.name: Francisco Jose

texts.es: Francisco José tiene 44 años. Su actividad económica es la venta de mercadería en general, además de hacer esto el ofrece el servicio de transporte de taxi, pero ayuda a ofrecer los productos. Por lo que su mayor interés es como padre responsable es ofrecer lo necesario para su familia. el ya ha tenido varios financiamientos con Fundación los que han sido de mucha ayuda para sacar adelante su negocio. El destino del financiamiento es para capital de trabajo para la compra de productos. Su mayor deseo es ser el propietario de una distribuidora.
texts.en:
Francisco Jose is 44 years old. He sells general merchandise, and in addition to this he has a taxi that he uses to provide transportation services and also uses to sell his products. His interest as a responsible parent is to provide what is necessary for his family. He has already had various financings with the Fundación that have been a great help in getting his business to succeed. This financing will be used as working capital to buy products. His main wish is to be the owner of a distributor.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital to buy products

loans.name: Natividad

texts.en:
Natividad C. is from the village of Macabayao, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 50 years old. Natividad is married and has 2 adult children. Natividad owns & operates a specialized retail store selling daily use products such as canned goods, milk, milo, eggs, cooking oil, soy sauce, shampoo, soap & toothpaste in the local community. Natividad has been engaged in her business for over 32 years and earns approximately 30,000.00 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Natividad joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to have the ability to engage in business activities. Natividad has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000.00 PHP from GDMPC. She is requesting a new loan of 50000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the fifth loan taken out by Natividad from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve & expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase inventory for retail store.

loans.name: Jorge Luis

texts.es: El joven Jorge Luis H. A., es soltero. Se encuentra domiciliado en casa de sus padres ubicada en el Caserío de Tate. Trabaja como obrero de campo en una empresa agroindustrial  con 1 año de experiencia. Es una persona emprendedora, que gracias a su empeño logró adquirir sus bienes. Requiere el crédito para terminar de construir su vivienda en un terreno que le otorgaron sus padres donde viene construyendo y que fue afectada por el terremoto del año 2007. Su sueño es lograr construir toda su vivienda con el fin de alcanzar una mejor calidad de vida. Esta muy agradecido por el apoyo que le podamos brindar a través de este financiamiento.
texts.en:
Jorge Luis H. A. is young and unmarried. He lives with his parents in the settlement of Tate. He has worked as a laborer in the fields of an agroindustrial company for one year. He is an enterprising person and thanks to his hard work he has developed a good reputation. He has requested the loan so that he can finish construction on his home, which he is building on land given to him by his parents. The construction was impaired by the 2007 earthquake. His dream is to build his dwelling and improve his quality of life. He is very grateful for the opportunity to improve his life with this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Matthew Raimondi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To improve his dwelling

loans.name: Pedrita

texts.en:
Pedrita L. is from the village of Macabayao, Jimenez, Misamis Occdental. She is 53 years old. Pedrita is widowed and has 4 adult children. Pedrita owns & operates a business raising pigs for resale. Pedrita has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 2,000.00 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Pedrita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to have the ability to engage in business activities. Pedrita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000.00 PHP from GDMPC. Pedrita is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to purchase feed for the pigs. This will be the second loan taken out by Pedrita from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve & expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase feed for the pigs.

loans.name: Exaltacion

texts.en:
Exaltacion B. is from the barangay of Bangko, Panaon Municipality, Misamis Occidental Province. She is 65 years old. Exaltacion is married and has six adult children. To make a living, Exaltacion owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting coconuts for sale. Exaltacion has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Exaltacion joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Exaltacion has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used for additional business capital. loans.name: Mavy Elena

texts.es: Mavy tiene 40 años es madre soltera tiene una hija de 15 años , vive en casa propia  tiene amplia experiencia en el rubro de ventas , pero hace 1 año puso su propio negocio de venta de dulces y otros, producto de su trabajo  tiene su casa propia y buena acumulacion de bienes  es padre y madre para su  hija, a Mavy le gusta mantener limpio y  presentable su negocio es por ello que tiene buena clientela, tiene experiencia crediticia  solicita dicho credito para invertir en el mejoramiento de su vivienda  se propone por contar con capacidad y sobre todo voluntad de pago.
texts.en:
Mavy, 40, is a single mother who has a 15 year-old daughter. She lives in her own home. She has extensive experience in sales, but a year ago she started her own business selling sweets and other items. As a result of her work she has her own home and has accumulated some possessions. She is both father and mother to her daughter. Mavy likes to maintain her business in a very clean and presentable condition. For this reason she has a good customer base. She has prior experience with credit. She requests this loan to invest in improving her home. She submits that she has the capacity and, more importantly, the willingness to make the payments.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: home improvement

loans.name: Guzman

texts.es: El Sr. Guzman L. Ruìz de  54 años de edad. Tiene 4 hijos que son independientes. Cuenta con  casa propia de material de esteras ubicada en el Caserío de Lujaraja. Trabaja como obrero de campo en una empresa agroindustrial  con 3 años de experiencia. Su conyuge también es obrera de campo. Es una persona emprendedora, que gracias a su empeño logró adquirir sus bienes. Requiere el crédito para construir su vivienda que fue afectada por el terremoto del año 2007. Su sueño es lograr construir toda su vivienda con el fin de alcanzar una mejor calidad de vida. Esta muy agradecido por el apoyo que le podamos brindar a través de este financiamiento.
texts.en:
Guzman L. Ruìz is 54 years old. He has four children who are independent and he has his own home, made of thatch, located in the Lujaraja region. He works in the fields for an agricultural business, and has 3 years' experience. His spouse also works in the fields.

Guzman is an enterprising person, who thanks to his determination is able to meet his family's needs. He seeks this loan so that he can rebuild his home, which was affected by the earthquake of 2007. His dream is to be able to finish his home with the goal of improving his quality of life. He is very appreciative of the support that this loan will bring him.

Translated from Spanish by Michelle Harrison, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Home improvements

loans.name: Olman Ramon

texts.es:
Este Señor es Originario del Municipio de San Francisco del Norte, Departamento de Chinandega, ha tenido 10 créditos ha sido un excelente cliente, solicita un crédito para mejorar su vivienda, repararla y comprar materiales de construcción tales como: laminas de zinc, bloques, cemento, arena, madera, para vivir en una casa digna para su familia. 
Además por medio de este crédito va a poder reparar su vivienda.
texts.en:
He is from San Francisco del Norte, Chinandega department. He has had 10 loans and has been an excellent client. He is asking for funds to repair and improve his home. He needs to buy building materials and supplies like: zinc metal sheeting, concrete blocks, cement, sand, lumber to live in a home that is proper for his family. In addition, the loan will make it possible for him to repair his home.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy building materials and supplies.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Erwin

texts.en:
Erwin G. is from the village of Malagana, Claveria Misamis Oriental. He is 29 years old. Erwin is married and has 2 infant-aged children. To make a living, Erwin owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling green bananas in the local community. Erwin has been engaged in his business for over 4 years and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Erwin joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Erwin is requesting a loan of 4000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Erwin from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Batdorj

texts.en:
Batdorj is 30 years old and lives with his father in Tosontsengel province in Mongolia. Three years ago he started his own carpenter business by himself. Since he never had his own building to work out of this year he started working in his brother in law's building. They now run the business together. Most of the woodcarving and furniture they make they send to the city to sell. In one month they do about 250,000- 350,000 (about $210-$290) tugrugs worth of business. They mostly do furniture for homes and with a loan Batdorj will by nice cedar and ebony wood to make better furniture with.
Batdorj lives with his dad who is retired and on a pension of less than $80 per month. His dad is old and his health is not very good, so along with his business Batdorj takes care of his dad. He is hardworking and dependable. His goal in life right now is to take good care of his dad and make these years good ones for him.

loans.use: To purchase wood

loans.name: Jonalyn

texts.en:
Jonalyn J. is from the village of BAYBAY, LILOY. She is 31 years old. Jonalyn is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Jonalyn owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for sale. Jonalyn has been engaged in her business for over 1 years and earns approximately  PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Jonalyn joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jonalyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future. Jonalyn is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Jonalyn from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily L. is from the village of Tabon, Jose Dalman, Zamboanga del Norte. She is 49 years old, married and has 11 adult and school-aged children. To make a living, Emily owns a fishing boat which is operated by her husband. Emily has been engaged in her business for 25 years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month. 

This year, Emily joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a new loan of 3,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional fishing equipment for her fishing boat. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Emily from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand it.

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional fishing equipment for her fishing boat

loans.name: Merelyn

Merelyn has been engaged in her business for over 8 years and earns approximately 4,500 PHP a month.

Merelyn is requesting a new loan of 4,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be Merelyn’s 1st loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand it.

Violeta has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Violeta joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Violeta is requesting a loan of 4,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be Violeta’s 1st loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand it.

She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the education of her children and to help sustain their daily needs.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith J. is from the village of Plaridel, Claveria. Misamis Oriental. She is 30 years old. Judith is married. To make a living, Judith owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail store. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling food, basic food ingredients & daily use products in the local community. Judith has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Judith joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Judith is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Judith from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement income of the family.

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
Merlinda T. is engaged in a retailing business. Her product is coconut wine. She sells the wine for PHP 200 per container. The income she earns from her business helps her pay for the daily expenses of their home. She has four children. She is dong very hard work so that she will be able to provide their needs. 

She would like a loan to buy more coconut wine to resell.

loans.use: To buy more coconut wine to resell

loans.name: Carla Josefa

texts.es: La señora Carla Josefa tiene 7 años de experiencia de maestra de educación, soltera anteriormente se le financio un crédito para estudios, ella está solicitando actualmente un crédito para ayudarla a su mama a comprar  materiales de vivienda ya que terminara de arreglar su vivienda.
texts.en:
Carla Josefa has been a teacher for 7 years. She is single. She got a previous loan to pay for her schooling. She is currently asking for funds that will be used to help her mother buy building materials and supplies to finish fixing her house.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Ros

texts.en:
Mr. Ros T. and his wife, Mrs. Men Meach (pictured together), were married in 1984 and have five children: three sons and two daughters. Two of their children are married and live outside the family home. The family lives in a suburb of Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia.

Ros raises ducks at home and his wife has been selling fish and eggs for more than 20 years. He wants to buy a cow to raise so he will get extra income from selling cows when they grow big enough. 

Ros is asking for a loan of $700 to use for this purpose.

loans.use: To buy a cow to raise.

loans.name: Judith

texts.es:
Judith tiene 39 años, es una responsable madre que vive con su pareja y sus 4 hijos; 2 de los cuales ya son independientes económicamente y la ayudan en el hogar. Toda la familia vive junta en su casa propia.

Su negocio es una bodega que instaló muy cerca de su vivienda, esto gracias a su esfuerzo y al de su familia para juntar el capital necesario para su implementación. Desde entonces, todos apoyan para que el negocio salga adelante, reemplazando a Judith cuando tiene que salir a comprar mercadería. Ella se siente satisfecha con su trabajo, pues le arroja buenas ganancias y puede cubrir los gastos de su hogar, además tiene la ventaja de poder realizarlo junto a las personas que más quiere. La parte difícil del negocio radica en tener que trasladarse de su casa a su bodega, pues para llegar a ella debe subir una gran pendiente arenosa donde está ubicado su establecimiento. 

Este es el primer crédito de Judith con MFP y promete ser muy puntual con todos los pagos de sus cuotas. Con el dinero que solicita quiere comprar más productos para surtir su tienda y por ende conseguir más clientela.
texts.en:
Judith is 39 years old, and is a responsible mother who lives with her spouse and four children, two of whom are already economically independent and help her in the home. The whole family lives together in their own home.

Her business is a store that was built very close to her home, made possible thanks to her efforts and those of her family who helped mount the necessary capital to build it. Since then, everyone supports her so that her business can move forward, and they cover for Judith when she has to go out to purchase more merchandise.

She feels satisfied with her work, as she is able to save her earnings and cover the costs of her home. In addition, she has the advantage of running it with the people she loves most. The difficult part of running her business is that she has to climb a large, sandy slope to get to the establishment.

This is Judith's first loan with MFP and she promises to be very punctual with all of her repayments. With the money she seeks, she wants to buy more products to stock her store and thus obtain more clients.

Translated from Spanish by Michelle Harrison, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase her merchandise

loans.name: Constancia

texts.en:
Constancia B. is from the village of Caluya, Sapang Dalaga, Misamis Occidental.  She is 43 years old, married and has 1 school-aged children. To make a living, Constancia owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising hogs. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling and buying hogs in the local community. Constancia has been engaged in her business for 10 years and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2003, Constancia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Constancia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC.  Constancia is requesting a new loan of 4,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional pigs for her hog raising activity. This loan will be the 4tth loan taken out by Constancia from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: additional capital of her hog raisning

loans.name: Blanca Nohemis

texts.es: La señora Blanca Nohemí es trabajadora, actualmente está trabajando asistente de oficina en una micro financiera tiene 10 años de experiencia, es soltera ella solicita el crédito ya que quiere tener sus propios aparatos en casa como televisor, grabadora, etc.
texts.en:
Blanca Nohemí is employed. She is currently working as an office assitant at a Microfinance office. She has 10 years experience. She is single. She is asking for funds because she wants to have her own home appliances, like a television set, tape recorder, etc.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy home appliances.

loans.name: Ana

texts.es:
Ana, de 46 años, vive en su casa propia al lado de su esposo Demetrio (44) que es agricultor y de su pequeña hija, Heidi de un año.

Desde joven ayudaba a sus padres en la agricultura y aprendió que la cosecha es productiva si se trabaja duro y con mucha dedicación. Cuando se casó se dio cuenta que la vida le daba la oportunidad de seguir trabajando la tierra y desde entonces, junto a su esposo, siembra maíz, lo que le genera buenas ganancias económicas, ya que aseguran muy bien la tierra antes de la siembra y venden toda su cosecha. Desde hace 4 años, también se dedica a la crianza y venta de ganado vacuno, según dice; esta actividad también es rentable, pues comercializa una vez al mes los animales en las ferias de la zona, así buscan que salir adelante y ganarse la vida a base de mucho esfuerzo y trabajo. Para el futuro, Ana tiene planeado comprar mayor cantidad de ganado vacuno y también ovino para continuar en la comercialización.

Este es el segundo préstamo que tiene con MFP y está muy agradecida con todas aquellas personas que hacen posible que pueda acceder al crédito que le permitirá seguir progresando. Además, está muy contenta con el trabajo de su banco comunal, ya que todos los integrantes han demostrado ser muy puntuales en el pago de sus cuotas y solidarios. Ana invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de fertilizantes y abono para sus tierras, además de dos cabezas de ganado.
texts.en:
Ana is 46 years old. Sh lives in her own house with her husband Demetrio (44), who is a farmer, and her little daughter, Heidi, a one year old. From the time she was young, she helped her parents with the farming and she learned that the harvest is productive if you work hard and with a lot of dedication. When she got married, she realized that life was giving her a chance to keep working the land. Since then, with her husband, she plants corn, which generates good income for them. They always secure the land before planting and they sell all of their harvest. For four years she has also been raising and selling cattle. According to her, this activity is profitable as well, since she brings the animals to market once a month in the area fairs. In this way, they seek to get ahead and make a living based on alot of effort and work. For the future, Ana plans to buy a larger quantity of cattle and also to continue bringing them to market. This is the second loan she has had with MFP and she is very grateful to all of the people who make it possible for her to access credit that will allow her to keep progressing. In addition, she is very content with the work of her communal bank, since all of the members have demonstrated that they are very punctual with payments and supportive. Ana will invest the requested money in the purchase of chemical and organic fertilizers for her land, as well as two heads of cattle.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of chemical and organic fertilizers

loans.name: Maria Lourdes

texts.es: La señora María Lourdes es maestra desde hace 10 años tiene experiencia en esa labor, ella es trabajadora ella es campesina, su marido trabaja en el campo cosecha frijoles y lo vende en la zona y también para consumo propio ella esta solicitando el crédito para su hija ya que entra a la universidad y no cuenta con mucho dinero.
texts.en:
María Lourdes has been a teacher for 10 years; she is experienced in that occupation. She is a worker, she is a farmer. Her husband works in the fields growing beans which he sells in the area and for their own consumption. She is asking for funds for her daughter because she is about to enter the university and she does not have much money.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For her daughter's university expenses.

loans.name: Angelica

texts.es:
Angélica, de 48 años, vive en su casa propia en compañía de su esposo Teófilo (50), quien es agricultor, y de sus 4 hijos de 22, 17, 13 y 10 años.

Cada día se levanta con los primeros rayos de luz para ir a supervisar, junto con  su esposo, sus campos de maíz. La tarea es ardua y nada fácil porque se necesita paciencia y dedicación para impedir que las condiciones climáticas y las constantes amenazas de plagas no destruyan lo que con tanto esfuerzo ha cuidado. Luego de un tiempo puede observar con mucho orgullo lo dorado de las mazorcas, las cuales vende a los comerciantes mayoristas. Estas ganancias le permiten vivir bien y darles educación a sus hijos, ya que quiere que algún día lleguen a ser profesionales. Por otro lado, también se dedica a la crianza de animales, tiene un toro de buena raza y ganado ovino que vende de vez en cuando, sobretodo cuando hay algún tipo de necesidad urgente. Angélica tiene muchos planes para el futuro y el más cercano es comprar algunas vacas para vender leche fresca.

Este es el primer préstamo que tiene con MFP y está muy agradecida con todas aquellas personas que hacen posible que pueda acceder al crédito que le permitirá seguir adelante. El dinero solicitado lo invertirá en la compra de varios sacos de fertilizantes para su siembra y también comprará dos vacas para empezar a producir leche.
texts.en:
Angélica is 48 years old and lives in her own home, along with her husband Teófilo (50), who is a farmer, and their four children, ages 22, 17, 13, and 10. Each day she rises with the first rays of the sunlight in order to tend to the cornfields, along with her husband. The work is strenuous and nothing easy. It requires patience and dedication in order to fend of the effects of the weather and prevent the insects from destroying what she put so much effort into caring for. After a while she is able to proudly see the golden cobs, which she sells to large businesses. This income allows them to live well and provide for their children’s education. They hope that one day they will become professionals. She also raises livestock and has a good breed of bull and some sheep that she sells now and then, mainly whenever there is an urgent need. Angélica has many plans for the future, the next is to buy some milk cows and sell fresh milk. This will be her first loan through MFP and she is thankful for all the people who make it possible for her to get this loan and move ahead. She will use the money to buy sacs of fertilizer for her crop, and two cows so that she can start selling milk.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Fertilizer for her crop and two milk cows

loans.name: Carina

texts.es:
Carina, de 24 años, vive en compañía de su pareja Edgar de 31 años, quien es agricultor y de su pequeña hija que estudia en el colegio primario de la zona.

Desde que era muy joven se dedica a la agricultura, aprendió las técnicas de sus padres y cuando formó su familia continuó trabajando junto a su esposo en la siembra de papa, olluco, maíz y alverja para sacar adelante a su familia. Ya han pasado 9 años y dice que le gusta mucho cultivar la tierra porque es lo que mejor que sabe hacer, aunque es algo sacrificado levantarse todos los días al amanecer para vigilar con dedicación sus campos, es gratificante recoger la gran producción en la temporada de cosecha. Todos sus productos, los vende a los comerciantes mayoristas de la zona y con lo que ganan puede darle una buena calidad de vida a sus hijos. Paralelamente a este trabajo se dedica a la crianza de ganado vacuno, el cual comercializa eventualmente a los productores de la zona. Y como es una mujer muy emprendedora, para el futuro tiene planeado sembrar en mayor cantidad para aumentar su producción y tener mayores ganancias económicas.

Este es el segundo préstamo que tiene con MFP y está muy agradecida con todas aquellas personas que hacen posible su crédito, el cual le permitirá continuar trabajando para alcanzar el progreso. Además, está muy satisfecha con el trabajo de su banco comunal, ya que todos los integrantes son muy responsables en el pago de sus cuotas. El dinero solicitado lo invertirá en la compra de semillas de alverja y varios sacos de fertilizantes  para asegurar sus tierras en las siembras futuras.
texts.en:
Carina is 24 years old and lives with her husband, Edgar, who is 31 and a farmer, and with her little girl who attends the local elementary school. She’s been farming since she was very young and learned the techniques from her parents. Even after starting her family, she continued to work, alongside her husband, raising potatoes, root vegetables, corn, and barley, in order to help move her family ahead. They’ve been doing this together for nine years and she says that she enjoys working the land because it’s the best that she knows how to do, although it involves some sacrifice having to rise at dawn each day to care for her fields. It’s very satisfying to reap the large harvest. She sells all of her products to large businesses in her zone and the income provides a good quality of life to her children. At the same time she also raises cattle, which she eventually sells to the processors within the zone. Since she is a very enterprising woman, she plans to plant in larger quantities in the future, in order to improve her income. This will be her second loan through MFP and she is very thankful to all the people who make this loan possible so that she can continue to work and move ahead. She is also very happy with the work that her communal bank has done and its members are very responsible with their payments. She will use the money from this loan to buy sacs of fertilizer to prepare her land for future crops.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Seed and Fertilizer

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Mrs. Leonora V. is 48 years old and married with six children. She is from Tiaman, Bonifacio, Misamis Occidental. She owns a sari-sari store and her husband is a farmer. She has managed her business for almost three years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month. Her husband also supports their daily basic needs.

She joined PMPC to gain access to financial support and to be engaged in other business activities. She successfully repaid her previous loan of 3,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding her business. As of now, she has a new loan of 3,000 PHP taken from PMPC, which will be used as additional capital for her sari-sari store.

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: As additional capital for her sari-sari store

loans.name: Brak

texts.en:
Mr. Brak L., age 26, is single and lives with his widowed mother, sister and brothers in a small village off of National Road Number Two about 20 km south of Phnom Penh. He is a construction contractor. In the past, he used to be an electrician too. He wants to purchase construction materials to operate his business, but he does not have enough money. Hence, he is requesting a loan of US $1,200 to use for that purpose. 

Brak is not in the photo; his mother is pictured instead.

loans.use: To purchase construction materials for his business.

loans.name: Tsend-Ochir

texts.en: Tsend-Ochir is 41 years old and lives with his wife and their three children in Uvs province, Mongolia.  He and his family live together in a ger, the Mongolian nomadic tent.  Tsend-Ochir produces wooden products and his wife sells them at the market. Since he started the business, he has been contributing to his family finances and has even purchased a new car. He started the carpentry business with a man named Namsrai in 1998, but they have worked separately since 2002. Since that time, his business has expanded and he has purchased electrical appliances and equipment for the business, which he runs from his own home.  He is a decent person and keeps good accounts of his own business.  He says, “I would like to create my own workplace for the business”. He is requesting a 700,000-tugrug loan to purchase a large amount of  wooden planks for the business.

loans.use: To purchase wooden planks for his carpentry business

loans.name: Luzvisminda

texts.en:
Luzvisminda S. is from the village of Dapaon, Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte. She is 63 years old. Luzvisminda is married and has two adult children. To make a living, Luzvisminda operates a piggery. Luzvisminda has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities. In 2007, Luzvisminda joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Luzvisminda is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional sacks of feed for her piggery. This will be the fifth loan taken out by Luzvisminda from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy sacks of feed

loans.name: Justina

texts.en:
Justina raises cows. She wants to improve her livelihood to be able to support the needs of her family. Aside from that, she is also managing a barbecue business. She sells barbecue everyday. The income that she earns helps a lot to accommodate the daily needs of her family. She wants to send all her children to school; that is why she wants to have more businesses. She would like to apply for a loan at Community Economic Ventures Inc. to buy chickens for her barbecue, cow feed and vitamins. 

She hopes to receive a loan from Community Ventures Inc. to help her with her livelihood.

loans.use: To buy cow feed, vitamins & chickens

loans.name: Valentina

texts.en:
Mrs. Valentina P. is 51 years old and married with seven children. She is from Tuluan, Tambulig, Zamboanga del Sur. She is a PDP-LP member and owns a sari-sari store. Her husband is a farmer. From her sari-sari store, she earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month. She has been engaged in her business for almost four years.    

She joined PMPC to gain access to financial support and to be engaged in other business activities. She successfully repaid her previous loan of 3,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding the business. As of now, she has a new loan of 4,000 PHP taken from PMPC, which will be used to have additional capital for her business. It is the third loan that Mrs. Valentina has taken from PMPC.

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

 *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders

loans.use: As additional capital for her sari-sari store

loans.name: Edilisa

texts.es:
Edilisa, de 24 años, vive en la casa de sus suegros, con ellos, su esposo Edinson (24), quien es agricultor y sus 2 pequeños hijos de 4 y 3 años.

Desde hace un año instaló en su casa una pequeña tienda de comestibles, puesto que quería ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar. Notó que por la alejada zona donde viven no había una tienda cerca y aprovechó la buena oportunidad para empezar su negocio. Al principio con poca mercadería y después de un tiempo ha logrado abastecerla con mayor cantidad de productos de primera necesidad. Esta actividad es tranquila y trabaja sola, desde las 6 de la mañana hasta las 6 de la tarde, aunque a veces extiende el horario de atención por las constantes necesidades de sus vecinos. 
Paralelamente, ayuda a su esposo en las labores agrícolas, pero solo en los tiempos de cosecha, ya que no le queda mucho tiempo libre con la tienda y la crianza de los niños. Y como es una mujer emprendedora, para el futuro tiene planeado mejorar las instalaciones de su tienda para ofrecer un mejor servicio e imagen.

Este es el primer préstamo que tiene con MFP y está muy agradecida con todas aquellas personas que hacen posible que pueda acceder al crédito  para seguir trabajando. Edilisa tiene pensado invertir el dinero solicitado en la compra de mayor cantidad de mercadería en abarrotes para abastecer su tienda, porque quiere traer productos nuevos y de mejor calidad  para ofrecer a sus habituales clientes.
texts.en:
Edilisa is 24 years old and lives in her in-laws’ home, along with her husband, Edinson (24), who is a farmer, and with her two young children, ages 4 and 3. A year ago she opened a small food store in their home because she wanted to help her husband with the household expenses. She saw that there were no stores nearby, so she took advantage of this and opened her own store. She started with a few items and has managed to stock it with many basic needs products over time. This job is easy and she works by herself from six in the morning to six in the evening, although at times she extends her hours to meet her customer’s needs. She also helps her husband with the farm work, but only during the harvest season because she does not have much free time between running the store and raising her children. But since she is an enterprising woman, she plans to improve her store’s fixtures in order to give it a better look and be able to improve her customer service. This will be her first loan through MFP and she is grateful to all the people who make this loan possible and allow her to continue to work. Edilisa will use the money from this loan to buy groceries in bulk to stock her store. She wants to bring in new and better quality items to offer to her regular customers.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Inventory

loans.name: Angeles

texts.en:
Angeles D. is from the village of Dapaon, Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte. She is 66 years old, married and has eight adult children. To make a living, Angeles operates a business selling clothes in the local community. Angeles has been engaged in her business for 25 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities. In 2008, Angeles joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Angeles has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Angeles is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Angeles from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About PMPC: 

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: As additional capital

loans.name: Felicidad

texts.en:
Felicidad G. is from the village of Galas, Dipolog City. She is 39 years old. Felicidad is married. To make a living, Felicidad operates a family member's business venture running a general store. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Felicidad is just starting this business.

In 2007, Felicidad joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Felicidad has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Felicidad is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used for the expansion of her store. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Felicidad from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Ernestina

texts.es:
Ernestina, de 32 años, vive al lado su pareja Isidoro (32), quien es agricultor, y de sus 3 hijos que son menores de edad y estudian en el colegio.

Desde muy joven se dedica a la agricultura, aprendió viendo a sus padres y hermanos cómo sembraban con esmero la tierra. Cuando formó su familia, hace 15 años, continuó con las labores agrícolas; en la actualidad ambos siembran maíz y papa y cuidan  mucho de sus tierras para asegurar su producción, pues deben vender todo a los comerciantes mayoristas que van hasta sus mismas chacras a recoger los productos. Ella está muy satisfecha, ya que tiene buenas ganancias y le gusta mucho su trabajo, porque a pesar de ser sacrificado, es gratificante sacar adelante a sus hijos con mucho esfuerzo. A su vez, se dedica a la crianza de ganado vacuno y porcino, el cual comercializa en las ferias de la zona por donde vive. Para el futuro tiene pensado sembrar en mayor cantidad el maíz, ya que el precio en el mercado esta alto, pero también quiere comprar más cabezas de ganado.

Este es el segundo préstamo que tiene con MFP y está muy agradecida con todas aquellas personas que hacen posible que pueda recibir el crédito que le permitirá seguir trabajando. El dinero solicitado lo invertirá en la compra de semillas de maíz y fertilizantes para asegurar la producción de sus campos.
texts.en:
Ernestina is 32 years old and lives with her husband, Isidoro (32), who is a farmer, and with her three young children who attend school. She’s been farming since she was a child and learned by watching her parents and brothers work the land with great care. When she started her family 15 years ago, she continued farming. Now they both raise corn and potatoes and care for their land in order to ensure a good harvest. They sell all of their products to large business who travel to the same fields to pick up their products. She is very satisfied, has a good income, and likes her work. Even though it requires a lot of sacrifice, it’s gratifying to help her children get ahead. She also raises cattle and hogs, which she sells. She would like to increase her corn production, since the price of corn is high, but she also wants to buy heads of livestock. This will be her second loan through MFP and she is very thankful to all the people who make this loan possible and allow her to continue working. She will use the money from this loan to buy corn seed and fertilizer to increase production.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Seed and fertilizer

loans.name: Eucalda

texts.es:
Eucalda, de 35 años, vive en su casa propia en compañía de su esposo Arturo (34), quien es agricultor, y de sus 3 hijos de 13, 11 y 7 años.

Desde que era muy pequeña aprendió, como jugando, todo lo que era necesario para la correcta producción agrícola. De esa manera, cuando se unió a su esposo no dudó en seguir trabajando la tierra junto a él y empezaron con la siembra de maíz. Tiempo después notaron que las ganancias por la venta de este producto les permitían sustentar muy bien a su familia, además de darles educación a sus hijas que era lo que más les interesaba. Ha pasado el tiempo y continúan  sembrando maíz y paralelamente se dedica a la crianza de ganado porcino para luego comercializarlos en las ferias de la zona donde vive. Esta actividad le da buenas ganancias, que junto a la agricultura le permite ofrecer una buena calidad de vida a su familia. Y como es una mujer muy emprendedora, para el futuro tiene planeado sembrar alverja, ya que sabe que el precio de este producto está muy alto en el mercado.

Este es el primer préstamo que tiene con MFP y está muy agradecida con todas las personas que hacen posible que pueda recibir el crédito que le permitirá seguir trabajando por su progreso. El dinero solicitado lo invertirá en la compra de semilla de alverja y varios sacos de fertilizantes para sus asegurar sus campos de cultivo y tener una buena producción.
texts.en:
Eucalda is 35 years old and lives in her own home with her husband, Arturo (34) who is a farmer, and with their three children, ages 13, 11, and 7. When she was little she, as a game, she learned everything necessary for proper farming. When she married her husband, she had no doubt that she would continue working the land and they started planting corn together. They eventually saw the income from the sale of their product allowed them to support their family very well, including paying for an education for their daughters, which is what they were most interested in. As time passed, they continued to cultivate corn and also began raising hogs to sell in the fairs in the zone where they live. This also provides a good income and, along with the income from farming, they are able to provide a good life for their family. Because she is an enterprising woman, she plans to grow peas in the future, now that she knows that the price for this product in the marketplace is high. This will be her first loan through MFP and she is very grateful to all the people who make this loan possible, allowing her to continue to work and progress. She will use the money from this loan to buy pea seed and various sacs of fertilizer to help ensure that the land produces a good harvest.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Seed and fertilizer

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna E. is from the village of Caluya, Sapang Dalaga, Misamis Occidental.  She is 40 years old, married and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Myrna owns & operates a general store. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling daily-use products in the local community. Myrna has been engaged in her business for seven years and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2003, Myrna joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Myrna has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,900 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Myrna is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used for house renovation. This loan will be the seventh loan taken out by Myrna. She plans to use the additional capital from PMPC to improve/expand her business. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: For house renovation

loans.name: Van

texts.en:
Mr. T. Van, 33 years old, and his wife, Mrs. Sony Chan, 28 years old, were married in 2005 and just have a young daughter. Besides his daughter, he also has his mother living with him. The family lives in a small village on National Road Number Two about 20 km south of Phnom Penh City. T. is not in the photo; his wife, who is a garment factory worker, was available instead. 

T. has just started a business selling Cha Khvai cakes three months ago (Cha Khvai is a kind of cake made of flour that swells up when fried). He cooks Cha Khvai at his house and distributes it to sell in Takhmao market, approximately 8 kilometers from his home.  
T. hopes to expand his business so he is able to earn extra income as well. Therefore, he is asking for a loan to help his capital.

loans.use: To expand his business.

loans.name: Feliciana

texts.es:
Feliciana, D. 52 años, vive en su casa propia en compañía D. su pareja Fidel (38), quien es agricultor, y D. su pequeño hijo D. 10 años, porque los 3 mayores ya tiene sus propias familias.

DesD. muy joven se dedica a las labores agrícolas, ya que aprendió D. sus padres las técnicas necesarias para el cuidado D. las tierras. Cuando quedó viuda pensó que su vida estaba terminando, pero tiempo después se unió a su actual pareja y tuvo un hijo; en la actualidad trabaja junto a su pareja en la siembra D. maíz y papa. Cada día es D. sacrificio, ya que la vida en la sierra es algo dura por los constantes cambios climáticos D. la zona y porque debe despertarse al amanecer, todos los días, para vigilar sus tierras. Paralelamente a las labores agrícolas cría ganado ovino, el que comercializa D. vez en cuando en las ferias su zona. Y como es una mujer muy emprendedora, para el futuro tiene planeado empezar a sembrar alverja, ya que se ha enterado que el precio D. este producto tiene un buen precio en el mercado.

Este es el primer préstamo que tiene con MFP y está muy agradecida con todas las personas que hacen posible que pueda acceder al crédito para continuar trabajando. Además está contenta D. pertenecer a su grupo D. trabajo porque es muy unido y solidario. El dinero solicitado lo invertirá en la compra D. varios sacos D. abono y fertilizantes que necesita para el cuidado D. sus tierras y para que la producción no presente ningún tipo D. problemas durante la cosecha.
texts.en:
Feliciana is 52 years old and lives in her own home with her partner Fidel (age 38), who is a farmer, and her ten year old son. Her three older children already have their own families.

From a young age she has worked on a farm. Feliciana learned from her parents the necessary techniques required to care for the land. When she became a widow, she thought her life was coming to an end. However, she later met her current partner and had another child. They work together planting corn and potatoes. Every day is a sacrifice because life in the mountains is sometimes difficult because of the changing climate. Feliciana wakes up at dawn every day to monitor her farmland. In addition, she raises sheep and sells her animals from time to time at the local fairs. Being a very enterprising woman, she has future plans to start growing peas because she learned that she can get a good market price for this product.

This is her first loan with MFP. She is grateful to everyone who maD. it possible for her to access a loan that allows her to keep working. Feliciana is glad to be working with a group that is very close and support of one another. She will use the money to buy sacks of compost and fertilizer needed to care for her land and prevent production problems that will impact her harvest.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase compost & fertilizers

loans.name: Hilvia

texts.es:
Hilvia, de 30 años, vive en la casa que le heredaron sus padres en compañía de su esposo Rubén (35), quien es agricultor, y de sus tres hijos; Elio (8),Vanesa(5) y Jordi (2).

Desde muy joven, esta trabajadora mujer, se dedica a la agricultura; siembra maíz y papa junto con su esposo. Con mucha paciencia vigilan sus cultivos hasta la temporada de cosecha y venden toda su producción a los comerciantes mayoristas que les paguen el mayor precio. Paralelamente, tiene una tienda de comestibles instalada en su vivienda y como es uno de los pocos negocios de la zona, le genera buenas ganancias. 
Siendo una mujer muy emprendedora, para el futuro tiene planeado sembrar en mayor cantidad, para producir más y ampliar las instalaciones de su tienda, ya que quiere abastecerla con mayor cantidad de productos.

Este es el segundo préstamo que tiene con MFP y está muy agradecida con todas aquellas personas que hacen posible que pueda recibir el crédito que la ayudará a seguir trabajando en busca del progreso. El dinero solicitado lo invertirá en la compra de semillas de alverjas, también comprará varios sacos de fertilizantes y abono para cuidar sus tierras.
texts.en:
Hilvia is 30 years old and lives in the house she inherited from her parents. Her husband Ruben (age 35) is a farmer and they have three children: Elio (age 8), Vanesa (age 5) and Jordi (age 2).

From a young age, Hilvia has worked hard has a farmer. She and her husband grow corn and potatoes. With great patience, she monitors her crops until harvest season. She sells all of her produce to the wholesale merchants who pay higher prices. At the same time, she manages a grocery store in her home. Since there are few businesses like hers in the area, she is able to generate good earnings. Being a very enterprising woman, Hilvia intends to plant more seeds in the future so that she can increase her output. She also plans to expand her store so that she can restock it with a larger quantity of products.

This is her second loan with MFP. Hilvia is very grateful to everyone who made it possible to receive this loan that will allow her to continue working. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy seeds for a new crop of peas. She will also purchase various sacks of fertilizers and compost to maintain her farmland.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase seeds & fertilizers

loans.name: Nelida

texts.es:
Nelida, de 28 años, vive en su casa propia con sus 3 hijos menores de edad, ella los mantiene sola y trata cada día de que nada les falte.

Esta luchadora mujer se dedica a sembrar maíz desde que era muy joven aprendió las técnicas  viendo a sus padres y hermanos; tiempo después cuando se separó de su pareja no dudo en continuar trabajando para sacar adelante a sus hijos. Cada día se despierta al amanecer y se dirige con mucho empeño a vigilar sus tierras, ya que debe protegerlas de las adversidades del clima (fuertes vientos y lluvias) y las constantes plagas que amenazan la producción. Aunque es un trabajo algo duro para una mujer le gusta mucho, pues la motiva el hecho de sacar adelante a sus hijos, y cuando es tiempo de cosecha vende muy bien toda su producción y con el dinero le puede dar alimento y educación a sus pequeños. Para el futuro tiene planeado sembrar en mayor cantidad el maíz y contratar los servicios de peones para obtener mayores ganancias.

Este es el segundo préstamo que tiene con MFP y está muy agradecida con todas aquellas personas que hacen posible que pueda acceder al crédito que le permitirá seguir trabajando. Además está muy satisfecha con el trabajo de su banco comunal, ya que todos sus compañeros son muy responsables. Nelida invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de semilla de maíz para empezar una productiva siembra, además de fertilizantes para asegurar sus tierras para el futuro.
texts.en:
Nelida is 28 years old and lives in her own home with her three dependent children. She raises them alone and makes sure each day that they do not lack anything.

This determined woman grows corn. At a young age, she learned farming techniques from her parents and siblings. After she separated from her husband, Nelida did not hesitate to continue working to support her children. Each day she wakes up at dawn and directs most of her efforts to monitoring her farmland since she must protect it against adverse weather conditions (strong winds and heavy rains) and persistent pests that threaten her crop production. Even though this is considered to be hard work for a woman, she enjoys it tremendously because she is motivated by the chance to move her children forward. At harvest time, she generates good sales from everything she produces. With the money she earns, Nelida is able to put food on the table and provide her children with an education. In the future, she intends to plant more corn and hire laborers so that she can earn more income.

This is her second loan with MFP. Nelida is very grateful to everyone who made it possible to receive this loan that will allow her to continue working. She is satisfied with the work of her Communal Bank, since her fellow members have been very responsible. Nelida will use the money to purchase seeds for planting a new crop of corn. She will also buy fertilizers to maintain her land for the future.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase seeds & fertilizers

loans.name: Nemicia

texts.es:
Nemicia, D. 60 años, vive en su casa propia al lado D. su esposo Ángel (63), y D. sus 3 hijos D. 15, 14 y 5 años, en una zona alejada D. la sierra del Perú.

DesD. muy pequeña aprendió a cultivar la tierra, le gustaba ayudar a sus padres en las labores agrícolas. Ahora trabaja junto a su esposo sembrado maíz y papa, el trabajo le gusta mucho porque si bien es cierto que no pudo estudiar, sus padres la capacitaron muy bien en las labores D. campo para que nunca le falte nada; es por esta razón que quiere que sus hijos estudien y hace lo posible, con su esposo, para darles lo mejor. También se dedica a la crianza D. ganado vacuno y ovino que, según cuenta, es un negocio seguro, ya que venD. sus animales mensualmente y obtiene buenas ganancias. Y como es una mujer muy empeñosa, para el futuro tiene planeado sembrar en mayor cantidad, además D. comprar más cabezas D. ganado.

Este es el segundo préstamo que tiene con MFP y está muy agradecida con todas aquellas personas que hacen posible que pueda acceder al crédito que le permitirá seguir trabajando para el bienestar D. su familia. Nemicia tiene pensado invertir el dinero solicitado en la compra D. fertilizantes para el mantenimiento D. sus tierras; también adquirirá  algunas cabezas D. ganado ovino.
texts.en:
Nemicia is 60 years old and lives in her own home with her husband Ángel (age 63) and their three children (ages 15, 14, and 5) in a remote area in the mountains of Peru.

From a young age, Nemicia learned how to cultivate the land. She enjoyed helping her parents with their farming duties. Now she works with her husband growing corn and potatoes. Nemicia was not able to attend school, so her parents trained her very well to perform field labor so that she could still earn a living. For this reason, she and her husband want their children to pursue an education and proviD. them the best if at all possible. Nemicia also raises cattle and sheep. She says this is a safe business because she can sell her animals every month and generate a good income. Being an enterprising woman, she hopes to plant more crops as well as buy more livestock.

This is her second loan with MFP. Nemicia is very grateful to everyone who maD. it possible for her to access a loan so that she can continue providing for her family's welfare. She will use the money to purchase fertilizers for maintaining her land and also buy a few heads of sheep.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertilizers & sheep

loans.name: Silvia

texts.es:
Silvia, de 29 años, vive en su casa propia en compañía de su pareja y sus 3 menores hijos; juntos buscan que salir adelante a base de mucho esfuerzo y trabajo.

Cada día se despierta al amanecer y se dirige hacia sus campos de maíz, junto con su esposo, para vigilar sus tierras, pues la cosecha futura debe ser muy productiva. La agricultura es una actividad que le genera buenas ganancias que le permite brindar a su familia una adecuada calidad de vida. A Silvia le gusta sembrar en sus tierras, ya que sabe cómo hacerlo, lo que no le gusta son las constantes plagas que muchas veces arruinan gran parte de la cosecha, por eso es necesaria la constante vigilancia. 
Paralelamente se dedica a la crianza de ganado vacuno, ya que ante cualquier emergencia que se le presente puede vender alguno y ganar dinero. Y como es una mujer emprendedora, tiene muchos planes para progresar, entre ellos se encuentra el de comprar mayor cantidad de ganado para continuar en la comercialización, pues obtiene buenas ganancias en este negocio.

Este es el segundo préstamo que tiene con MFP y está muy agradecida con todas las personas que hacen posible que pueda recibir el crédito que le permitirá continuar trabajando. El dinero solicitado lo invertirá en la compra fertilizantes para asegurar sus tierras, además quiere comprar dos cabezas de ganado que engordará para después verderlos.
texts.en:
Silvia is 29 years old and lives in her own home with her partner and their three dependent children. Together they seek to get ahead on the basis of much effort and work.

Every day Silvia wakes up at dawn to begin work in her cornfields. Both she and her husband look after their land so that they can be assured of a good and productive harvest. Farming generates a decent income that gives her family an adequate quality of life. Silvia enjoys planting seeds because she knows exactly what to do, but she does not like constantly dealing with pests that have ruined a large part of her harvest on several previous occasions. Therefore, it is necessary that she remain vigilant. Silvia also raises cattle. Whenever emergency situations arise, she can always sell a head of cattle to earn some money. Being an enterprising woman, Silvia has many plans to keep progressing. One of her goals is to buy more cattle so that she can continue to sell them, thereby generating more income.

This is her second loan with MFP. Silvia is very grateful to everyone who made it possible to receive this loan that will allow her to continue working. The money will be used to purchase fertilizers for maintaining her land. She will also buy two heads of cattle for fattening and eventual resale.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertilizers & two heads of cattle

loans.name: It

texts.en:
Mrs. It C. (pictured above), 56, and her husband, Mr. Hout Khloeng, 62, live in a small village across the Mekong River about 15 km from Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 1970 and have eight children: six sons and two daughters. Four of the children are married and live outside the family home, one attends school and the other three children weave silk at home.    

It has been a silk weaver for 25 years, a skill she learned from her aunt. She sells her finished products to a middleman who then takes them to sell in Phnom Penh market. It is requesting her first loan of $1,000 to purchase silk materials for her and her children’s weaving business.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for her and her children’s weaving business.

loans.name: Phorn

texts.en: Mr. Phorn P., 38, is a hardworking man who resides in Phnom Penh, the capital of Cambodia. Phorn P. was married many years ago and has three kids who attend school and depend on his income. To earn a daily income, Phorn P. always leaves home to go to rural areas where he buys oxen at reasonable prices from farmers so that he can fatten them for a while and then resell them. He is able to earn around $5 each day to manage his family’s daily requirements. He has a life partner in his wife, who sells a few vegetables in the market. Phorn P. desires to improve his business and is requesting a loan of $500 from Kiva’s field partner, HKL. He will buy more animals to sell for extra income.

loans.use: To buy more animals.

loans.name: Kan

texts.en:
Mrs. Kan S. (shown in the photo), 60, is a widow who lives with her daughter and niece on an island in the Mekong River about 15 km from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. 

Kan has been selling groceries since 1990. She buys grocery items from Phnom Penh market for resale at the store in front of her house. Kan is requesting her first loan of $500 to purchase more grocery items for her inventory and to buy silk material for her niece’s weaving business.

loans.use: To purchase more grocery items and silk material

loans.name: Merlina

texts.en:
Merlina E. owns a small eatery business. She has been selling different food items so that she will be able to earn a profit to accommodate their needs. She would like to grow her business and hopes to expand and have other eateries. She has only one child. She is doing her best to be the best mother to her child. 

She is requesting a loan of PHP 8,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. She will use the loan to buy additional food ingredients.

loans.use: To buy additional food ingredients

loans.name: Chhem

texts.en: Mrs. S. is a vegetable seller who has been running her business in the market for years. She then hurries to deliver her items by trailer-motorcycle to the market where she retails them. She is married, with four school-aged kids, while her husband is a family contributor who works in construction. Mrs. S. is seeking assistance in order to improve her vegetable trade by buying greater quantities of vegetables to sell. (Mrs. S. was not available for a picture, so her husband is pictured instead.)

loans.use: To buy greater quantities of vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Lak

texts.en:
Mrs. Lak S. (pictured here), age 30, and her husband, Mr. Phal Leng, age 37, have been married since 1994 and have three children: two sons and one daughter. The family lives along National Road Number One about 15 km from Phnom Penh City. 

Lak has been selling sugarcane juice in her village for almost three years. Her husband has been a motorcycle repairer for almost three years. Lak wants to supplement her income with a new business raising pigs.  She will be able to earn extra income from selling pigs when they grow big enough.  

Hence, Lak is requesting her first loan of $500 to purchase piglets to raise and to buy motorcycle spare parts for her husband’s motorcycle repair business.

loans.use: To purchase piglets and motorcycle spare parts

loans.name: Chyibylova Aysalkyn`s Group

texts.en:
Our first member of this solidarity group is Aysalkyn. She is a widow with two children. Both of the children are married and have their own children. Her only son lives with her and they have a common business. They fatten cattle and sheep and they keep some poultry. This loan will be used to buy five sheep. Her family started this business soon after the collapse of the USSR. Although this a little business, it is quite enough to cover the family expenses and that is the most important thing for Aysalkyn. 

Now let us introduce Jeken. She is 65 years. She is married and the loved mother of 10! children. She has also dozens of grandchildren. As she says, they are all her biggest achievement in her life. She has a livestock business. She started this business in 1994 with 4 cows and 20 sheep. Her average income per month is about $250 US. She also produces milk products. Her loan will be used to buy fodder.

Saliyahon, 73, is a married pensioner. Her husband is also a pensioner. She has five children: three daughters and two sons. She is involved in farming and livestock. They usually raise wheat and corn. Her loan will be used to buy one milking cow with a calf. 

Perizat is the youngest member of this group. She is just 22 years old. She has one infant. Her husband has a little yard where he fattens animals.  Also he resells them at the local animal market. Her loan will be used to buy fodder. She also wants to start farming and raise vegetables.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: To buy five sheep

loans.name: Same

texts.en:
