loans.name: Juvy

texts.en: Mrs. Juvy B., 23 years of age, is single and is a resident of Bolinsong, Bonifacio, Misamis Occidental. She lives with Charlie Bacus, a laborer mason and the father of her infant daughter. Juvy joined the cooperative this year, 2010. As a newly-recognized member of the PDP-LP (Paglaum Development Program for Landless People) Program, she was given the privilege of obtaining a loan of P3,000. She will use this to add to her capital in opening a sari-sari (variety) store in order to help her spouse with their family income. Together with her in the photo is one of her customers. The future income from this loan will be used for loan repayments, daily basic needs and savings for the future. Juvy is hoping that her business will become more progressive in the future. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for the opening of a sari-sari store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for her husband's business

loans.name: Samnang

texts.en:
O. Samnang, 49, is a widow living in Takeo province with her three children. She sells sugarcane juice, making US$8 in revenue a day and is supported by her children who are in the garment factories.

O. Samnang is asking for a loan of US$500 to grow vegetables to sell at the market.

loans.use: To grow vegetables

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional goods for her business

loans.name: Sarin

texts.en:
K. Sarin, 35, is married with three children and lives in Takeo province. She is a farmer, making around US$2 each day. Her husband is a construction foreman who is able to generate US$2 each day as well.

K. Sarin is asking for a loan of US$550 to raise chickens, pigs and cows. She needs the money to purchase the animals and also the feed. Along with her ability to generate income through the purchase of animals, she would like to purchase a water pump.

K. Sarin believes that this loan can raise her standard of living and provide valuable resources for her family.

loans.use: To raise cows, pigs and chickens and to purchase a water pump

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en: Rosalinda D. is from the village of Salimbal, Lugait, Misamis Oriental. She is 52 years old, is married, and has four adult children. Rosalinda continues operating a business providing manicure and pedicure services to local community members. She has been engaged in her business for a long time and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. Rosalinda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. She is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials needed to expand services provided. This loan will be her 2nd from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to expand services provided

loans.name: Sok

texts.en: L. Sok, 54, is married with four children.  Her family lives in the Takeo province. She raises animals and makes rice wine, earning around $5 each day. Her husband is a taxi driver who is able to generate $5 each day as well.  L. Sok is asking for a loan of $1000 for rice and tools so that she can produce more rice wine to sell at the local market.

loans.use: Purchase rice to make rice wine.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en: Mrs. Evangeline D., 40 years of age, is married and is a resident of Maloro, Tangub City. She is married to Ponciano D., employed by the government as a driver of a government vehicle in the city. With an income of only P4,000 from her husband, they felt some financial hardships in supporting the needs of their three children who are now of school age. To help her husband, Evangeline uses her skills in pedicure and manicure and is currently providing pedicure and manicure services. Through these skills, she is earning an average net income of not less than P2,000 a month which is so helpful to their family. Evangeline joined the cooperative this year, 2010. As a newly-recognized member of the PDP-LP (Paglaum Development Program for Landless People) Program, she was given the privilege of obtaining a loan of P3,000 to purchase additional manicure and pedicure sets for her business activities. Evangeline’s dreams in life are to provide a better future for her children and to improve their living conditions. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional pedicure and manicure sets

location.town: Maloro, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental, Mindanao

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva I. is from the village of  Lumbia Cagayan de oro City. She is 42 years old, married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Eva runs a sari-sari (variety) retail shop.  Her main source of income comes primarily from selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Eva has been in business for over 3 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Eva joined HSPFI to access financial services to improve her living situation and to engage in business activities. Eva has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from HSPFI to purchase additional products to sell.  Eva is requesting a new loan of 11000 PHP which will be used to expand her business.  This loan will be her third from HSPFI.  She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 
--------------------------------
About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

loans.use: Invest in expanding the business.

location.town: Lumbia, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Cheryl

texts.en:
Twenty-six-year-old Cheryl T. farms for a living.  She is a single parent of two children; her oldest child is six years old.  She says that raising her children alone brings a lot of challenges.  They are her motivation to go on and face every challenge.  Cheryl does her best to sustain them and has started saving for their education. 

Cheryl needs additional capital for her business. She is asking for a loan of Php4,000 from CEVI.  She said she would use the loan to buy seeds, fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.use: Farm Supplies

loans.name: Florencia

texts.en:
Florencia tills her two-hectare rice field with patience.  She has been doing this since 2004.  Florencia also runs a small store where she sells oil, vinegar and other daily necessities to her neighbors. She has a 16 year-old child who goes to school.  Florencia aims to have her child finish college and have a bright future.  Her husband, Teodoro, is her partner in maintaining the farm. She hopes to succeed in all ventures in life.

Florencia recently joined CEVI to gain access to its loan program. She requested a loan Php4,000.  If granted, she will purchase farm supplies like seeds and fertilizers.

loans.use: Farm Supplies

loans.name: Simorn

texts.en:
Simorn U., 55, lives several kilometers from Phnom Penh City.  She has four children: three daughters and one son. One is a waitress, other one is a scarf weaver and two attend school.  

Simorn is a scarf weaver and scarf-weaving teacher. She is requesting her first loan of $500 to purchase cotton thread for her daughter's scarf-weaving business.

loans.use: Buy cotton thread for her daughter’s scarf-weaving business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase of motorcycle

loans.name: Deonita

texts.en:
“Farming is our source of income and we just prepared our farm for planting. I also have a stall in the market where I sell fish”, Deonita shares about her business. 

She and her husband work hand-in-hand to earn a living.  They have a twelve-year-old child, whom they both hope will have a bright future.  She looked for ways to sustain her business and when she learned of CEVI, she joined hoping to gain access to its loan program.  Deonita is now requesting a loan of Php4, 000.  She told CEVI that she would use it to fund her farm by buying farm supplies like seeds and fertilizers.

loans.use: Farm Supplies

loans.name: Dinalyn

texts.en: Dinalyn is a married woman from Agusan Del Sur.  She has two children with her husband, Ruel.  Her oldest child is only three years of age.  Dinalyn is a rice farmer and tills one hectare.  This is how she gets her income.  Dinalyn wants to expand her business to improve her earnings because she wants her children to have a proper education.  She joined CEVI to get a loan. She is requesting Php4, 000, which will be used to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs.

loans.use: Farm Supplies

loans.name: Meriam

texts.en: Meriam, 57, is grateful to be tilling her own farm because other farmers at her town only tend other people’s farm to earn a living.  She currently has two hectares of rice field located in a town in Agusan Del Sur.  Being in a province where rice farming is one of the main livelihoods, she intends to sell quality rice to people in her community.  Meriam also joined CEVI, an MFI, to get financial support for her business.  She said its program is really helpful to farmers like her who need additional capital. She is asking to loan Php4,000. With this amount of money, Meriam will buy certified seeds, fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.use: Farm Supplies

loans.name: Luzminda

texts.en:
Luzminda is a mother of a 16 year-old child.  She is 48 years old and has been married to Roberto for 27 years.  Luzminda ventured in rice farming several years ago and now has two hectares of rice field.  She helps her husband maintain their farm.  She makes sure it is free of weeds and pests so their crops would grow healthy.  Luzminda hopes to have her child finish college and has a bright future.

Luzminda needs additional capital for her business.   That’s why she joined Community Economic Ventures, Inc.  She is happy to have access to its program and is now requesting to loan Php4,000, which she would use to buy farm supplies, like seeds and fertilizers.

loans.use: Farm Supplies

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en: Myrna, a 38-year-old married woman, said she discovered CEVI when she noticed her neighbor’s business was improving.  She is a rice farmer with four children.  Her oldest child is only ten years old and she wants all of them to finish college and find decent jobs.  She has six hectares of rice field located in her town, in Agusan Del Sur.  Myrna wants to sustain it and when she learned of CEVI, she joined the MFI to take advantage of what her neighbors were experiencing.  She requests a loan of Php4,000.  Myrna said she would use it to supply her farm.

loans.use: Farm Supplies

loans.name: Mary Grace

texts.en: Mary Grace just started planting rice crops at her 1.5 hectare field.  She said the farm still lacks inputs and the crops she already planted need to be nourished.  A married woman with three children, she gives her best to help her husband provide for the growing needs in their household.  One of her priorities is her children’s education.  A new member of CEVI, she is grateful to get into its loan program. She is asking for a loan of Php4,000.  Mary Grace will use this loan to buy farm inputs like seeds and fertilizers.

loans.use: Farm Supplies

loans.name: Ma. Elena

texts.en:
Ma. Elena S. and her husband own a five hectares rice field.  Sometimes she hires laborers to help them prepare the land for planting.  

She has been married to her husband Larry for twenty years. She has an eight-year-old child whom she loves taking care of.

Ma. Elena is asking for a loan from CEVI.  She said that if granted, it would really be helpful her buy the necessary farm inputs she needs such as seeds, fertilizers and others.

loans.use: Farm Supplies

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith, 47, has five children with her husband Percibal.  She has been farming since 1996.  Judith now has two hectares of field where she and her husband plant rice crops.  She said that a financial shortage and climate changes bring challenges to her business.  There are times when her harvest is too little and there are also times it is just enough.  She wants to have an abundant harvest to be able to provide for the increasing needs of her household. 

Judith joined CEVI to gain financial support for her business.  She requests a loan of Php4, 000, to use to support her farm.  With that amount of money, she would be able to buy seeds, fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.use: Farm Supplies

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta A. is from the village of Salimbal, Lugait Misamis Oriental.  She is 44 years old, married and has 7 school-aged children.  Julieta makes and sells food.  Her main source of income comes primarily from selling specialty food products in her local community.

Julieta joined HSPFI to access financial services to improve her living situation and to engage in business activities.  Julieta has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI.  Now Julieta is requesting a loan of 8000 PHP to make more products to sell.  This loan will be the 2nd loan from HSPFI.  She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the education of her children. 
--------------------------------------------------
About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

loans.use: Purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Ruby Pearl

texts.en:
Ruby's parents owned five hectares of rice field but it was pawned when she and her other siblings were in school.  Later she and her husband paid for the farm and now tills it together.  Ruby wants to give her two children a proper education and improve their house.

Ruby recently joined CEVI to gain access to its loan program. She requested for a loan of Php6,000, which she will use to purchase farm supplies like seeds and fertilizers.

loans.use: Farm Supplies

loans.name: Michelle

texts.en: Michelle started her hog-raising business with only one piglet.  She raised it and when she sold it, she was able to buy three piglets.  With her continuous efforts, her business started growing and now it is the main source of her income.  Michelle is planning to expand her pen so more pigs could be accommodated.  She requested a loan of Php6,000, which she will use to buy feed for her pigs and materials to expand of their pen.  Receiving this loan is truly helpful to Michelle’s growing business.

loans.use: Feeds for pigs and supplies to expand their pen.

loans.name: Lucila

texts.en: Lucila is a 49-year-old woman from Agusan Del Sur.  She has two children; the oldest aged 25.  She does rice farming for a living and has been doing so for four years.  Lucila spends most of her daytime tilling her one-hectare rice field.  She aims to have an abundant harvest so she does her best to achieve success.  She sought the help of CEVI, an MFI in the Philippines, to gain financial support.  Lucila requests a loan of Php6, 000, to supply her farm with inputs it lacks, like seeds and fertilizer.

loans.use: Farm Supplies

loans.name: Ginalyn

texts.en: Ginalyn started farming way back in 2002.  She said she started with a small amount of capital so her harvest was not really that much.  Having two children, she and her husband work hard to supply their growing needs.  Ginalyn is seeking additional capital from Community Economic Ventures, Inc. She will use the loan to buy seeds, fertilizer and other farm inputs.  Hopefully, this loan would help Ginalyn achieve an abundant harvest.

loans.use: Farm Supplies

loans.name: Lucita

texts.en:
Lucita opened a small store to add to her family's income.  Primarily, she and her husband are rice farmers.  She said that sometimes they are really short on money because it costs a lot to support the education of their five children.  But still, she works hard to help provide for their needs.

Lucita applied to CEVI and requested a loan of Php6, 000.  She told CEVI that she would use it to buy seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs.

loans.use: Farm Supplies

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a 41 year widow.  All of her children died.  She rents a one roomed house with four people in a slum.  There is no electricity or water in the home, but she cares for two orphans and is self reliant. 

She buys raw materials to make a drink and sells it at the Owino Market, one of the big markets in Kampala city.  Grace works seven days a week. 

Grace gets an average of nine customers per day and sells on retail basis. She has been running this business for six years and has been with MCDT and the same group mates for six years. 

This will be her thirteenth loan.  Grace’s major challenge is the rainy season when her customers sometimes stop coming to her for her drink because her place is covered with mud and water.  Thieves sometimes break into her business and steal her drink. Grace wants to buy land so she can construct a commercial house and earn money from tenants.

loans.use: Buy more raw materials like sorghum and millet for making her brew.

loans.name: Yum

texts.en:
Mrs. Yum S. (shown in the photo), 50 years old, and her husband, Mr. Borey Yang, 52 years old, were married in 1979 and have four children: two daughters and two sons. Two of them are married and live outside the family home and the other two are in school. The family lives in a small village on National Road Number Two about twenty kilometers south of Phnom Penh City. 

Yum has been raising pigs for almost four years, while her husband has been producing rice wine for almost four as well. She is asking for a loan of $400 to purchase food for her pigs.

loans.use: To purchase food for her pigs.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn B. is from the village of Talakag, Bukidnon. She is 29 years old. Evelyn is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Evelyn owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) store, selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Evelyn is just starting this business. (Evelyn's first business was managing a clothing store. She opted to have a sari-sari store during her 2nd loan.)

In 2009, Evelyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Evelyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. Evelyn is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase more products to sell. This will be her 2nd loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Kasfa,

texts.en:
Kasfa is 45 years of age and she is married with seven children. She rents a one-room house where she lives with her children. She also takes care of her grandchild.

Her greatest expenses in a month are feeding the family and paying rent for the house. Kasfa sells ripe bananas in the market. She receives about ten customers a day. She has operated this business for several years now. Her challenges are the price fluctuations for commodities which in turn force her to raise the prices of her bananas. 

Kasfa has been with MCDT for over three years and this is her 7th loan. She wants to use this loan to buy more bananas to sell, and she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more bananas to sell

loans.name: Jolita

texts.en:
Jolita C. is from the village of Masilakon I, Lugait Misamis Oriental. She is 49 years old. Jolita is married and has two adult-aged children. To make a living, Jolita continues to operate a business, making and selling food. Her main source of income for the business comes from selling snacks and other delicacies in the local community.

In 2009, Jolita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jolita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Jolita is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her 2nd loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of her family. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Marife

texts.en:
Marife R. is from the village of Talakag, Bukidnon. She is 48 years old. Marife is married and has six school-aged children. To make a living, Marife owns and operates a specialized retail store in the local community, selling different vegetables and spices for cooking. She has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately $130 a month from these activities.

In 2009, Marife joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. She is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to invest in the business. This will be her 2nd loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Vanna

texts.en:
Mrs. Vanna C. (shown in the photo), age 44, and her husband, Mr. Penh Uk, live in a small village across the Mekong River, about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 1995 and have one son who attends school. 

Vanna has been a silk weaver for fifteen years. She sells her finished products to a middleman in the village who then takes them to sell in the market in Phnom Penh. Her husband has been a carpenter for twenty years. Vanna is requesting a loan of $600 to purchase silk material for her weaving business, and she will use part of her loan to buy wooden materials for her husband’s carpentry business.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for weaving.

loans.name: Norah

texts.en:
Norah is a 42-year-old married woman with four children between the ages of 24 and 18. All her children go to school, the first two at the university and the other two in senior six and five. 

Norah owns and lives in a six-room house with six people, and she takes care of additional family members. The family has access to electricity and piped water and gets three meals a day. Norah incurs transportation costs to and from buying secondhand clothes from Owino market. She works in a semi-urban area on the outskirts of Kampala. 

She owns a shop in Ntinda Bukoto 11 Parish where she sells all types of secondhand clothes. She sells both retail and wholesale. Norah works seven days a week, receiving an average of thirty customers a day. Her major business challenges include the ever-increasing cost of secondhand clothes. Her monthly expenses include feeding the family and medication.  

Norah has been in this business for over eighteen years and with MCDT for ten years, now servicing her twenty-first loan and working with the same group mates. Norah joined MCDT because it was near her home and also because she likes working in groups. She wants to use this loan to buy more secondhand clothes to sell. She hopes to see her business grow bigger so that she can start selling on a wholesale basis only.

loans.use: To buy more bales of second hand clothes

loans.name: Isakbaeva Chynar`s Group

texts.en:
Chynar is the leader of this group. This will be her 2nd loan with the Kiva field partner, Mol Bulak Finance. Chynar is married and she has four children. The oldest is a university student and the other three children study at the local school. Her husband owns a minibus and provides passenger transportation services. Chynar wants to start up a new business, breeding poultry. Although she doesn't have much practice, she is going to learn about this business in the local agricultural training center. Right now she has three horses and three cows in calf. The new business will increase her family's income. 

Humorhon, 42, is married and has four sons. She has a little workshop at home where she sews bedspreads, dowry items and national clothing. Her husband and young son deal in animal breeding. They will use the loan to buy three calves. In the future Humorhon wants to expand her business,  build a bigger sewing workshop and create new jobs. 

Mamadal will use this loan to buy potato seeds and fertilizers. He has dealt in agriculture since 1994, raising vegetables, wheat and corn. Now he is getting prepared for the spring sowing. He owns 0.8 hectare of land, but he wants to rent one hectare more. His son helps him in this business. 

Zuura is 44 years old. Her husband raises vegetables and sells them in the local market. Zuura has four children and all of them are students. She is planning to sow potatoes this year. 

Their previous loan had a positive impact on all these clients.  

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of the 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: To buy poultry

loans.name: Saddam

texts.en:
Saddam S. is from the village of Talakag, Bukidnon. He is 18 years old and single. To make a living, Saddam owns and operates a specialized retail store selling ready-to-wear clothing for different classes of ladies and also a selection of men's wear in the local community. Saddam has been engaged in this business for over three years and earns approximately $110 a month from these activities.

In 2009, Saddam joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Saddam has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Saddam is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be his 2nd loan from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue to continue to improve his business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding his business

loans.name: Elizabeth Nassaka’S Group

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a 32-year-old married woman with three children, all of whom go to school. She owns and lives in a four-room house with four people where there is both electricity and water. She resides and works in a semi-urban area on the outskirts of Kampala. The family gets three meals a day. 

Elizabeth sells charcoal to all categories of people, both on a wholesale and a retail basis. She buys the charcoal from suppliers who bring it from the villages so she doesn’t incur any extra transport cost. She operates from her home and sells to an average of ten customers a day.

She has been in this business for the last five years. She first dealt in a restaurant business and then changed to charcoal selling. Elizabeth has been with MCDT for the last eight years and has successfully paid back fifteen loans with the same group mates. Her main challenge is the competition, and she is working toward her business growing bigger.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal

loans.name: Cherry

texts.en:
Cherry P. is from the village of Salimbal, Lugait Misamis Oriental. She is 44 years old, married, and has three grown children. Cherry makes and sells food for a living, selling snacks and other delicacies in the local community. 

In 2009, Cherry joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Cherry successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI.

Cherry is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Cherry from HSPFI. She plans to use any additional revenue generated from the business to supplement income of her family. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding a food and snack business.

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en:
Rosemary is 33 years old and is married with five children aged between 6 and 14. All her children go to school. She resides in and rents a two-roomed house where she lives with seven people. She doesn’t take care of additional family members. The family has access to electricity but no piped water.

Rosemary works in a semi-urban area which is in the outskirts of Kampala. She is a tailor on Lubaga Road and buys clothing materials from Owino market and so she pays for transport costs to and from shopping. She doesn’t pay rent for her business as she works from her home. Before starting her sewing/tailoring business she was dealing in locally made cold drinks.

Rosemary sells to all categories of people both retail and wholesale and works six days a week. She has been in her business for nine years and with MCDT for six years. She is servicing her thirteenth loan and working with the same group members.

Rosemary wants to use this loan to buy more clothing materials. She is aspiring to seeing her business grow bigger and owning fashion and design shop.

loans.use: To buy more clothing materials

loans.name: Chamroeurn

texts.en:
Mr. Chamroeurn S., 30, and his wife, Mrs. Savet Sorn, 30, (pictured together) live in a small village across the Mekong River about seventeen kilometers from Phnom Penh. They have been married since 2001 and have four children: three sons and one daughter.

Chamroeurn is a rice farmer and, besides farming, he also sells firewood. His wife sells Cambodian noodles in the village.

Chamroeurn is requesting his first loan of US$600 to buy a motorized hand-tiller to use on his rice farm.

loans.use: To buy a motorized hand-tiller to use on his rice farm

loans.name: Doreen

texts.en:
Doreen is a mother of two and the head of her family. For three years now she has operated a business in which she sells shoes in Fort Portal Uganda. She started out operating her business while working in her boss’s shop. She now sells the shoes outside the shop.

Doreen is taking her business step by step as it comes with growth in her customer numbers. She took a loan facility to enable her to purchase shoes to sell.

Doreen aims to construct a house for her family to shift from renting.

loans.use: To purchase shoes to sell

loans.name: Jackielyn

texts.en: Jackielyn A. is from the village of Talakag, Bukidnon. She is 39 years old, is married, and has seven school-aged children. Jackielyn owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Jackielyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Jackielyn is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will again be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her 2nd from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Resty

texts.en:
Resty is the 50-year-old single mother of four children aged between 19 and 26 years. All her children go to school. She also takes care of additional family members. She resides in and rents a two-roomed house where she lives with six people. The family has access to electricity but no piped water.

Resty works in a semi-urban area which in the outskirts of Kampala. She sells secondhand clothes in Najjanankumbi Stella Zone and buys these clothes from Owino market, one of the busiest markets in Uganda. She incurs extra transport costs to and from shopping. She sells to all categories of people both retail and wholesale.

Resty has been in this business for ten years and with MCDT for eight years. She is servicing her thirteenth loan, working with the same group members. She wants to use this loan to buy more bales of secondhand clothes.

Resty is aspiring to seeing her business grow bigger and to start importing directly from the U.K.

loans.use: To buy more bales of secondhand clothes

loans.name: Ajdar

texts.en: Ajdar bought fertilizer and seedlings with his previous loan. Now he needs a second loan of $2000 AZN to buy more fertilizer and seedlings in order to improve his business.  Thank you for the loan.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seedlings.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty is a 46 year married with four children ages 13 and 22 years.  All her school go to school.  She resides in and owns a five roomed house where she stays with seven people.  She has access to electricity but no piped water.  

She owns a retail shop selling day to day essentials.  On average Betty receives 20 customers a day.  She has been in this business for six years and with MCDT for ten years servicing her eighteenth loan. 

Her monthly expenses include school fees and medication.  Her challenges include customer defaulters and the rainy season because many customers stay away.  Betty wants to use this loan to buy more merchandise like soap, salt sacks, sugar and cans of cooking oil.

loans.use: Buy more merchandise like sugar ,salt, soap  for her retail shop.

loans.name: Irenia

texts.en:
Irenia Arnaiz is requesting for a loan through ASHI for the second time yet first time through Kiva.  This loan will be used to purchase another hog for fattening.  She wanted to sell her hogs after four months to make more profit.  

She also wanted to invest some portion of her loan in a rice production business managed by her husband, with the help of her eldest son.  Irenia also plans to raise chicken in their backyard. Her livestock will be sold to people within their village either alive or slaughtered.  Her rice will be sold in volume to the vendors.  

Proceeds of these businesses will be used to support the needs of her family, especially to improve their way of living.  Aside from her desire to support her children, Irenia wants to support the needs of her grandchildren by making her business profitable.

loans.use: Purchase hog/pig and necessary farm inputs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional  chicks and feed.

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna S. is from the village of Talakag , bukidnon.  She is 49 years old, married and has 5 adult-aged children. To make a living, Lorna owns a sari-sari (variety) retail shop.  Lorna has been in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month..

In 2009, Lorna joined HSPFI to access to financial services to improve her living situation and to engage in business activities. Lorna has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI to purchase additional products to sell.  Lorna is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP to expand her business.  This loan will be the 2nd from HSPFI.  She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to expand her business. 
---------------------------------
About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

loans.use: Invest in expanding the business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy tools and renovate garage

loans.name: Deonata

texts.en:
Deonata A. is a loving and compassionate person.  Despite being single and having no child, she expresses her love, care and kindness to her niece and nephew.  She also supports their education and treats them as her own children. 

To sustain their education until they graduate from college, Deonata is requesting a loan to grow her small “sari-sari” (variety) store, so that its profits will grow as well.  Deonata also wishes to satisfy her customers by offering a wide variety of goods for their convenience.

loans.use: Purcahse variety of goods to sell in her store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase additional commodities for her business.

loans.name: Amerlita

texts.en:
Amerlita P. is from the village of Prk. A Bonifacio,Lugait Misamis Oriental.  She is 55 years old, married and has 3 grown children.  Amerlita owns & operates a specialized retail business, selling a variety of goods in the local community.  Amerlita earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Amerlita joined HSPFI to access financial services to improve her living situation and ability to engage in business. Amerlita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI and now requests 8,000 PHP to purchase new items to expand her product offerings. 

This loan will be the 2nd from HSPFI.  She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her business. 
----------------------------------------
About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

loans.use: Purchase new items to expand product offering.

location.town: Prk. A, Bonifacio, Lugait, Misamis Oriental
